analyzed: uṣāḥ vai aśvasya medhyasya śiraḥ
translated: The dawn is the head of the sacrificial horse.

original: sūryaś cakṣur vātaḥ prāṇo vyāttam agnir vaiśvānaraḥ saṃvatsara ātmāśvasya medhyasya /🔽dyauḥ pṛṣṭham antarikṣam udaraṃ pṛthivī pājasyaṃ diśaḥ pārśve avāntaradiśaḥ parśava
analyzed: sūryaḥ cakṣuḥ vātaḥ prāṇaḥ vyāttam agniḥ vaiśvānaraḥ saṃvatsaraḥ ātmā aśvasya medhyasya  dyauḥ pṛṣṭham antarikṣam udaram pṛthivī pājasyam diśaḥ pārśve avāntaradiśaḥ parśavaḥ
translated: The sun is its eye, the wind its breath, the open space is its mouth, the all-pervading fire is its body, the year is the soul of the sacrificial horse.🔽The sky is its back, the atmosphere its belly, the earth its chest, the quarters its sides, the intermediate quarters its ribs.

original: ṛtavo 'ṅgāni māsāś cārdhamāsāś ca parvāṇy ahorātrāṇi pratiṣṭhā nakṣatrāṇy asthīni nabho māṃsāni /
analyzed: ṛtavaḥ ṅgāni māsāḥ ca ardha māsāḥ ca parvāṇi ahar rātrāṇi pratiṣṭhāḥ nakṣatrāṇi asthīni nabhaḥ māṃsāni
translated: The seasons are its limbs, the months and half-months its joints, the days and nights its foundations, the stars its bones, the firmament its flesh.

original: ūvadhyaṃ sikatāḥ sindhavo gudā yakṛc ca klomānaś ca parvatā oṣadhayaś ca vanaspatayaś ca lomāni /
analyzed: ūvadhyam sikatāḥ sindhavaḥ gudāḥ yakṛt ca klomānaḥ ca parvatāḥ oṣadhayaḥ ca vanaspatayaḥ ca lomāni
translated: The sand is its entrails, the rivers its bowels, the mountains its liver and lungs, the plants and trees its hair.

analyzed: udyan pūrva ardhaḥ nimlocam jaghana ardhaḥ
translated: The rising sun is its forepart, the setting sun its hindpart.

original: yad vijṛmbhate tad vidyotate /🔽yad vidhūnute tat stanayati /
analyzed: yat vijṛmbhate tat vidyotate  yat vidhūnute tat stanayati
translated: When it yawns, it thunders.

analyzed: yat mehati tat varṣati
translated: When it shakes itself, it lightens.🔽When it urinates, it rains.

analyzed: vāc eva asya vāc
translated: Its speech is its speech.

analyzed: ahar vai aśvam purastāt mahimā anvajāyata
translated: The day was born before the horse as its greatness.

analyzed: tasya pūrve samudre yoniḥ
translated: Its birthplace is the eastern ocean.

analyzed: rātriḥ enam paścāt mahimā anvajāyata
translated: The night was born after it as its greatness.

analyzed: tasya apare samudre yoniḥ
translated: Its birthplace is the western ocean.

original: etau vā aśvaṃ mahimānāv abhitaḥ sambabhūvatuḥ /
analyzed: etau vai aśvam mahimānau abhitas sambabhūvatuḥ
translated: These two, the great ones, have come together on both sides of the horse.

original: hayo bhūtvā devān avahad vājī gandharvān arvāsurān aśvo manuṣyān /
analyzed: hayaḥ bhūtvā devān avahat vājī gandharvān arvā asurān aśvaḥ manuṣyān
translated: Having become a horse, he carried the gods, as a stallion the Gandharvas, as a donkey the Asuras, as a horse men.

analyzed: samudraḥ eva asya bandhuḥ samudraḥ yoniḥ
translated: The ocean is indeed his kinsman, the ocean his birthplace.

analyzed: na eva iha kim cana agre āsīt
translated: In the beginning this was indeed nothing at all.

analyzed: mṛtyunā eva idam āvṛtam āsīt aśanāyayā
translated: This was covered by death, by hunger.

analyzed: aśanāyā hi mṛtyuḥ
translated: For hunger is indeed death.

analyzed: tat manaḥ kuruta ātmanvī syām iti
translated: It made the mind, thinking, Let me be self-existent.

analyzed: saḥ rcan acarat
translated: It moved about shining.

analyzed: tasya arcataḥ āpaḥ jāyanta
translated: From its shining, the waters were born.

original: arcate vai me kam abhūd iti /
analyzed: arcate vai me kam abhūt iti
translated: It has become food for me who am shining, (he thought).

analyzed: tat eva arkyasya arka tvam
translated: That is the shining of the Arka.

original: kaṃ ha vā asmai bhavati ya evam etad arkyasyārkatvaṃ veda // / / //
analyzed: kam ha vai asmai bhavati yaḥ evam etat arkyasya arka tvam veda
translated: Verily, he who knows thus the shining of the Arka becomes food for him.

analyzed: āpaḥ vai arkaḥ
translated: The Arka is indeed the waters.

original: tad yad apāṃ śara āsīt tat samahanyata /
analyzed: tat yat apām śaraḥ āsīt tat samahanyata
translated: That essence of the waters which was, it was heated.

analyzed: sā pṛthivī abhavat
translated: That became the earth.

analyzed: tasyām aśrāmyat
translated: It rested on that.

analyzed: tasya śrāntasya taptasya tejaḥ rasaḥ niravartata agniḥ
translated: From its resting, its heating, its essence, fire was separated.

original: sa tredhātmānaṃ vyakurutādityaṃ tṛtīyaṃ vāyuṃ tṛtīyam /
analyzed: sa tredhā ātmānam vyakuruta ādityam tṛtīyam vāyum tṛtīyam
translated: It divided itself into three: the sun as one third, the wind as one third.

analyzed: saḥ eṣa prāṇaḥ tredhā vihitaḥ
translated: This breath is threefold.

original: tasya prācī dik śiro 'sau cāsau cermau /
analyzed: tasya prācī diś śiraḥ sau ca asau ca irmau
translated: The eastern direction is its head, and these two (the southern and northern directions) are its two arms.

original: athāsya pratīcī dik puccham asau cāsau ca sakthyau /🔽dakṣiṇā codīcī ca pārśve /
analyzed: atha asya pratīcī diś puccham asau ca asau ca sakthyau  dakṣiṇā ca udīcī ca pārśve
translated: Now, the western direction is its tail, and these two (the northern and southern directions) are its two thighs.🔽The southern and northern (directions) are its two sides.

original: dyauḥ pṛṣṭham antarikṣam udaram iyam uraḥ /
analyzed: dyauḥ pṛṣṭham antarikṣam udaram iyam uraḥ
translated: The sky is its back, the atmosphere its belly, and this (earth) its chest.

analyzed: saḥ eṣā u psu pratiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: This (universe) is established in the waters.

original: yatra kva caiti tad eva pratitiṣṭhaty evaṃ vidvān // / / //
analyzed: yatra kva ca eti tat eva pratitiṣṭhati evam vidvān
translated: Wherever it goes, there it finds support. One who knows thus...

analyzed: saḥ kāmayata dvitīyaḥ me ātmā jāyeta iti
translated: He desired, 'Let a second self of mine be born.'

original: sa manasā vācaṃ mithunaṃ samabhavad aśanāyā mṛtyuḥ /
analyzed: sa manasā vācam mithunam samabhavat aśanāyāḥ mṛtyuḥ
translated: He united mind with speech, food with death.

original: tad yad reta āsīt sa saṃvatsaro 'bhavat /
analyzed: tat yat retaḥ āsīt sa saṃvatsaraḥ bhavat
translated: What semen there was, that became the year.

original: na ha purā tataḥ saṃvatsara āsa /🔽tam etāvantaṃ kālam abibhar yāvānt saṃvatsaraḥ /
analyzed: na ha purā tatas saṃvatsaraḥ āsa  tam etāvantam kālam abibhar yāvān saṃvatsaraḥ
translated: Before that, there was no year.🔽He supported it for as long as the year.

analyzed: tam etāvataḥ kālasya parastāt asṛjata
translated: After that length of time, he created it.

analyzed: tam jātam abhivyādadāt
translated: When it was born, he opened its mouth.

analyzed: sa bhāṇ akarot
translated: It made a sound.

analyzed: sā eva vāc abhavat
translated: That became speech.

original: sa aikṣata yadi vā imam abhimaṃsye kanīyo 'nnaṃ kariṣya iti /
analyzed: sa aikṣata yadi vai imam abhimaṃsye kanīyaḥ nnam kariṣye iti
translated: He considered, 'If I think of it, I will make food less.'

original: sa tayā vācā tenātmanedaṃ sarvam asṛjata yad idaṃ kiñca ṛco yajūṃṣi sāmāni chandāṃsi yajñān prajāṃ paśūn /
analyzed: sa tayā vācā tena ātmanā idam sarvam asṛjata yat idam kiñca ṛcaḥ yajūṃṣi sāmāni chandāṃsi yajñān prajām paśūn
translated: By that speech, by that self, he created all this whatever exists, the Ṛc verses, the Yajuṣ formulas, the Sāman chants, the metres, the sacrifices, offspring, and cattle.

original: sa yadyad evāsṛjata tattad attum adhriyata /
analyzed: sa yat yat eva asṛjata tat tat attum adhriyata
translated: Whatever he created, he created for his own food.

original: sarvaṃ vā attīti tad aditer adititvam /
analyzed: sarvam vai atti iti tat aditeḥ aditi tvam
translated: He eats everything, therefore it is Aditi's Aditihood.

original: sarvasyāttā bhavati sarvam asyānnaṃ bhavati ya evam etad aditer adititvaṃ veda // / / //
analyzed: sarvasya attā bhavati sarvam asya annam bhavati yaḥ evam etat aditeḥ aditi tvam veda
translated: He becomes the eater of everything, everything becomes his food, who knows this Aditihood of Aditi.

analyzed: sā u kāmayata bhūyasā yajñena bhūyaḥ yajeya iti
translated: He desired, 'By a greater sacrifice I shall worship more.'

analyzed: saḥ śrāmyat  sa tapaḥ tapyata
translated: He toiled.🔽He practised austerity.

original: tasya śrāntasya taptasya yaśo vīryam udakrāmat /
analyzed: tasya śrāntasya taptasya yaśaḥ vīryam udakrāmat
translated: His glory and strength went out from him, while he was toiling and practising austerity.

analyzed: prāṇāḥ vai yaśaḥ vīryam
translated: The vital breaths are glory and strength.

analyzed: tat prāṇeṣu utkrānteṣu śarīram śvayitum adhriyata
translated: When the vital breaths had gone out, his body was about to swell.

analyzed: tasya śarīre eva manaḥ āsīt
translated: His mind was in his body alone.

original: so 'kāmayata medhyaṃ ma idaṃ syād ātmanvy anena syām iti /
analyzed: sā kāmayata medhyam me idam syāt ātmanvī anena syām iti
translated: He desired, 'May this be sacred to me, may I be possessed of a self by it.'

analyzed: tatas u śvas samabhavat
translated: From that the horse came into being.

original: yad aśvat tan medhyam abhūd iti tad evāśvamedhasyāśvamedhatvam /
analyzed: yat aśvat tat medhyam abhūt iti tat eva aśvamedhasya aśvamedha tvam
translated: In that it was a horse, it became sacred to him. That is why the horse sacrifice is called aśvamedha (horse-sacrifice).

original: eṣa ha vā aśvamedhaṃ veda ya enam evaṃ veda /
analyzed: eṣa ha vai aśvamedham veda yaḥ enam evam veda
translated: He who knows this horse in this way, verily, knows the horse sacrifice.

analyzed: tam an avarudhya eva amanyata
translated: He considered him as not to be obstructed.

analyzed: tam saṃvatsarasya parastāt ātmanaḥ ālabhata
translated: He offered him to himself beyond the year.

analyzed: paśūn devatābhyaḥ pratyauhat
translated: He restored the animals to the gods.

analyzed: tasmāt sarva devatyam prokṣitam prājāpatyam ālabhante
translated: Therefore they offer the consecrated animal to Prajapati, which is sacred to all the gods.

original: eṣa vā aśvamedho ya eṣa tapati /
analyzed: eṣa vai aśvamedhaḥ yaḥ eṣa tapati
translated: This one who shines is indeed the horse sacrifice.

analyzed: tasya saṃvatsaraḥ ātmā
translated: Its body is the year.

analyzed: ayam agniḥ arkaḥ
translated: This fire is the sun.

analyzed: tasya ime lokāḥ ātmānaḥ
translated: Its bodies are these worlds.

analyzed: tau etau arka aśvamedhau
translated: Those two are the sun and the horse sacrifice.

original: so punar ekaiva devatā bhavati mṛtyur eva /🔽apa punarmṛtyuṃ jayati /
analyzed: sā u punar ekā eva devatā bhavati mṛtyuḥ eva  apa punarmṛtyum jayati
translated: But it becomes one deity again, namely death.🔽He conquers death again and again.

analyzed: na enam mṛtyuḥ āpnoti
translated: Death does not overtake him.

analyzed: mṛtyuḥ asya ātmā bhavati
translated: Death becomes his self.

analyzed: sarvam āyuḥ eti
translated: He attains the whole life.

analyzed: etāsām devatānām ekaḥ bhavati
translated: He becomes one of those deities.

original: dvayā ha prājāpatyā devāś cāsurāś ca tataḥ kānīyasā eva devā jyāyasā asurāḥ /
analyzed: dvayāḥ ha prājāpatyāḥ devāḥ ca asurāḥ ca tatas kānīyasāḥ eva devāḥ jyāyasāḥ asurāḥ
translated: The gods and the asuras were indeed the two offspring of Prajapati. Then the gods were fewer and the asuras were more.

analyzed: te eṣu lokeṣu aspardhanta
translated: They contended for these worlds.

original: te ha devā ūcur hantāsurān yajña udgīthenātyayāmeti // / / //
analyzed: te ha devāḥ ūcuḥ hanta asurān yajñe udgīthena atyayāma iti
translated: The gods said, 'Let us kill the asuras with the Udgitha in the sacrifice.'

original: te ha vācam ūcus tvaṃ na udgāyeti /
analyzed: te ha vācam ūcuḥ tvam naḥ udgāya iti
translated: They said to speech, 'Sing for us.'

analyzed: tathā iti tebhyaḥ vāc udagāyat
translated: 'So be it,' said she, and she sang for them.

original: yo vāci bhogas taṃ devebhya āgāyat /
analyzed: yaḥ vāci bhogaḥ tam devebhyaḥ āgāyat
translated: Whatever enjoyment there is in speech, that he sang to the gods.

analyzed: yat kalyāṇam vadati tat ātmane
translated: Whatever good he speaks, that is for himself.

analyzed: te viduḥ anena vai naḥ udgātrā atyeṣyanti iti
translated: They knew: 'Surely, by this Udgātṛ they will overpass us.'

analyzed: tam abhidrutya pāpmanā avidhyan
translated: They rushed upon him and pierced him with evil.

original: sa yaḥ sa pāpmā yad evedam apratirūpaṃ vadati /
analyzed: sa yaḥ sa pāpmā yat eva idam apratirūpam vadati
translated: That which is this evil, namely, that one speaks what is improper,

original: sa eva sa pāpmā // / / //🔽atha ha prāṇam ūcus tvaṃ na udgāyeti /
analyzed: saḥ eva sa pāpmā  atha ha prāṇam ūcuḥ tvam naḥ udgāya iti
translated: that is that evil.🔽Then they said to Prana: 'Sing to us.'

analyzed: tathā iti tebhyaḥ prāṇaḥ udagāyat
translated: 'So be it,' said he, and sang to them.

original: yaḥ prāṇe bhogas taṃ devebhya āgāyat /
analyzed: yaḥ prāṇe bhogaḥ tam devebhyaḥ āgāyat
translated: Whatever enjoyment there is in Prana, that he sang to the gods.

analyzed: yat kalyāṇam jighrati tat ātmane
translated: Whatever good he smells, that is for himself.

analyzed: te viduḥ anena vai naḥ udgātrā atyeṣyanti iti
translated: They knew: 'Surely, by this Udgātṛ they will overpass us.'

analyzed: tam abhidrutya pāpmanā avidhyan
translated: They rushed upon him and pierced him with evil.

original: sa yaḥ sa pāpmā yad evedam apratirūpaṃ jighrati /
analyzed: sa yaḥ sa pāpmā yat eva idam apratirūpam jighrati
translated: That which is this evil, namely, that one smells what is improper,

original: sa eva sa pāpmā // / / //🔽atha ha cakṣur ūcus tvaṃ na udgāyeti /
analyzed: saḥ eva sa pāpmā  atha ha cakṣuḥ ūcuḥ tvam naḥ udgāya iti
translated: that is that evil.🔽Then they said to the eye: 'Sing to us.'

analyzed: tathā iti tebhyaḥ cakṣuḥ udagāyat
translated: 'So be it,' said it, and sang to them.

original: yaś cakṣuṣi bhogas taṃ devebhya āgāyat /
analyzed: yaḥ cakṣuṣi bhogaḥ tam devebhyaḥ āgāyat
translated: Whatever enjoyment there is in the eye, that he sang to the gods.

analyzed: yat kalyāṇam paśyati tat ātmane
translated: Whatever good one sees, that is for oneself.

analyzed: te viduḥ anena vai naḥ udgātrā atyeṣyanti iti
translated: They knew: 'Surely, by this Udgātṛ they will overpass us.'

original: tam abhidrutya pāpmanāvidhyan /🔽sa yaḥ sa pāpmā yad evedam apratirūpaṃ paśyati /
analyzed: tam abhidrutya pāpmanā avidhyan  sa yaḥ sa pāpmā yat eva idam apratirūpam paśyati
translated: They rushed at him and pierced him with evil.🔽That which is evil, that is the evil which one sees here that is not proper.

analyzed: saḥ eva sa pāpmā
translated: That is the evil.

original: atha ha śrotram ūcus tvaṃ na udgāyeti /
analyzed: atha ha śrotram ūcuḥ tvam naḥ udgāya iti
translated: Then indeed speech said to the ear, 'You chant for us.'

analyzed: tathā iti tebhyaḥ śrotram udagāyat
translated: 'So be it,' said the ear and chanted for them.

original: yaḥ śrotre bhogas taṃ devebhya āgāyat /
analyzed: yaḥ śrotre bhogaḥ tam devebhyaḥ āgāyat
translated: Whatever enjoyment there is in the ear, that it chanted for the gods.

analyzed: yat kalyāṇam śṛṇoti tat ātmane
translated: Whatever good one hears, that is for one's own self.

analyzed: te viduḥ anena vai naḥ udgātrā atyeṣyanti iti
translated: They knew, 'By this Udgātṛ indeed they will pass over us.'

analyzed: tam abhidrutya pāpmanā avidhyan
translated: They rushed at him and pierced him with evil.

analyzed: sa yaḥ sa pāpmā
translated: That which is evil,

analyzed: yat eva idam apratirūpam śṛṇoti
translated: that is the evil which one hears here that is not proper.

original: sa eva sa pāpmā // / / //🔽atha ha mana ūcus tvaṃ na udgāyeti /
analyzed: saḥ eva sa pāpmā  atha ha manaḥ ūcuḥ tvam naḥ udgāya iti
translated: That is the evil.🔽Then indeed the mind said to the ear, 'You chant for us.'

analyzed: tathā iti tebhyaḥ manaḥ udagāyat
translated: 'So be it,' said the ear and chanted for them.

original: yo manasi bhogas taṃ devebhya āgāyat /
analyzed: yaḥ manasi bhogaḥ tam devebhyaḥ āgāyat
translated: Whatever enjoyment there is in the mind, that it chanted for the gods.

analyzed: yat kalyāṇam saṃkalpayati tat ātmane
translated: Whatever good one resolves, that is for one's own self.

analyzed: te viduḥ anena vai naḥ udgātrā atyeṣyanti iti
translated: They knew, 'By this Udgātṛ indeed they will pass over us.'

analyzed: tam abhidrutya pāpmanā avidhyan
translated: They rushed at him and pierced him with evil.

analyzed: sa yaḥ sa pāpmā
translated: That which is evil,

analyzed: yat eva idam apratirūpam saṃkalpayati
translated: that is the evil which one resolves here that is not proper.

analyzed: saḥ eva sa pāpmā
translated: That is the evil.

original: evam u khalv etā devatāḥ pāpmabhir upāsṛjan /
analyzed: evam u khalu etāḥ devatāḥ pāpmabhiḥ upāsṛjan
translated: In this way, indeed, these deities were connected with evil.

analyzed: evam enāḥ pāpmanā avidhyan
translated: In this way, indeed, they were pierced by evil.

original: atha hemam āsanyaṃ prāṇam ūcus tvaṃ na udgāyeti /
analyzed: atha ha imam āsanyam prāṇam ūcuḥ tvam naḥ udgāya iti
translated: Then they said to the breath in the mouth, 'Sing for us.'

analyzed: tathā iti tebhyaḥ eṣa prāṇaḥ udagāyat
translated: 'So be it,' said he, and sang for them.

analyzed: te viduḥ anena vai naḥ udgātrā atyeṣyanti iti
translated: They knew, 'By this Udgātṛ, indeed, we shall pass beyond.'

analyzed: tam abhidrutya pāpmanā avivyatsan
translated: They rushed upon him and pierced him with evil.

original: sa yathāśmānam ṛtvā loṣṭo vidhvaṃsetaivaṃ haiva vidhvaṃsamānā viṣvañco vineśuḥ /
analyzed: sa yathā aśmānam ṛtvā loṣṭaḥ vidhvaṃseta evam ha eva vidhvaṃsamānāḥ viṣvañcaḥ vineśuḥ
translated: Just as a clod thrown against a rock would be shattered, so were they shattered and scattered in all directions.

analyzed: tatas devāḥ abhavan parā asurā
translated: Then the gods became prosperous, the demons were defeated.

analyzed: bhavati ātmanā
translated: One becomes prosperous himself.

original: parāsya dviṣan bhrātṛvyo bhavati ya evaṃ veda // / / //
analyzed: parā asya dviṣan bhrātṛvyaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: One's hateful enemy is defeated who knows thus.

original: te hocuḥ kva nu so 'bhūd yo na ittham asakteti /
analyzed: te ha ūcuḥ kva nu saḥ bhūt yaḥ naḥ ittham asaktā iti
translated: They said, 'Where, indeed, was he who thus stuck to us?'

analyzed: ayam āsye ntar iti
translated: 'He is here within the mouth.'

analyzed: saḥ yā asya āṅgirasaḥ u ṅgānām hi rasaḥ
translated: He is the one in the mouth, the son of Aṅgiras, for he is the essence of the limbs.

original: sā vā eṣā devatā dūr nāma /🔽dūraṃ hy asyā mṛtyur /
analyzed: sā vai eṣā devatā dūḥ nāma  dūram hi asyāḥ mṛtyuḥ
translated: Now that deity is called Dūr (distant),🔽for death is far away from him.

original: dūraṃ ha vā asmān mṛtyur bhavati ya evaṃ veda // / / //
analyzed: dūram ha vai asmāt mṛtyuḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: Death is indeed far away from him who knows this.

original: sā vā eṣā devataitāsāṃ devatānāṃ pāpmānaṃ mṛtyum apahatya yatrāsāṃ diśām antas tad gamayāṃ cakāra /
analyzed: sā vai eṣā devatā etāsām devatānām pāpmānam mṛtyum apahatya yatra āsām diśām antaḥ tat gamayāṃ cakāra
translated: That deity, having removed the evil, death, of these deities, made it go to the end of these quarters.

analyzed: tat āsām pāpmanaḥ vinyadadhāt
translated: There it placed the evil of these (quarters).

original: tasmān na janam iyān nāntam iyān net pāpmānaṃ mṛtyum anvavāyānīti // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt na janam iyāt na antam iyāt na id pāpmānam mṛtyum anvavāyāni iti
translated: Therefore one should not go to a people, should not go to an end, lest one should follow the evil, death.

original: sā vā eṣā devataitāsāṃ devatānāṃ pāpmānaṃ mṛtyum apahatyāthainā mṛtyum atyavahat // / / //
analyzed: sā vai eṣā devatā etāsām devatānām pāpmānam mṛtyum apahatya atha enāḥ mṛtyum atyavahat
translated: That deity, having removed the evil, death, of these deities, then carried them beyond death.

original: sā vai vācam eva prathamām atyavahat /🔽sā yadā mṛtyum atyamucyata so 'gnir abhavat /
analyzed: sā vai vācam eva prathamām atyavahat  sā yadā mṛtyum atyamucyata saḥ agniḥ abhavat
translated: It carried speech first of all.🔽When it was freed from death, it became fire.

original: so 'yam agniḥ pareṇa mṛtyum atikrānto dīpyate // / / //
analyzed: saḥ yam agniḥ pareṇa mṛtyum atikrāntaḥ dīpyate
translated: This fire shines beyond death, having overcome it.

original: atha prāṇam atyavahat /🔽sa yadā mṛtyum atyamucyata sa vāyur abhavat /
analyzed: atha prāṇam atyavahat  sa yadā mṛtyum atyamucyata sa vāyuḥ abhavat
translated: Then it carried the breath.🔽When it was freed from death, it became the wind.

original: so 'yaṃ vāyuḥ pareṇa mṛtyum atikrāntaḥ pavate // / / //
analyzed: saḥ yam vāyuḥ pareṇa mṛtyum atikrāntaḥ pavate
translated: This wind blows beyond death, having overcome it.

original: atha cakṣur atyavahat /🔽tad yadā mṛtyum atyamucyata sa ādityo 'bhavat /
analyzed: atha cakṣuḥ atyavahat  tat yadā mṛtyum atyamucyata saḥ ādityaḥ bhavat
translated: Then it carried the eye.🔽When it was freed from death, it became the sun.

original: so 'sāv ādityaḥ pareṇa mṛtyum atikrāntas tapati // / / //
analyzed: saḥ saḥ ādityaḥ pareṇa mṛtyum atikrāntaḥ tapati
translated: This sun shines beyond death, having overcome it.

analyzed: atha śrotram atyavahat
translated: Then it carried the ear.

original: tad yadā mṛtyum atyamucyata tā diśo 'bhavan /
analyzed: tat yadā mṛtyum atyamucyata tāḥ diśaḥ bhavan
translated: When it had passed beyond death, those became the quarters.

original: tā imā diśaḥ pareṇa mṛtyum atikrāntāḥ // / / //
analyzed: tāḥ imāḥ diśaḥ pareṇa mṛtyum atikrāntāḥ
translated: These are the quarters which have passed beyond death on the other side.

original: atha mano 'tyavahat /🔽tad yadā mṛtyum atyamucyata sa candramā abhavat /
analyzed: atha manaḥ tyavahat  tat yadā mṛtyum atyamucyata sa candramāḥ abhavat
translated: Then it drew up the mind.🔽When it had passed beyond death, that became the moon.

original: so 'sau candraḥ pareṇa mṛtyum atikrānto bhāti /
analyzed: saḥ sau candraḥ pareṇa mṛtyum atikrāntaḥ bhāti
translated: That moon shines on the other side of death.

original: evaṃ ha vā enam eṣā devatā mṛtyum ativahati ya evaṃ veda // / / //
analyzed: evam ha vai enam eṣā devatā mṛtyum ativahati yaḥ evam veda
translated: In this way, verily, that divinity carries him beyond death who knows thus.

analyzed: atha ātmane nnādyam āgāyat
translated: Then it sang the food for itself.

original: yad dhi kiñcānnam adyate 'nenaiva tad adyate /
analyzed: yat hi kiñca annam adyate nena eva tat adyate
translated: For whatever food is eaten is eaten by it.

analyzed: iha pratitiṣṭhati
translated: It stands firm here.

analyzed: te devāḥ abruvan
translated: The gods said:

original: etāvad vā idaṃ sarvaṃ yad annam /
analyzed: etāvat vai idam sarvam yat annam
translated: This is all that there is, namely food.

original: tad ātmana āgāsīḥ /🔽anu no 'sminn anna ābhajasveti /
analyzed: tat ātmane āgāsīḥ  anu naḥ smin anne ābhajasva iti
translated: You have made it yours.🔽Share it with us here.

analyzed: te vai mā abhisaṃviśata iti
translated: Let us enter into you.

analyzed: tathā iti tam samantam pariṇyaviśanta
translated: So be it. They entered into it on all sides.

original: tasmād yad anenānnam atti tenaitās tṛpyanti /
analyzed: tasmāt yat anena annam atti tena etāḥ tṛpyanti
translated: Therefore, when he eats food with it, they are satisfied with it.

original: evaṃ ha vā enaṃ svā abhisaṃviśanti bhartā svānāṃ śreṣṭhaḥ puraetā bhavaty annādo 'dhipatir ya evaṃ veda /
analyzed: evam ha vai enam svāḥ abhisaṃviśanti bhartā svānām śreṣṭhaḥ puraetā bhavati anna ādaḥ dhipatiḥ yaḥ evam veda
translated: In this way, verily, his own people enter into him. He becomes the supporter of his own people, the best, the leader, the eater of food, the lord, who knows thus.

original: ya u haivaṃvidaṃ sveṣu pratir bubhūṣati na haivālaṃ bhāryebhyo bhavati /
analyzed: yaḥ u ha evaṃvidam sveṣu pratiḥ bubhūṣati na ha eva alam bhāryebhyaḥ bhavati
translated: He who, knowing this, desires to be the lord of his own people, is not overwhelmed by his wives.

original: atha ya evaitam anubhavati yo vaitam anu bhāryān bubhūrṣati sa haivālaṃ bhāryebhyo bhavati // / / //
analyzed: atha yaḥ eva etam anubhavati yaḥ vā etam anu bhāryān bubhūrṣati sa ha eva alam bhāryebhyaḥ bhavati
translated: But he who follows this, who desires to be the lord of his wives following this, is not overwhelmed by his wives.

original: so 'yāsya āṅgiraso 'ṅgānāṃ hi rasaḥ /🔽prāṇo vā aṅgānāṃ rasaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ yā asya āṅgirasaḥ u ṅgānām hi rasaḥ  prāṇaḥ vai aṅgānām rasaḥ
translated: He is the Āyāsy Āṅgirasa, for he is the essence of the limbs.🔽The breath is the essence of the limbs.

analyzed: prāṇaḥ hi vai aṅgānām rasaḥ
translated: For the breath is indeed the essence of the limbs.

original: tasmād yasmāt kasmāccāṅgāt prāṇa utkrāmati tad eva tac chuṣyati /
analyzed: tasmāt yasmāt kasmāt ca aṅgāt prāṇaḥ utkrāmati tat eva tat śuṣyati
translated: Therefore, from whatever limb the breath departs, that very limb dries up.

analyzed: eṣa hi vai aṅgānām rasaḥ
translated: For this is indeed the essence of the limbs.

analyzed: eṣaḥ u eva bṛhaspatiḥ
translated: He is indeed Brihaspati.

analyzed: vāc vai bṛhatī
translated: Speech is indeed the great one.

original: tasyā eṣa patis tasmād u bṛhaspatiḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasyāḥ eṣa patiḥ tasmāt u bṛhaspatiḥ
translated: He is the lord of that, therefore he is Brihaspati.

analyzed: eṣaḥ u eva brahmaṇaspatiḥ
translated: He is indeed Brahmanaspati.

analyzed: vāc vai brahma
translated: Speech is indeed Brahman.

original: tasyā eṣa patis tasmād u brahmaṇaspatiḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasyāḥ eṣa patiḥ tasmāt u brahmaṇaspatiḥ
translated: He is the lord of that, therefore he is Brahmanaspati.

analyzed: eṣaḥ u eva sāma
translated: He is indeed the Sāman.

original: vāg vai sāmaiṣa sā cāmaś ceti tat sāmnaḥ sāmatvam /
analyzed: vāc vai sāma eṣa sā ca amaḥ ca iti tat sāmnaḥ sāma tvam
translated: Speech is indeed the Sāman. He is that and the Sāman. That is the Sāman-ness of the Sāman.

original: yad v eva samaḥ pluṣiṇā samo maśakena samo nāgena sama ebhis tribhir lokaiḥ samo 'nena sarveṇa tasmād v eva sāma /
analyzed: yat u eva samaḥ pluṣiṇā samaḥ maśakena samaḥ nāgena samaḥ ebhiḥ tribhiḥ lokaiḥ samaḥ nena sarveṇa tasmāt u eva sāma
translated: And because it is equal to a louse, equal to a mosquito, equal to an elephant, equal to these three worlds, equal to all this, therefore it is Sāman.

analyzed: aśnute sāmnaḥ sāyujyam salokatām
translated: One attains union with Sāman, the state of being in the same world,

analyzed: yaḥ evam etat sāma veda
translated: one who knows this Sāman in this way...

analyzed: eṣaḥ u vai udgīthaḥ
translated: This, indeed, is the Udgītha.

original: prāṇo vā ut prāṇena hīdaṃ sarvam uttabdham /🔽vāg eva gīthā /🔽uc ca gīthā ceti /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ vai ud prāṇena hi idam sarvam uttabdham  vāc eva gīthā  ud ca gīthā ca iti
translated: Breath is Udgītha, for by breath all this is blown forth.🔽Speech itself is Gītha.

analyzed: saḥ udgīthaḥ
translated: It is Udgītha because it is Udgītha.

original: tad dhāpi brahmadattaś caikitāneyo rājānaṃ bhakṣayann uvāca /
analyzed: tat ha api brahmadattaḥ caikitāneyaḥ rājānam bhakṣayan uvāca
translated: Now, once Brahmadatta, the son of Cekitāna, while eating the king, said:

original: ayaṃ tyasya rājā mūrdhānaṃ vipātayatād yad ito 'yāsya āṅgiraso 'nyenodagāyad iti /
analyzed: ayam tyasya rājā mūrdhānam vipātayatāt yat itas yā asya āṅgirasaḥ nyena udagāyat iti
translated: Let this king's head be struck off, since this one, the son of Āṅgirasa, sang with another.

original: vācā ca hy eva sa prāṇena codagāyad iti // / / //
analyzed: vācā ca hi eva sa prāṇena ca udagāyat iti
translated: For he sang with speech and with breath.

original: tasya haitasya sāmno yaḥ svaṃ veda bhavati hāsya svam /
analyzed: tasya ha etasya sāmnaḥ yaḥ svam veda bhavati ha asya svam
translated: Now, he who knows the self of this Sāman becomes the self's own.

original: tasya vai svara eva svam /🔽tasmād ārtvijyaṃ kariṣyan vāci svaram iccheta /
analyzed: tasya vai svaraḥ eva svam  tasmāt ārtvijyam kariṣyan vāci svaram iccheta
translated: The self of that is indeed the tone.🔽Therefore, one who is about to perform priestly duties should desire the tone in speech.

analyzed: tayā vācā svara sampannayā ārtvijyam kuryāt
translated: With that speech endowed with tone, one should perform priestly duties.

analyzed: tasmāt yajñe svaravantam didṛkṣante eva
translated: Therefore, at a sacrifice, they desire to see one who has tone.

original: atho yasya svaṃ bhavati /🔽bhavati hāsya svaṃ ya evam etat sāmnaḥ svaṃ veda // / / //
analyzed: atha u yasya svam bhavati  bhavati ha asya svam yaḥ evam etat sāmnaḥ svam veda
translated: And, verily, for him who knows this, his own becomes his own.🔽His own becomes his own, verily, who knows this.

original: tasya haitasya sāmno yaḥ suvarṇaṃ veda bhavati hāsya suvarṇam /
analyzed: tasya ha etasya sāmnaḥ yaḥ suvarṇam veda bhavati ha asya suvarṇam
translated: Verily, for him who knows the gold of this Sāman, gold becomes his.

original: tasya vai svara eva suvarṇam /🔽bhavati hāsya suvarṇaṃ ya evam etat sāmnaḥ suvarṇaṃ veda // / / //
analyzed: tasya vai svaraḥ eva suvarṇam  bhavati ha asya suvarṇam yaḥ evam etat sāmnaḥ suvarṇam veda
translated: Its gold is its voice.🔽Gold becomes his, verily, who knows this gold of the Sāman.

original: tasya haitasya sāmno yaḥ pratiṣṭhāṃ veda prati ha tiṣṭhati /🔽tasya vai vāg eva pratiṣṭhā /🔽vāci hi khalv eṣa etat prāṇaḥ pratiṣṭhito gīyate /
analyzed: tasya ha etasya sāmnaḥ yaḥ pratiṣṭhām veda prati ha tiṣṭhati  tasya vai vāc eva pratiṣṭhā  vāci hi khalu eṣaḥ etat prāṇaḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ gīyate
translated: Verily, for him who knows the support of this Sāman, he finds support.🔽Its support is speech.🔽For in speech this breath is indeed sung as supported.

analyzed: anne iti u ha eke āhuḥ
translated: Some say food.

original: athātaḥ pavamānānām evābhyārohaḥ /🔽sa vai khalu prastotā sāma prastauti /
analyzed: atha atas pavamānānām eva abhyārohaḥ  sa vai khalu prastotā sāma prastauti
translated: Now, then, the ascent of the Pavamānas.🔽The Prastotr priest chants the Sāman.

original: sa yatra prastuyāt tad etāni japet /🔽asato mā sad gamaya /
analyzed: sa yatra prastuyāt tat etāni japet  asataḥ mā sat gamaya
translated: Wherever he should chant, there he should murmur these (verses):🔽'From non-being may I go to being,'

analyzed: tamasaḥ mā jyotiḥ gamaya
translated: 'From darkness may I go to light,'

analyzed: mṛtyoḥ mā amṛtam gamaya iti
translated: 'From death may I go to immortality.'

original: sa yad āhāsato mā sad gamayeti /
analyzed: sa yat āha asataḥ mā sat gamaya iti
translated: When he says, 'From non-being may I go to being,'

original: mṛtyur vā asat sad amṛtaṃ mṛtyor māmṛtaṃ gamayāmṛtaṃ mā kurv ity evaitad āha /
analyzed: mṛtyuḥ vai asat sat amṛtam mṛtyoḥ mā amṛtam gamaya amṛtam mā kuru iti eva etat āha
translated: non-being is death, being is immortality. 'From death may I go to immortality, may I become immortal' is what he says.

analyzed: tamasaḥ mā jyotiḥ gamaya iti
translated: 'From darkness may he lead me to light', he says.

original: mṛtyur vai tamo jyotir amṛtaṃ mṛtyor māmṛtaṃ gamayāmṛtaṃ mā kurv ity evaitad āha /
analyzed: mṛtyuḥ vai tamaḥ jyotiḥ amṛtam mṛtyoḥ mā amṛtam gamaya amṛtam mā kuru iti eva etat āha
translated: Darkness, indeed, is death, and light is immortality. 'From death lead me to immortality, make me immortal', is what he thereby says.

analyzed: mṛtyoḥ mā amṛtam gamaya iti
translated: 'From death lead me to immortality', he says.

analyzed: na atra tirohitam iva asti
translated: There is nothing obscure here.

original: atha yānītarāṇi stotrāṇi teṣv ātmane 'nnādyam āgāyet /
analyzed: atha yāni itarāṇi stotrāṇi teṣu ātmane nnādyam āgāyet
translated: Now, in the other hymns of praise, he should sing food and drink for himself or for the sacrificer.

analyzed: tasmāt u teṣu varam vṛṇīta
translated: Therefore, in them one should choose a boon.

analyzed: yam kāmam kāmayet tam
translated: Whatever desire one may desire.

original: sa eṣa evaṃvid udgātātmane vā yajamānāya vā yaṃ kāmaṃ kāmayate tam āgāyati /
analyzed: saḥ eṣaḥ evaṃvid udgātā ātmane vā yajamānāya vā yam kāmam kāmayate tam āgāyati
translated: This knower of the Sāman, the Udgātṛ, sings whatever desire he may desire for himself or for the sacrificer.

analyzed: tat ha etat loka jit eva
translated: This, indeed, is the conqueror of the worlds.

original: na haivālokyatāyā āśāsti ya evam etat sāma veda // / / //
analyzed: na ha eva alokya tāyai āśāsti yaḥ evam etat sāma veda
translated: He does not expect to see what is not seen by one who knows this Sāman in this way.

analyzed: ātmā eva idam agre āsīt puruṣavidhaḥ
translated: The Self alone existed in the beginning, in the form of a person.

analyzed: saḥ nu vīkṣya na anyat ātmanaḥ paśyat
translated: He, looking around, saw nothing else but the Self.

analyzed: saḥ ham asmi iti agre vyāharat
translated: 'I am He', he first uttered.

analyzed: tatas haṃnāmā bhavat
translated: Then the name 'I' came into existence.

original: tasmād apy etarhy āmantrito 'ham ayam ity evāgra uktvāthānyan nāma prabrūte yad asya bhavati /
analyzed: tasmāt api etarhi āmantritaḥ ham ayam iti eva agre uktvā atha anyat nāma prabrūte yat asya bhavati
translated: Therefore, even now, when addressed, one first says 'I am this', and then mentions another name that one may have.

original: sa yat pūrvo 'smāt sarvasmāt sarvān pāpmana auṣat tasmāt puruṣaḥ /
analyzed: sa yat pūrvaḥ smāt sarvasmāt sarvān pāpmanaḥ auṣat tasmāt puruṣaḥ
translated: In that he removed all evil from him who was before all this, therefore (he is called) Purusha.

original: oṣati ha vai sa taṃ yo 'smāt pūrvo bubhūṣati ya evaṃ veda // / / //
analyzed: oṣati ha vai sa tam yaḥ smāt pūrvaḥ bubhūṣati yaḥ evam veda
translated: He who desires to be before him who knows this, he indeed removes that (evil).

analyzed: saḥ bibhet tasmāt ekākī bibheti
translated: He was afraid. Therefore one who is alone is afraid.

analyzed: sa ha ayam īkṣām cakre
translated: He thought:

original: yan mad anyan nāsti kasmān nu bibhemīti /
analyzed: yat mat anyat na asti kasmāt nu bibhemi iti
translated: Since there is nothing else but me, of what should I be afraid?

analyzed: tatas eva asya bhayam vīyāya
translated: Then his fear went away.

analyzed: kasmāt hi abheṣyat
translated: For of what should he be afraid?

analyzed: dvitīyāt vai bhayam bhavati
translated: For fear comes from a second.

analyzed: sa vai na eva reme
translated: He indeed did not rejoice.

analyzed: tasmāt ekākī na ramate
translated: Therefore one who is alone does not rejoice.

analyzed: sa dvitīyam aicchat
translated: He desired a second.

original: sa haitāvān āsa yathā strīpumāṃsau sampariṣvaktau /
analyzed: sa ha etāvān āsa yathā strī pumāṃsau sampariṣvaktau
translated: He became just so much as a man and a woman embracing each other.

analyzed: saḥ imam eva ātmānam dvedhā apātayat
translated: He split this self in two.

analyzed: tatas patiḥ ca patnī ca abhavatām
translated: Then there were husband and wife.

original: tasmād idam ardhabṛgalam iva sva iti ha smāha yājñavalkyaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt idam ardha bṛgalam iva svaḥ iti ha sma āha yājñavalkyaḥ
translated: Therefore it is said, This (body) is as it were half of oneself, said Yajnavalkya.

original: tasmād ayam ākāśaḥ striyā pūryata eva /
analyzed: tasmāt ayam ākāśaḥ striyā pūryate eva
translated: Therefore this space is filled by a woman.

analyzed: tām samabhavat
translated: They united.

analyzed: tatas manuṣyāḥ ajāyanta
translated: Then humans were born.

original: so heyam īkṣāṃ cakre kathaṃ nu mātmana eva janayitvā sambhavati /
analyzed: saḥ ha iyam īkṣām cakre katham nu mā ātmanaḥ eva janayitvā sambhavati
translated: He thought: How can I be born from myself?

analyzed: hanta tiras sāni iti
translated: 'Let us go away', (he said).

analyzed: sā gauḥ abhavat vṛṣabhaḥ itaraḥ
translated: The cow was one, the bull the other.

analyzed: tām sam eva abhavat
translated: They united together.

analyzed: tatas gāvaḥ jāyanta  vaḍavā itarā bhavat aśva vṛṣaḥ itaraḥ
translated: From that the cows were born.🔽The mare was one, the stallion the other.

analyzed: gardabhītarā gardabhaḥ itaraḥ
translated: The she-ass was one, the ass the other.

analyzed: tām sam eva abhavat
translated: They united together.

analyzed: tatas ekaśapham ajāyata  ajā itarā bhavat bastaḥ itaraḥ
translated: From that the one-hoofed was born.🔽The she-goat was one, the he-goat the other.

analyzed: aviḥ itarā meṣaḥ itaraḥ
translated: The ewe was one, the ram the other.

analyzed: tām sam eva abhavat
translated: They united together.

analyzed: tatas jāvayaḥ jāyanta
translated: From that the goats and sheep were born.

original: evam eva yad idaṃ kiñca mithunam ā pipīlikābhyas tat sarvam asṛjata // / / //
analyzed: evam eva yat idam kiñca mithunam ā pipīlikābhyaḥ tat sarvam asṛjata
translated: Thus indeed, whatever pair there is, down to the ants, all that he created.

original: so 'ved ahaṃ vāva sṛṣṭir asmy ahaṃ hīdaṃ sarvam asṛkṣīti /
analyzed: saḥ vet aham vāva sṛṣṭiḥ asmi aham hi idam sarvam asṛkṣi iti
translated: He knew: 'Verily, I am creation. For I have created all this.'

analyzed: tatas sṛṣṭiḥ abhavat
translated: From that creation came into being.

original: sṛṣṭyāṃ hāsyaitasyāṃ bhavati ya evaṃ veda // / / //
analyzed: sṛṣṭyām ha asya etasyām bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: In this creation he becomes who knows thus.

analyzed: atha iti abhyamanthat
translated: Then he churned.

original: sa mukhāc ca yoner hastābhyāṃ cāgnim asṛjata /🔽tasmād etad ubhayam alomakam antarataḥ /
analyzed: sa mukhāt ca yoneḥ hastābhyām ca agnim asṛjata  tasmāt etat ubhayam alomakam antarataḥ
translated: He created Agni from his mouth, womb, and hands.🔽Therefore this is both hairless within.

analyzed: alomakā hi yoniḥ antarataḥ
translated: For the womb is hairless within.

original: tad yad idam āhur amuṃ yajāmuṃ yajety ekaikaṃ devam etasyaiva sā visṛṣṭiḥ /
analyzed: tat yat idam āhuḥ amum yaja amum yaja iti ekaikam devam etasya eva sā visṛṣṭiḥ
translated: Now, when they say, 'We worship that one, we worship that one,' each deity, that is a creation of this (Brahman).

original: eṣa u hy eva sarve devāḥ /
analyzed: eṣaḥ u hi eva sarve devāḥ
translated: For he is all the gods.

original: atha yat kiñcedam ārdraṃ tad retaso 'sṛjata /
analyzed: atha yat kiñca idam ārdram tat retasaḥ sṛjata
translated: And whatever here is moist, that he created from his seed.

analyzed: tat u soma
translated: That is Soma.

original: etāvad vā idaṃ sarvam annaṃ caivānnādaś ca /
analyzed: etāvat vai idam sarvam annam ca eva anna ādaḥ ca
translated: For this much is all this: food and the eater of food.

analyzed: somaḥ eva annam agniḥ anna ādaḥ
translated: Soma is food, Agni is the eater of food.

analyzed: sā eṣā brahmaṇaḥ tisṛṣṭiḥ
translated: This is the over-creation of Brahman.

original: yac chreyaso devān asṛjatātha yan martyaḥ sann amṛtān asṛjata tasmād atisṛṣṭir /
analyzed: yat śreyasaḥ devān asṛjata atha yat martyaḥ san amṛtān asṛjata tasmāt atisṛṣṭiḥ
translated: When he created the gods, who are better than himself, and when, being mortal, he created the immortals, therefore it is an over-creation.

original: atisṛṣṭyāṃ hāsyaitasyāṃ bhavati ya evaṃ veda // / / //
analyzed: atisṛṣṭyām ha asya etasyām bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: In this over-creation he has a share who knows this.

analyzed: tat ha idam tarhi a vyākṛtam āsīt
translated: Now at that time this (universe) was undefined.

original: tan nāmarūpābhyām eva vyākriyatāsau nāmāyam idaṃrūpa iti /
analyzed: tat nāma rūpābhyām eva vyākriyata asau nāma ayam idaṃrūpaḥ iti
translated: It was defined by name and form: 'This is named that, it has this form.'

original: tad idam apy etarhi nāmarūpābhyām eva vyākriyata asau nāmāyam idaṃrūpa iti /
analyzed: tat idam api etarhi nāma rūpābhyām eva vyākriyata asau nāma ayam idaṃrūpaḥ iti
translated: And it is defined by name and form even now: 'This is named that, it has this form.'

original: sa eṣa iha praviṣṭa ā nakhāgrebhyo yathā kṣuraḥ kṣuradhāne 'vahitaḥ syād viśvambharo vā viśvambharakulāye /
analyzed: saḥ eṣaḥ iha praviṣṭaḥ ā nakha agrebhyaḥ yathā kṣuraḥ kṣura dhāne vahitaḥ syāt viśvambharaḥ vā viśvambhara kulāye
translated: He has entered here, even into the tips of the nails. He is like a razor hidden in a razor-case, or like a fire covered by ashes.

analyzed: tam na paśyanti
translated: They do not see him.

original: akṛtsno hi saḥ prāṇann eva prāṇo nāma bhavati /
analyzed: akṛtsnaḥ hi saḥ prāṇan eva prāṇaḥ nāma bhavati
translated: For he is incomplete, indeed, when he lives, he is called only 'life';

original: vadan vāk paśyaṃś cakṣuḥ śṛṇvañ chrotraṃ manvāno manaḥ /
analyzed: vadan vāc paśyan cakṣuḥ śṛṇvam śrotram manvānaḥ manaḥ
translated: when he speaks, 'speech'; when he sees, 'the eye'; when he hears, 'the ear'; when he thinks, 'the mind.'

analyzed: tāni asya etāni karmanāmāni eva
translated: These are his names according to his actions.

original: sa yo 'ta ekaikam upāste na sa veda /
analyzed: sa yaḥ te ekaikam upāste na sa veda
translated: One who worships any one of them as separate from the others does not know,

analyzed: akṛtsnaḥ hi eṣa u te ekaikena bhavati
translated: for he is incomplete, indeed, by being separated from the others.

analyzed: ātmā iti eva upāsīta
translated: One should worship only as 'the Self.'

original: atra hy ete sarva ekaṃ bhavanti /
analyzed: atra hi ete sarve ekam bhavanti
translated: For in this all these become one.

original: tad etat padanīyam asya sarvasya yad ayam ātmā /
analyzed: tat etat padanīyam asya sarvasya yat ayam ātmā
translated: This is the path of all this, that this is the Self.

analyzed: anena hi etat sarvam veda
translated: For by this one knows all this.

original: yathā ha vai padenānuvinded evaṃ kīrtiṃ ślokaṃ vindate ya evaṃ veda // / / //
analyzed: yathā ha vai padena anuvindet evam kīrtim ślokam vindate yaḥ evam veda
translated: One who knows thus obtains fame and praise, as if one were to find something with a foot.

original: tad etat preyaḥ putrāt preyo vittāt preyo 'nyasmāt sarvasmād antarataraṃ yad ayam ātmā /
analyzed: tat etat preyaḥ putrāt preyaḥ vittāt preyaḥ nyasmāt sarvasmāt antarataram yat ayam ātmā
translated: This is dearer than a son, dearer than wealth, dearer than anything else, more intimate than this, that this is the Self.

original: sa yo 'nyam ātmanaḥ priyaṃ bruvāṇaṃ brūyāt priyaṃ rotsyatītīśvaro ha tathaiva syāt /
analyzed: sa yaḥ ātmanaḥ priyam bruvāṇam brūyāt priyam rotsyati iti īśvaraḥ ha tathā eva syāt
translated: One who would say to another who speaks what is dear to the Self, 'What is dear will be destroyed,' the Lord would be so indeed.

analyzed: ātmānam eva priyam upāsīta
translated: One should worship only the Self as dear.

original: sa ya ātmānam eva priyam upāste na hāsya priyaṃ pramāyukaṃ bhavati // / / //
analyzed: sa yaḥ ātmānam eva priyam upāste na ha asya priyam pramāyukam bhavati
translated: One for whom the Self alone is dear to worship, his dear one is not subject to destruction.

original: tad āhur yad brahmavidyayā sarvaṃ bhaviṣyanto manuṣyā manyante /
analyzed: tat āhuḥ yat brahma vidyayā sarvam bhaviṣyantaḥ manuṣyāḥ manyante
translated: Regarding this, they say: 'Thinking that through the knowledge of Brahman everything will be, men think that.

original: kim u tad brahmāved yasmāt tat sarvam abhavad iti // / / //
analyzed: kim u tat brahma avet yasmāt tat sarvam abhavat iti
translated: What is that Brahman, knowing which everything became so?'

analyzed: brahma vai idam agre āsīt
translated: Brahman indeed was this in the beginning.

analyzed: tat ātmānam eva avet
translated: It knew itself:

analyzed: aham brahma asmi iti
translated: 'I am Brahman.'

analyzed: tasmāt tat sarvam abhavat
translated: Therefore, it became all this.

original: tad yo yo devānāṃ pratyabudhyata sa eva tad abhavat /
analyzed: tat yaḥ yaḥ devānām pratyabudhyata saḥ eva tat abhavat
translated: He who understood it among the gods, he became just that.

analyzed: tathā ṛṣīnām
translated: So also among the seers.

analyzed: tathā manuṣyāṇām
translated: So also among men.

original: tad dhaitat paśyann ṛṣir vāmadevaḥ pratipede 'haṃ manur abhavaṃ sūryaś ceti /
analyzed: tat ha etat paśyan ṛṣiḥ vāmadevaḥ pratipede ham manuḥ abhavam sūryaḥ ca iti
translated: Seeing this, the seer Vamadeva entered: 'I became Manu, and the sun.'

original: tad idam apy etarhi ya evaṃ vedāhaṃ brahmāsmīti sa idaṃ sarvaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: tat idam api etarhi yaḥ evam veda aham brahma asmi iti saḥ idam sarvam bhavati
translated: And he who even today knows thus, 'I am Brahman,' he becomes all this.

original: tasya ha na devāś canābhūtyā īśate /
analyzed: tasya ha na devāḥ cana ābhūtyai īśate
translated: The gods do not have power over him for his destruction.

analyzed: ātmā hi eṣām sa bhavati
translated: For he becomes their self.

original: atha yo 'nyāṃ devatām upāste 'nyo 'sāv anyo 'ham asmīti na sa veda /
analyzed: atha yaḥ nyām devatām upāste nyaḥ sau anyaḥ ham asmi iti na sa veda
translated: But he who worships another deity, thinking 'He is one, I am another,' does not know.

analyzed: yathā paśuḥ evam sa devānām
translated: He is like a beast to the gods.

original: yathā ha vai bahavaḥ paśavo manuṣyaṃ bhuñjyur evam ekaikaḥ puruṣo devān bhunakti /
analyzed: yathā ha vai bahavaḥ paśavaḥ manuṣyam bhuñjyuḥ evam ekaikaḥ puruṣaḥ devān bhunakti
translated: Just as many beasts might devour a man, so each man devours the gods.

original: ekasminn eva paśāv ādīyamāne 'priyaṃ bhavati kim u bahuṣu /
analyzed: ekasmin eva paśau ādīyamāne priyam bhavati kim u bahuṣu
translated: When only one animal is being killed, there is displeasure; how much more so when many are being killed.

original: tasmād eṣāṃ tan na priyaṃ yad etan manuṣyā vidyuḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt eṣām tat na priyam yat etat manuṣyāḥ vidyuḥ
translated: Therefore, that which men know is not pleasing to them.

original: brahma vā idam agra āsīd ekam eva /
analyzed: brahma vai idam agre āsīt ekam eva
translated: Brahman indeed was this in the beginning, one only.

analyzed: tat ekam sat na vyabhavat
translated: That one, being, did not flourish.

analyzed: tat śreyaḥ rūpam atyasṛjata kṣatram
translated: It created the Kshatriya class, which is of the nature of excellence.

original: yāny etāni devatrā kṣatrāṇīndro varuṇaḥ somo rudraḥ parjanyo yamo mṛtyur īśāna iti /
analyzed: yāni etāni devatrā kṣatrāṇi indraḥ varuṇaḥ somaḥ rudraḥ parjanyaḥ yamaḥ mṛtyuḥ īśānaḥ iti
translated: Those Kshatriya classes in the gods are Indra, Varuna, Soma, Rudra, Parjanya, Yama, Mrityu, and Isana.

analyzed: tasmāt kṣatrāt param na asti
translated: Therefore, there is nothing higher than the Kshatriya.

original: tasmād brāhmaṇaḥ kṣatriyaṃ adhastād upāste rājasūye /
analyzed: tasmāt brāhmaṇaḥ kṣatriyam adhastāt upāste rājasūye
translated: Therefore, the Brahmana sits below the Kshatriya in the Rajasuya sacrifice.

analyzed: kṣatre eva tat yaśaḥ dadhāti
translated: He places that glory in the Kshatriya itself.

analyzed: sā eṣā kṣatrasya yoniḥ yat brahma
translated: This is the womb of the Kshatriya, namely, the Brahmana.

original: tasmād yady api rājā paramatāṃ gacchati brahmaivāntata upaniśrayati svāṃ yonim /
analyzed: tasmāt yadi api rājā parama tām gacchati brahma eva antatas upaniśrayati svām yonim
translated: Therefore, even if a king attains the highest position, he ultimately resorts to the Brahmana, his own womb.

original: ya u enaṃ hinasti svāṃ sa yonim ṛcchati /
analyzed: yaḥ u enam hinasti svām sa yonim ṛcchati
translated: One who injures him goes to his own womb.

original: sa pāpīyān bhavati yathā śreyāṃsaṃ hiṃsitvā // / / //
analyzed: sa pāpīyān bhavati yathā śreyāṃsam hiṃsitvā
translated: He becomes worse, just like one who injures a superior.

analyzed: sa na eva vyabhavat
translated: It did not flourish.

analyzed: sa viśam asṛjata
translated: It created the people.

original: yāny etāni devajātāni gaṇaśa ākhyāyante vasavo rudrā ādityā viśve devā maruta iti // / / //
analyzed: yāni etāni deva jātāni gaṇaśas ākhyāyante vasavaḥ rudrāḥ ādityāḥ viśve devāḥ marutaḥ iti
translated: These are the groups of gods that are mentioned, namely, the Vasus, the Rudras, the Adityas, the Visve Devas, and the Maruts.

analyzed: sa na eva vyabhavat
translated: He did not become differentiated.

original: sa śaudraṃ varṇam asṛjata pūṣaṇam /🔽iyaṃ vai pūṣā /
analyzed: sa śaudram varṇam asṛjata pūṣaṇam  iyam vai pūṣā
translated: He created the Śūdra caste, Pūṣan.🔽Pūṣan is this (earth),

original: iyaṃ hīdaṃ sarvaṃ puṣyati yad idaṃ kiñca // / / //
analyzed: iyam hi idam sarvam puṣyati yat idam kiñca
translated: for she nourishes (puṣyati) everything here that exists.

analyzed: sa na eva vyabhavat
translated: He did not become differentiated.

analyzed: tat śreyaḥ rūpam atyasṛjata dharmam
translated: He created the form of excellence, Dharma.

original: tad etat kṣatrasya kṣatraṃ yad dharmaḥ /
analyzed: tat etat kṣatrasya kṣatram yat dharmaḥ
translated: That is the essence of the Kshatriya, that it is Dharma.

analyzed: tasmāt dharmāt param na asti
translated: Therefore, there is nothing higher than Dharma.

analyzed: atha u a balīyān balīyāṃsam āśaṃsate dharmeṇa
translated: Moreover, the weaker one aspires to the stronger one through Dharma.

analyzed: yathā rājñā evam
translated: Just as by the king.

original: yo vai sa dharmaḥ satyaṃ vai tat /
analyzed: yaḥ vai sa dharmaḥ satyam vai tat
translated: Whatever that Dharma is, that is indeed truth.

original: tasmāt satyaṃ vadantam āhur dharmaṃ vadatīti /
analyzed: tasmāt satyam vadantam āhuḥ dharmam vadati iti
translated: Therefore, when one speaks the truth, they say, He speaks Dharma.

analyzed: dharmam vā vadantam satyam vadati iti
translated: Or when one speaks Dharma, they say, He speaks the truth.

analyzed: etat hi eva etat ubhayam bhavati
translated: For this is indeed both of them.

original: tad etad brahma kṣatraṃ viṭ śūdraḥ /
analyzed: tat etat brahma kṣatram viś śūdraḥ
translated: That is this Brahman, Kshatriya, Vaishya, and Shudra.

original: tad agninaiva deveṣu brahmābhavad brāhmaṇo manuṣyeṣu /
analyzed: tat agninā eva deveṣu brahmā abhavat brāhmaṇaḥ manuṣyeṣu
translated: By Agni he became Brahman among the gods, and a Brahmin among men.

analyzed: kṣatriyeṇa kṣatriyaḥ
translated: By the Kshatriya, a Kshatriya.

analyzed: vaiśyena vaiśyaḥ
translated: By the Vaishya, a Vaishya.

analyzed: śūdreṇa śūdraḥ
translated: By the Shudra, a Shudra.

original: tasmād agnāv eva deveṣu lokam icchante brāhmaṇe manuṣyeṣu /
analyzed: tasmāt agnau eva deveṣu lokam icchante brāhmaṇe manuṣyeṣu
translated: Therefore, in the fire they desire the world of the gods, and in the Brahmana the world of men.

analyzed: etābhyām hi rūpābhyām brahma abhavat
translated: For it is through these two forms that Brahman became.

original: atha yo ha vā asmāl lokāt svaṃ lokam adṛṣṭvā praiti sa enam avidito na bhunakti yathā vedo vānanūkto 'nyad vā karmākṛtam /
analyzed: atha yaḥ ha vai asmāt lokāt svam lokam a dṛṣṭvā praiti saḥ enam a viditaḥ na bhunakti yathā vedaḥ vā an anūktaḥ nyat vā karma a kṛtam
translated: Now, he who departs from this world without seeing his own world, he does not enjoy it unknown, just as a Veda not recited or any other rite not performed.

original: yadi ha vā apy anevaṃvin mahatpuṇyaṃ karma karoti tad dhāsyāntataḥ kṣīyata eva /
analyzed: yadi ha vai api an evaṃvid mahat puṇyam karma karoti tat ha asya antatas kṣīyate eva
translated: If, indeed, one who is not thus knowing performs a great meritorious rite, it is exhausted in the end for him.

analyzed: ātmānam eva lokam upāsīta
translated: One should worship as his world just one's own self.

original: sa ya ātmānam eva lokam upāste na hāsya karma kṣīyate /
analyzed: sa yaḥ ātmānam eva lokam upāste na ha asya karma kṣīyate
translated: For one who worships just one's own self as the world, one's rite is not exhausted.

original: asmād dhy evātmano yadyat kāmayate tattat sṛjate // / / //
analyzed: asmāt hi eva ātmanaḥ yat yat kāmayate tat tat sṛjate
translated: For from just this self, whatever one desires, that he creates.

original: atho ayaṃ vā ātmā sarveṣāṃ bhūtānāṃ lokaḥ /
analyzed: atha u ayam vai ātmā sarveṣām bhūtānām lokaḥ
translated: Moreover, this self is the world of all beings.

original: sa yaj juhoti yad yajate tena devānāṃ lokaḥ /
analyzed: sa yat juhoti yat yajate tena devānām lokaḥ
translated: By what he offers and what he sacrifices, he is the world of the gods.

original: atha yad anubrūte tena ṛṣīṇām /🔽atha yat pitṛbhyo nipṛṇāti yat prajām icchate tena pitṝṇām /
analyzed: atha yat anubrūte tena ṛṣīṇām  atha yat pitṛbhyaḥ nipṛṇāti yat prajām icchate tena pitṝṇām
translated: Then by what he recites, he is the world of the sages.🔽Then by what he offers to the ancestors and what he desires offspring, he is the world of the ancestors.

original: atha yan manuṣyān vāsayate yad ebhyo 'śanaṃ dadāti tena manuṣyāṇām /
analyzed: atha yat manuṣyān vāsayate yat ebhyaḥ śanam dadāti tena manuṣyāṇām
translated: Then by what he accommodates men and what food he gives to them, he is the world of men.

original: atha yat paśubhyas tṛṇodakaṃ vindati tena paśūnām /
analyzed: atha yat paśubhyaḥ tṛṇa udakam vindati tena paśūnām
translated: And what grass and water he finds for the cattle, that is for the cattle.

original: yad asya gṛheṣu śvāpadā vayāṃsy ā pipīlikābhya upajīvanti tena teṣāṃ lokaḥ /
analyzed: yat asya gṛheṣu śvāpadāḥ vayāṃsi ā pipīlikābhyaḥ upajīvanti tena teṣām lokaḥ
translated: And the world of those (beings) which live in his house, down to dogs, birds, and ants, is that (world of the cattle).

original: yathā ha vai svāya lokāyāriṣṭim icchet /
analyzed: yathā ha vai svāya lokāya ariṣṭim icchet
translated: Just as one would wish for one's own world that there should be no misfortune,

original: evaṃ haivaṃvide sarvadā sarvāṇi bhūtāny ariṣṭim icchanti /
analyzed: evam ha evaṃvide sarvadā sarvāṇi bhūtāni ariṣṭim icchanti
translated: so all beings wish for him who knows thus that there should be no misfortune.

analyzed: tat vai etat viditam mīmāṃsitam
translated: That has been known, pondered,

analyzed: ātmā eva idam agre āsīt ekaḥ eva
translated: the Self was this world in the beginning, one only.

original: so 'kāmayata jāyā me syād atha prajāyeya /
analyzed: sā u kāmayata jāyā me syāt atha prajāyeya
translated: He desired, 'May I have offspring.

original: atha vittaṃ me syād atha karma kurvīyeti /
analyzed: atha vittam me syāt atha karma kurvīya iti
translated: May I acquire wealth. May I perform holy rites.'

analyzed: etāvān vai kāmaḥ
translated: So great is desire.

analyzed: na icchan cana atas bhūyaḥ vindet
translated: One who desires not would find no more than this.

original: tasmād apy etarhy ekākī kāmayate jāyā me syād atha prajāyeyātha vittaṃ me syād atha karma kurvīyeti /
analyzed: tasmāt api etarhi ekākī kāmayate jāyā me syāt atha prajāyeya atha vittam me syāt atha karma kurvīya iti
translated: Therefore even now a man who is alone desires, 'May I have a wife. May I have offspring. May I acquire wealth. May I perform holy rites.'

original: sa yāvad apy eteṣām ekaikaṃ na prāpnoty akṛtsna eva tāvan manyate /
analyzed: sa yāvat api eteṣām ekaikam na prāpnoti akṛtsnaḥ eva tāvat manyate
translated: As long as he does not obtain even one of these, he considers himself incomplete.

analyzed: tasya u kṛtsna tā
translated: His completeness is this.

analyzed: manaḥ eva asya ātmā  vāc jāyā
translated: The mind is his Self.🔽Speech is his wife.

analyzed: prāṇaḥ prajā
translated: The breath is his offspring.

analyzed: cakṣuḥ mānuṣam vittam
translated: The eye is human wealth.

analyzed: cakṣuṣā hi tat vindate
translated: For by the eye one obtains that.

analyzed: śrotram daivam
translated: The ear is divine.

analyzed: śrotreṇa hi tat śṛṇoti  ātmā eva asya karma
translated: For by the ear one hears that.🔽The self is indeed one's own action.

analyzed: ātmanā hi karma karoti
translated: For by the self one performs action.

analyzed: saḥ eṣa pāṅktaḥ yajñaḥ
translated: This sacrifice is fivefold.

analyzed: pāṅktaḥ paśuḥ
translated: The animal is fivefold.

analyzed: pāṅktaḥ puruṣaḥ
translated: Man is fivefold.

original: pāṅktam idaṃ sarvaṃ yad idaṃ kiñca /
analyzed: pāṅktam idam sarvam yat idam kiñca
translated: This whole world, whatever there is, is fivefold.

original: tad idaṃ sarvam āpnoti ya evaṃ veda // / / //
analyzed: tat idam sarvam āpnoti yaḥ evam veda
translated: He obtains all this who knows thus.

analyzed: yat sapta annāni medhayā tapasā ajanayat pitā
translated: The seven kinds of food which the father produced by knowledge and austerity,

original: ekam asya sādhāraṇaṃ dve devān abhājayat /
analyzed: ekam asya sādhāraṇam dve devān abhājayat
translated: One of them is common to all, two he assigned to the gods,

analyzed: trīṇi ātmane kuruta paśubhyaḥ ekam prāyacchat
translated: Three he made for the self, one he gave to the cattle.

original: tasmin sarvaṃ pratiṣṭhitaṃ yacca prāṇiti yacca na /
analyzed: tasmin sarvam pratiṣṭhitam yat ca prāṇiti yat ca na
translated: On that everything rests, what breathes and what does not breathe.

original: kasmāt tāni na kṣīyante adyamānāni sarvadā /
analyzed: kasmāt tāni na kṣīyante adyamānāni sarvadā
translated: Why do they not perish, being used up all the time?

original: yo vai tām akṣitiṃ veda so 'nnam atti pratīkena /
analyzed: yaḥ vai tām akṣitim veda saḥ annam atti pratīkena
translated: He who knows that imperishable one eats food with the mouth.

original: sa devān apigacchati sa ūṛjam upajīvati /
analyzed: sa devān apigacchati saḥ ūṛjam upajīvati
translated: He goes even to the gods, he lives on the essence.

original: iti ślokāḥ // / / //🔽yat saptānnāni medhayā tapasājanayat piteti /
analyzed: iti ślokāḥ  yat sapta annāni medhayā tapasā ajanayat pitā iti
translated: Thus are the verses.

original: medhayā hi tapasājanayat pitaikam asya sādhāraṇam iti /
analyzed: medhayā hi tapasā ajanayat pitā ekam asya sādhāraṇam iti
translated: The seven kinds of food which the father produced by knowledge and austerity, he said: One of them is common to all.

original: idam evāsya tat sādhāraṇam annaṃ yad idam adyate /
analyzed: idam eva asya tat sādhāraṇam annam yat idam adyate
translated: This is his common food, namely what is eaten.

original: sa ya etad upāste na sa pāpmano vyāvartate /
analyzed: sa yaḥ etat upāste na sa pāpmanaḥ vyāvartate
translated: One who worships it does not turn away from evil.

analyzed: miśram hi etat
translated: For it is mixed.

analyzed: dve devān abhājayat iti
translated: It is said, He gave two to the gods.

analyzed: hutam ca prahutam ca
translated: The offered and the offered-up.

original: tasmād devebhyo juhvati ca pra ca juhvati /
analyzed: tasmāt devebhyaḥ juhvati ca pra ca juhvati
translated: Therefore they offer to the gods and offer up to them.

analyzed: atha u āhuḥ darśapūrṇamāsau iti
translated: Moreover, they say, it is the new and full moon sacrifices.

analyzed: tasmāt na iṣṭiyājukaḥ syāt
translated: Therefore one should not be one who sacrifices to the Neṣṭṛ priest.

analyzed: paśubhyaḥ ekam prāyacchat iti
translated: He gave one to the cattle, they say.

analyzed: tat payaḥ
translated: That is milk.

original: payo hy evāgre manuṣyāś ca paśavaś copajīvanti /🔽tasmāt kumāraṃ jātaṃ ghṛtaṃ vaivāgre pratilehayanti stanaṃ vānudhāpayanti /
analyzed: payaḥ hi eva agre manuṣyāḥ ca paśavaḥ ca upajīvanti  tasmāt kumāram jātam ghṛtam vā eva agre pratilehayanti stanam vā anudhāpayanti
translated: For men and cattle first live on milk.🔽Therefore, as soon as a boy is born, they first make him lick ghee or give him the breast.

original: atha vatsaṃ jātam āhus tṛṇād iti /
analyzed: atha vatsam jātam āhuḥ tṛṇāt iti
translated: Then they say to a calf that is born, 'Eat grass.'

original: tasmin sarvaṃ pratiṣṭhitaṃ yacca prāṇiti yacca neti /
analyzed: tasmin sarvam pratiṣṭhitam yat ca prāṇiti yat ca na iti
translated: In it all this rests, what breathes and what does not breathe.

original: payasi hīdaṃ sarvaṃ pratiṣṭhitaṃ yacca prāṇiti yacca na /
analyzed: payasi hi idam sarvam pratiṣṭhitam yat ca prāṇiti yat ca na
translated: For in milk all this rests, what breathes and what does not breathe.

original: tad yad idam āhuḥ saṃvatsaraṃ payasā juhvad apa punarmṛtyuṃ jayatīti /
analyzed: tat yat idam āhuḥ saṃvatsaram payasā juhvat apa punarmṛtyum jayati iti
translated: Now, as for what they say, 'One who offers milk for a year conquers death again,'

analyzed: na tathā vidyāt
translated: one should not know it thus.

original: yad ahar eva juhoti tad ahaḥ punarmṛtyum apajayaty evaṃ vidvān /
analyzed: yat ahar eva juhoti tat ahar punarmṛtyum apajayati evam vidvān
translated: On whatever day he offers, on that day he conquers death again. Thus one who knows this.

analyzed: sarvam hi devebhyaḥ nnādyam prayacchati
translated: For he gives all food to the gods.

original: kasmāt tāni na kṣīyante adyamānāni sarvadeti /
analyzed: kasmāt tāni na kṣīyante adyamānāni sarvadā iti
translated: Why do they not perish when eaten, being all?

analyzed: puruṣaḥ vai akṣitiḥ
translated: Or man is imperishable.

original: sa hīdam annaṃ punaḥ punar janayate /
analyzed: sa hi idam annam punar punar janayate
translated: For he generates this food again and again.

analyzed: yaḥ vā etām akṣitim veda iti
translated: He who knows this imperishability.

analyzed: puruṣaḥ vai akṣitiḥ
translated: Or man is imperishable.

original: sa hīdam annaṃ dhiyādhiyā janayate karmabhiḥ /🔽yad dhaitan na kuryāt kṣīyeta ha /
analyzed: sa hi idam annam dhiyā adhiyā janayate karmabhiḥ  yat ha etat na kuryāt kṣīyeta ha
translated: For he generates this food with thought after thought through actions.🔽If he were not to do this, he would perish.

analyzed: saḥ annam atti pratīkena iti
translated: He eats food with a symbol.

analyzed: mukham pratīkam mukhena iti etat
translated: The mouth is the symbol. This means: with the mouth.

original: sa devān apigacchati sa ūrjam upajīvatīti praśaṃsā // / / //
analyzed: sa devān apigacchati saḥ ūrjam upajīvati iti praśaṃsā
translated: He goes even to the gods. He lives on strength. This is the praise.

analyzed: trīṇi ātmane kuruta iti
translated: He made three for the self.

analyzed: manaḥ vācam prāṇam tāni ātmane kuruta
translated: He made the mind, speech, and breath for the self.

original: anyatramanā abhūvaṃ nādarśam anyatramanā abhūvaṃ nāśrauṣam iti manasā hy eva paśyati manasā śṛṇoti /
analyzed: anyatramanāḥ abhūvam na adarśam anyatramanāḥ abhūvam na aśrauṣam iti manasā hi eva paśyati manasā śṛṇoti
translated: Apart from the mind I was, I saw not; apart from the mind I was, I heard not. For one sees with the mind, one hears with the mind.

original: kāmaḥ saṃkalpo vicikitsā śraddhāśraddhā dhṛtir adhṛtir hrīr dhīr bhīr ity etat sarvaṃ mana eva /
analyzed: kāmaḥ saṃkalpaḥ vicikitsā śraddhā aśraddhā dhṛtiḥ adhṛtiḥ hrīḥ dhīḥ bhīḥ iti etat sarvam manaḥ eva
translated: Desire, resolve, doubt, faith, lack of faith, firmness, lack of firmness, shame, understanding, fear - all this is mind alone.

original: tasmād api pṛṣṭhata upaspṛṣṭo manasā vijānāti /
analyzed: tasmāt api pṛṣṭhatas upaspṛṣṭaḥ manasā vijānāti
translated: Therefore, when touched from behind, one knows with the mind.

original: yaḥ kaśca śabdo vāg eva sā /
analyzed: yaḥ kaḥ ca śabdaḥ vāc eva sā
translated: Whatever sound there is, that is speech.

original: eṣā hy antaṃ āyattaiṣā hi na /
analyzed: eṣā hi antam āyattā eṣā hi na
translated: For this is dependent on the end. This indeed is not.

original: prāṇo 'pāno vyāna udānaḥ samāno 'na ity etat sarvaṃ prāṇa eva /
analyzed: prāṇo pānaḥ vyānaḥ udānaḥ samānaḥ naḥ iti etat sarvam prāṇaḥ eva
translated: Prana, apana, vyana, udana, samana, ana - all this is prana alone.

analyzed: etad mayaḥ vai ayam ātmā
translated: This Self is made up of that.

analyzed: vāc mayaḥ manaḥ mayaḥ prāṇa mayaḥ
translated: Made up of speech, made up of mind, made up of prana...

analyzed: trayaḥ lokāḥ ete eva
translated: These are the three worlds.

original: vāg evāyaṃ loko mano 'ntarikṣalokaḥ prāṇo 'sau lokaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vāc eva ayam lokaḥ manaḥ ntarikṣa lokaḥ prāṇaḥ u sau lokaḥ
translated: This world is speech, the atmospheric world is mind, that world is prana...

analyzed: trayaḥ veda ete eva
translated: These are the three Vedas.

original: vāg evargvedo mano yajurvedaḥ prāṇaḥ sāmavedaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vāc eva ṛgvedaḥ manaḥ yajurvedaḥ prāṇaḥ sāmavedaḥ
translated: The Rig Veda is speech, the Yajur Veda is mind, the Sama Veda is prana...

analyzed: devāḥ pitaraḥ manuṣyāḥ ete eva
translated: These are the gods, the ancestors, and humans.

analyzed: vāc eva devāḥ manaḥ pitaraḥ
translated: The gods are speech, the ancestors are mind,

analyzed: prāṇaḥ mānuṣyāḥ
translated: the humans are prana...

analyzed: pitā mātā prajā ete eva
translated: These are the father, the mother, and the offspring.

original: mana eva pitā vāṅ mātā prāṇaḥ prajā // / / //
analyzed: manaḥ eva pitā vāc mātā prāṇaḥ prajā
translated: The father is mind, the mother is speech, the offspring is prana...

analyzed: vijñātam vijijñāsyam a vijñātam ete eva
translated: These are what is known, what is to be known, and what is unknown.

original: yat kiñca vijñātaṃ vācas tad rūpam /
analyzed: yat kiñca vijñātam vācaḥ tat rūpam
translated: Whatever is known is the form of speech.

analyzed: vāc hi vijñātā
translated: Speech, indeed, is the known.

analyzed: vāc enam tat bhūtvā avati
translated: Speech, having become that, protects him.

original: yat kiñca vijijñāsyaṃ manasas tad rūpam /
analyzed: yat kiñca vijijñāsyam manasaḥ tat rūpam
translated: Whatever is to be known, that is the form of the mind.

analyzed: manaḥ hi vijijñāsyam
translated: The mind, indeed, is to be known.

original: mana enaṃ tad bhūtvāvati // / / //🔽yat kiñcāvijñātaṃ prāṇasya tad rūpam /
analyzed: manaḥ enam tat bhūtvā avati  yat kiñca a vijñātam prāṇasya tat rūpam
translated: The mind, having become that, protects him.🔽Whatever is not known, that is the form of the breath.

analyzed: prāṇaḥ hi a vijñātaḥ
translated: The breath, indeed, is not known.

analyzed: prāṇaḥ enam tat bhūtvā avati
translated: The breath, having become that, protects him.

analyzed: tasyai vācaḥ pṛthivī śarīram
translated: The body of that speech is the earth.

analyzed: jyotiḥ rūpam ayam agniḥ
translated: The luminous form is this fire.

original: tad yāvaty eva vāk tāvatī pṛthivī tāvān ayam agniḥ // / / //
analyzed: tat yāvatī eva vāc tāvatī pṛthivī tāvān ayam agniḥ
translated: As far as speech extends, so far extends the earth, so far extends this fire.

analyzed: atha etasya manasaḥ dyauḥ śarīram
translated: Now, the body of that mind is the sky.

analyzed: jyotiḥ rūpam asau ādityaḥ
translated: The luminous form is that sun.

original: tad yāvad eva manas tāvatī dyaus tāvān asāv ādityaḥ /
analyzed: tat yāvat eva manaḥ tāvatī dyauḥ tāvān asau ādityaḥ
translated: As far as the mind extends, so far extends the sky, so far extends that sun.

analyzed: tau mithunam samaitām
translated: Those two united.

analyzed: tatas prāṇaḥ jāyata
translated: From that the breath was born.

analyzed: saḥ indraḥ
translated: That is Indra.

analyzed: saḥ eṣaḥ sapatnaḥ
translated: He is the non-enemy.

analyzed: dvitīyaḥ vai sapatnaḥ
translated: The second, indeed, is the enemy.

original: nāsya sapatno bhavati ya evaṃ veda // / / //🔽athaitasya prāṇasyāpaḥ śarīram /🔽jyotīrūpam asau candraḥ /
analyzed: na asya sapatnaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda  atha etasya prāṇasya āpaḥ śarīram  jyotiḥ rūpam asau candraḥ
translated: He does not become an enemy to him who knows thus.🔽Now, the body of that breath is the water.🔽The luminous form is that moon.

original: tad yāvān eva prāṇas tāvatya āpas tāvān asau candraḥ /
analyzed: tat yāvān eva prāṇaḥ tāvatyaḥ āpaḥ tāvān asau candraḥ
translated: As far as the breath extends, so far extends the water, so far extends that moon.

original: ta ete sarva eva samāḥ sarve 'nantāḥ /🔽sa yo haitān antavata upāste 'ntavantaṃ sa lokaṃ jayati /
analyzed: te ete sarve eva samāḥ sarve nantāḥ  sa yaḥ ha etān antavataḥ upāste ntavantam sa lokam jayati
translated: All these are equal, all are infinite.🔽He who worships them as finite wins a finite world.

original: atha yo haitān anantān upāste 'nantaṃ sa lokaṃ jayati // / / //
analyzed: atha yaḥ ha etān anantān upāste nantam sa lokam jayati
translated: But he who worships them as infinite wins an infinite world.

analyzed: saḥ eṣa saṃvatsaraḥ prajāpatiḥ ṣoḍaśa kalaḥ
translated: This year, consisting of sixteen parts, is Prajapati.

analyzed: tasya rātrayaḥ eva pañcadaśa kalā
translated: Of it, the nights are the fifteen parts.

analyzed: dhruvā eva asya ṣoḍaśī kalā
translated: The firm one is its sixteenth part.

original: sa rātribhir evā ca pūryate 'pa ca kṣīyate /
analyzed: sa rātribhiḥ evā ca pūryate pa ca kṣīyate
translated: It is filled by the nights and diminished by them.

original: so 'māvāsyāṃ rātrim etayā ṣoḍaśyā kalayā sarvam idaṃ prāṇabhṛd anupraviśya tataḥ prātar jāyate /
analyzed: saḥ māvāsyām rātrim etayā ṣoḍaśyā kalayā sarvam idam prāṇabhṛt anupraviśya tatas prātar jāyate
translated: Having entered all these living beings with this sixteenth part on the new moon night, it is born again in the morning.

original: tasmād etāṃ rātriṃ prāṇabhṛtaḥ prāṇaṃ na vicchindyād api kṛkalāsasyaitasyā eva devatāyā apacityai // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt etām rātrim prāṇabhṛtaḥ prāṇam na vicchindyāt api kṛkalāsasya etasyāḥ eva devatāyāḥ apacityai
translated: Therefore, one should not cut off the life of any living being on that night, even of a lizard, lest he should diminish that deity.

original: yo vai sa saṃvatsaraḥ prajāpatiḥ ṣoḍaśakālo 'yam eva sa yo 'yam evaṃvit puruṣaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ vai sa saṃvatsaraḥ prajāpatiḥ ṣoḍaśa kālaḥ yam eva sa yaḥ yam evaṃvid puruṣaḥ
translated: He who knows this, that this year, consisting of sixteen parts, is this very person who knows thus,

analyzed: tasya vittam eva pañcadaśa kalāḥ
translated: his wealth is the fifteen parts.

analyzed: ātmā eva asya ṣoḍaśī kalā
translated: The self is his sixteenth part.

original: sa vittenaivā ca pūryate 'pa ca kṣīyate /
analyzed: sa vittena evā ca pūryate ca kṣīyate
translated: He is filled by wealth and diminished by it.

original: tad etan nabhyaṃ yad ayam ātmā /
analyzed: tat etat nabhyam yat ayam ātmā
translated: This Self is the nave.

analyzed: pradhiḥ vittam
translated: Wealth is the rim.

original: tasmād yady api sarvajyāniṃ jīyata ātmanā cej jīvati pradhināgād ity evāhuḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt yadi api sarva jyānim jīyate ātmanā ced jīvati pradhinā agāt iti eva āhuḥ
translated: Therefore, even if one is defeated in every battle, if he lives by the Self, they say he has not gone beyond the rim.

original: atha trayo vāva lokā manuṣyalokaḥ pitṛloko devaloka iti /
analyzed: atha trayaḥ vāva lokāḥ manuṣya lokaḥ pitṛ lokaḥ deva lokaḥ iti
translated: Now, there are indeed three worlds: the world of men, the world of the ancestors, and the world of the gods.

original: so 'yaṃ manuṣyalokaḥ putreṇaiva jayyo nānyena karmaṇā /
analyzed: saḥ yam manuṣya lokaḥ putreṇa eva jayyaḥ na anyena karmaṇā
translated: This world of men is to be conquered by a son alone, not by any other deed.

analyzed: karmaṇā pitṛ lokaḥ
translated: The world of the ancestors is by deed.

analyzed: vidyayā deva lokaḥ
translated: The world of the gods is by knowledge.

analyzed: deva lokaḥ vai lokānām śreṣṭhaḥ
translated: The world of the gods is indeed the best of the worlds.

analyzed: tasmāt vidyām praśaṃsanti
translated: Therefore, they praise knowledge.

original: athātaḥ samprattiḥ /🔽yadā praiṣyan manyate 'tha putram āha tvaṃ brahma tvaṃ yajñas tvaṃ loka iti /
analyzed: atha atas samprattiḥ  yadā praiṣyan manyate tha putram āha tvam brahma tvam yajñaḥ tvam lokaḥ iti
translated: Now, therefore, the handing over.🔽When he thinks of departing, then he says to his son: 'You are Brahman, you are the sacrifice, you are the world.'

original: sa putraḥ pratyāhāhaṃ brahmāhaṃ yajño 'ham loka iti /
analyzed: sa putraḥ pratyāha aham brahmā aham yajñaḥ ham lokaḥ iti
translated: That son replies: 'I am Brahman, I am the sacrifice, I am the world.'

original: yad vai kiñcānūktaṃ tasya sarvasya brahmety ekatā /
analyzed: yat vai kiñca anūktam tasya sarvasya brahma iti ekatā
translated: Whatever has been said, of all that Brahman is the unity.

original: ye vai ke ca yajñās teṣāṃ sarveṣāṃ yajña ity ekatā /
analyzed: ye vai ke ca yajñāḥ teṣām sarveṣām yajñaḥ iti ekatā
translated: Whatever sacrifices there are, of all of them the sacrifice is the unity.

original: ye vai ke ca lokās teṣāṃ sarveṣāṃ loka ity ekatā /
analyzed: ye vai ke ca lokāḥ teṣām sarveṣām lokaḥ iti ekatā
translated: Whatever worlds there are, of all of them the world is the unity.

analyzed: etāvat vai idam sarvam
translated: This much, indeed, is all.

original: etan mā sarvaṃ sann ayam ito bhunajad iti /
analyzed: etat mā sarvam san ayam itas bhunajat iti
translated: 'May he enjoy all this, existing here, through me.'

analyzed: tasmāt putram anuśiṣṭam lokyam āhuḥ
translated: Therefore they call a son who is instructed 'worthy of the world.'

analyzed: tasmāt enam anuśāsati
translated: Therefore he instructs him.

original: sa yadaivaṃvid asmāl lokāt praity athaibhir eva prāṇaiḥ saha putram āviśati /
analyzed: sa yadā evaṃvid asmāt lokāt praiti atha ebhiḥ eva prāṇaiḥ saha putram āviśati
translated: When he who knows thus departs from this world, then he enters his son together with these very vital breaths.

original: sa yady anena kiñcid akṣṇayā kṛtaṃ bhavati tasmād enaṃ sarvasmāt putro muñcati tasmāt putro nāma /
analyzed: sa yadi anena kiñcid akṣṇayā kṛtam bhavati tasmāt enam sarvasmāt putraḥ muñcati tasmāt putraḥ nāma
translated: If he has done anything wrong through him, then the son delivers him from all that. Therefore he is called a son.

analyzed: sa putreṇa eva asmin loke pratitiṣṭhati
translated: He finds support in this world through the son alone.

original: athainam ete devāḥ prāṇā amṛtā āviśanti // / / //
analyzed: atha enam ete devāḥ prāṇāḥ amṛtāḥ āviśanti
translated: Then these gods, the vital breaths, enter him, the immortal ones.

original: pṛthivyai cainam agneś ca daivī vāg āviśati /
analyzed: pṛthivyai ca enam agneḥ ca daivī vāc āviśati
translated: The divine speech of earth and of Agni enters him.

original: sā vai daivī vāg yayā yad yad eva vadati tat tad bhavati // / / //
analyzed: sā vai daivī vāc yayā yat yat eva vadati tat tat bhavati
translated: That is the divine speech, by which whatever one speaks becomes so.

original: divaś cainam ādityāc ca daivaṃ mana āviśati /
analyzed: divaḥ ca enam ādityāt ca daivam manaḥ āviśati
translated: The divine mind of heaven and of the sun enters him.

original: tad vai daivaṃ mano yenānandy eva bhavaty atho na śocati // / / //
analyzed: tat vai daivam manaḥ yena ānandī eva bhavati atha u na śocati
translated: That is the divine mind, by which one becomes joyful and does not grieve.

original: adbhyaś cainaṃ candramasaś ca daivaḥ prāṇa āviśati /
analyzed: adbhyaḥ ca enam candramasaḥ ca daivaḥ prāṇaḥ āviśati
translated: The divine breath of water and of the moon enters him.

original: sa vai daivaḥ prāṇo yaḥ saṃcaraṃś cāsaṃcaraṃś ca na vyathate 'tho na riṣyati /
analyzed: sa vai daivaḥ prāṇaḥ yaḥ saṃcaran ca a saṃcaran ca na vyathate na riṣyati
translated: That vital breath is divine, which is not injured, nor destroyed, while moving and not moving.

original: sa eṣa evaṃvit sarveṣāṃ bhūtānām ātmā bhavati /
analyzed: saḥ eṣaḥ evaṃvid sarveṣām bhūtānām ātmā bhavati
translated: He who knows this becomes the self of all beings.

analyzed: yathā eṣā devatā evam saḥ
translated: As is this divinity, so is he.

original: yathaitāṃ devatāṃ sarvāṇi bhūtāny avanty evaṃ haivaṃvidaṃ sarvāṇi bhūtāny avanti /
analyzed: yathā etām devatām sarvāṇi bhūtāni avanti evam ha evaṃvidam sarvāṇi bhūtāni avanti
translated: As all beings rest on this divinity, so do all beings rest on him who knows this.

original: yad u kiñcemāḥ prajāḥ śocanty amaivāsāṃ tad bhavati /
analyzed: yat u kiñca imāḥ prajāḥ śocanti amā eva āsām tat bhavati
translated: Whatever these people lament, that becomes as if it were.

analyzed: puṇyam eva amum gacchati
translated: Merit alone goes to him.

original: na ha vai devān pāpaṃ gacchati // / / //
analyzed: na ha vai devān pāpam gacchati
translated: For evil does not go to the gods.

analyzed: atha atas vrata mīmāṃsā
translated: Now, therefore, the investigation of vows.

analyzed: prajāpatiḥ ha karmāṇi sasṛje
translated: Prajapati created the acts.

analyzed: tāni sṛṣṭāni anyaḥ nyena aspardhanta
translated: Those created ones competed with each other.

analyzed: vadiṣyāmi eva aham iti vāc dadhre
translated: Speech grasped, I will speak.

analyzed: drakṣyāmi aham iti cakṣuḥ
translated: The eye, I will see.

analyzed: śroṣyāmi aham iti śrotram
translated: The ear, I will hear.

analyzed: evam anyāni karmāṇi yathākarmam
translated: And the other acts, each according to its function.

analyzed: tāni mṛtyuḥ śramaḥ bhūtvā upayeme
translated: Death, becoming fatigue, seized them.

analyzed: tāni āpnot
translated: He obtained them.

analyzed: tāni āptvā mṛtyuḥ avārundha
translated: Having obtained them, Death seized them.

analyzed: tasmāt śrāmyati eva vāc  śrāmyati cakṣuḥ
translated: Therefore, speech tires.🔽The eye tires.

analyzed: śrāmyati śrotram
translated: The ear tires.

original: athemam eva nāpnot yo 'yaṃ madhyamaḥ prāṇaḥ /
analyzed: atha imam eva na āpnot yaḥ yam madhyamaḥ prāṇaḥ
translated: Then they did not obtain this one, which is the middle breath.

analyzed: tāni jñātum dadhrire
translated: They set about to know it.

original: ayaṃ vai naḥ śreṣṭho yaḥ saṃcaraṃś cāsaṃcaraṃś ca na vyathate 'tho na riṣyati /
analyzed: ayam vai naḥ śreṣṭhaḥ yaḥ saṃcaran ca a saṃcaran ca na vyathate na riṣyati
translated: This one is the best of us, who, moving and not moving, is not pained and does not perish.

analyzed: hanta asya eva sarve rūpam bhavāma iti
translated: Let us all become his form.

analyzed: te etasya eva sarve rūpam abhavan
translated: They all became his form.

original: tasmād eta etenākhyāyante prāṇā iti /🔽tena ha vāva tat kulam ācakṣate yasmin kule bhavati ya evaṃ veda /
analyzed: tasmāt ete etena ākhyāyante prāṇāḥ iti  tena ha vāva tat kulam ācakṣate yasmin kule bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: Therefore, they are called by that name, 'prāṇa'.🔽And that family is said to be blessed in which he is born, who knows this.

analyzed: yaḥ u ha evaṃvidā spardhate nuśuṣyati
translated: But he who rivals him, knowing thus, dries up.

analyzed: anuśuṣya ha eva antatas mriyate iti adhyātmam
translated: Having dried up, he indeed dies in the end. Thus, in the individual self.

analyzed: atha adhidevatam
translated: Now, in the deities.

analyzed: jvaliṣyāmi eva aham iti agniḥ dadhre
translated: Agni conceived, 'I shall blaze.'

analyzed: tapsyāmi aham iti ādityaḥ
translated: Āditya (the sun), 'I shall heat.'

analyzed: bhāsyāmi aham iti candramāḥ
translated: Candrama (the moon), 'I shall shine.'

analyzed: evam anyāḥ devatāḥ yathādevatam
translated: And the other deities, according to their respective deities.

original: sa yathaiṣāṃ prāṇānāṃ madhyamaḥ prāṇa evam etāsāṃ devatānāṃ vāyuḥ /
