analyzed: sa yathā eṣām prāṇānām madhyamaḥ prāṇaḥ evam etāsām devatānām vāyuḥ
translated: Just as the middle breath is among these breaths, so is Vāyu among these deities.

original: mlocanti hy anyā devatā na vāyuḥ /
analyzed: mlocanti hi anyāḥ devatāḥ na vāyuḥ
translated: For the other deities close their eyes, but not Vāyu.

analyzed: sā eṣā an astamitā devatā yat vāyuḥ
translated: This Vāyu is the deity that does not set.

analyzed: atha eṣa ślokaḥ bhavati
translated: Now there is this verse:

original: yataś codeti sūryo 'staṃ yatra ca gacchatīti /
analyzed: yatas ca udeti sūryaḥ u stam yatra ca gacchati iti
translated: From which the sun rises and into which it sets.

original: prāṇād vā eṣa udeti prāṇe 'stam eti /
analyzed: prāṇāt vai eṣaḥ udeti prāṇe stam eti
translated: It rises from the breath and sets in the breath.

original: taṃ devāś cakrire dharmaṃ sa evādya sa u śva iti /
analyzed: tam devāḥ cakrire dharmam saḥ eva adya saḥ u śvas iti
translated: The gods made this rule, it is the same today as it was then.

original: yad vā ete 'murhy adhriyanta tad evāpy adya kurvanti /
analyzed: yat vai ete murhi adhriyanta tat eva api adya kurvanti
translated: Or whatever they did in the past, they do even today.

original: tasmād ekam eva vrataṃ caret prāṇyāc caivāpānyāc ca /
analyzed: tasmāt ekam eva vratam caret prāṇyāt ca eva apānyāt ca
translated: Therefore one should observe only one vow, to inhale and exhale.

original: nen mā pāpmā mṛtyur āpnavad iti /
analyzed: na id mā pāpmā mṛtyuḥ āpnavat iti
translated: So that sin and death may not overtake me.

original: yady u caret samāpipayiṣet teno etasyai devatāyai sāyujyaṃ salokatāṃ jayati // / / //
analyzed: yadi u caret samāpipayiṣet tena u etasyai devatāyai sāyujyam salokatām jayati
translated: If one does observe it, one should complete it. By that one conquers union with that deity, co-existence with it.

original: trayaṃ vā idaṃ nāma rūpaṃ karma /
analyzed: trayam vai idam nāma rūpam karma
translated: This is threefold: name, form, and action.

original: teṣāṃ nāmnāṃ vāg ity etad eṣām uktham /
analyzed: teṣām nāmnām vāc iti etat eṣām uktham
translated: Of those, speech is the praise of these names.

analyzed: atas hi sarvāṇi nāmāni uttiṣṭhanti
translated: For from it all names arise.

analyzed: etat eṣām sāma
translated: This is their Sāman.

analyzed: etat hi sarvaiḥ nāmabhiḥ samam
translated: For this is common to all names.

analyzed: etat eṣām brahma
translated: This is their Brahman.

analyzed: etat hi sarvāṇi nāmāni bibharti
translated: For this bears all names.

original: atha rūpāṇāṃ cakṣur ity etad eṣām uktham /
analyzed: atha rūpāṇām cakṣuḥ iti etat eṣām uktham
translated: Now of forms, the eye is the praise of these.

analyzed: atas hi sarvāṇi rūpāṇi uttiṣṭhanti
translated: For from it all forms arise.

analyzed: etat eṣām sāma
translated: This is their Sāman.

analyzed: etat hi sarvaiḥ rūpaiḥ samam
translated: For this is equal to all forms.

analyzed: etat eṣām brahma
translated: This is their Brahman.

analyzed: etat hi sarvāṇi rūpāṇi bibharti
translated: For this bears all forms.

original: atha karmaṇām ātmety etad eṣām uktham /
analyzed: atha karmaṇām ātmā iti etat eṣām uktham
translated: Now, as for the statement that the Self is the action, this is their hymn.

analyzed: atas hi sarvāṇi karmāṇi uttiṣṭhanti
translated: For from this all actions arise.

analyzed: etat eṣām sāma
translated: This is their Sāman.

analyzed: etat hi sarvaiḥ karmabhiḥ samam
translated: For this is equal to all actions.

analyzed: etat eṣām brahma
translated: This is their Brahman.

original: etad dhi sarvāṇi karmāṇi bibharti /🔽tad etat trayaṃ sad ekam ayam ātmā /
analyzed: etat hi sarvāṇi karmāṇi bibharti  tat etat trayam sat ekam ayam ātmā
translated: For this bears all actions.🔽This triad, being one, is this Self.

analyzed: ātmā u ekaḥ san etat trayam
translated: Being one, the Self is this triad.

analyzed: tat etat amṛtam satyena channam
translated: This is the immortal, covered by the true.

analyzed: prāṇaḥ vai amṛtam
translated: The life-breath is indeed the immortal.

analyzed: nāma rūpe satyam
translated: Name and form are the true.

analyzed: tābhyām ayam prāṇaḥ channaḥ
translated: This life-breath is covered by them.

analyzed: dṛptabālākiḥ ha anūcānaḥ gārgyaḥ āsa
translated: The proud young Gargya, the son of Hānū, was there.

original: sa hovācājātaśatruṃ kāśyaṃ brahma te bravāṇīti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca ajātaśatrum kāśyam brahma te bravāṇi iti
translated: He said to Ajātaśatru of Kāśi, I will tell you about Brahman.

original: sa hovācājātaśatruḥ sahasram etasyāṃ vāci dadmaḥ /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ sahasram etasyām vāci dadmaḥ
translated: Ajātaśatru said, We will give a thousand coins for this statement.

original: janako janaka iti vai janā dhāvantīti // / / //
analyzed: janakaḥ janakaḥ iti vai janāḥ dhāvanti iti
translated: People run around saying 'Janaka, Janaka.'

original: sa hovāca gārgyaḥ ya evāsāv āditye puruṣa etam evāhaṃ brahmopāsa iti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca gārgyaḥ yaḥ eva asau āditye puruṣaḥ etam eva aham brahma upāse iti
translated: Gargya said, The person who is in the sun, I meditate on him as Brahman.

analyzed: sa ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvadiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Ajatasatru said, 'Do not dispute with me about this.

original: atiṣṭhāḥ sarveṣāṃ bhūtānāṃ mūrdhā rājeti vā aham etam upāsa iti /
analyzed: atiṣṭhāḥ sarveṣām bhūtānām mūrdhā rājā iti vai aham etam upāse iti
translated: I worship him as the head and king of all beings.'

original: sa ya etam evam upāste 'tiṣṭhāḥ sarveṣāṃ bhūtānāṃ mūrdhā rājā bhavati // / / //
analyzed: sa yaḥ etam evam upāste tiṣṭhāḥ sarveṣām bhūtānām mūrdhā rājā bhavati
translated: He who worships him thus becomes the head and king of all beings.

original: sa hovāca gārgyaḥ ya evāsau candre puruṣa etam evāhaṃ brahmopāsa iti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca gārgyaḥ yaḥ eva asau candre puruṣaḥ etam eva aham brahma upāse iti
translated: Gargya said, 'The person who is in the moon, on him I meditate as Brahman.'

analyzed: sa ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvadiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Ajatasatru said, 'Do not dispute with me about this.

original: bṛhan pāṇdaravāsāḥ somo rājeti vā aham etam upāsa iti /
analyzed: bṛhan pāṇdara vāsāḥ somaḥ rājā iti vai aham etam upāse iti
translated: I worship him as the great, white-robed king Soma.

original: sa ya etam evam upāste 'harahar sutaḥ prasuto bhavati /
analyzed: sa yaḥ etam evam upāste harahar sutaḥ prasutaḥ bhavati
translated: He who worships him thus becomes pressed and well-pressed day by day.

analyzed: na asya annam kṣīyate
translated: His food is not exhausted.

original: sa hovāca gārgyaḥ ya evāsau vidyuti puruṣa etam evāhaṃ brahmopāsa iti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca gārgyaḥ yaḥ eva asau vidyuti puruṣaḥ etam eva aham brahma upāse iti
translated: Gargya said, 'The person who is in lightning, on him I meditate as Brahman.'

original: sa hovācājātaśatruḥ mā maitasmin saṃvadiṣṭhāḥ /🔽tejasvīti vā aham etam upāsa iti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvadiṣṭhāḥ  tejasvī iti vai aham etam upāse iti
translated: Ajatasatru said, 'Do not dispute with me about this.🔽I worship him as radiant.

original: sa ya etam evam upāste tejasvī ha bhavati /
analyzed: sa yaḥ etam evam upāste tejasvī ha bhavati
translated: He who worships him thus becomes radiant.

analyzed: tejasvinī ha asya prajā bhavati
translated: His offspring becomes radiant.

original: sa hovāca gārgyaḥ ya evāyam ākāśe puruṣa etam evāhaṃ brahmopāsa iti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca gārgyaḥ yaḥ eva ayam ākāśe puruṣaḥ etam eva aham brahma upāse iti
translated: Gargya said, 'The person who is in the ether, on him I meditate as Brahman.'

analyzed: sa ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvadiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Ajatasatru said, 'Do not dispute with me about this.

original: pūrṇam apravartīti vā aham etam upāsa iti /
analyzed: pūrṇam a pravarti iti vai aham etam upāse iti
translated: I meditate on him as full and unmoving.'

original: sa ya etam evam upāste pūryate prajayā paśubhir nāsyāsmāl lokāt prajodvartate // / / //
analyzed: sa yaḥ etam evam upāste pūryate prajayā paśubhiḥ na asya asmāt lokāt prajā udvartate
translated: He who meditates on him as such becomes full of offspring and cattle, and his offspring are not cut off from this world.

original: sa hovāca gārgyaḥ ya evāyaṃ vāyau puruṣa etam evāhaṃ brahmopāsa iti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca gārgyaḥ yaḥ eva ayam vāyau puruṣaḥ etam eva aham brahma upāse iti
translated: Gargya said, 'The person who is in the wind, on him I meditate as Brahman.'

analyzed: sa ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvadiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Ajatasatru said, 'Do not dispute with me about this.

original: indro vaikuṇṭho 'parājitā seneti vā aham etam upāsa iti /
analyzed: indraḥ vaikuṇṭhaḥ parājitā senā iti vai aham etam upāse iti
translated: I meditate on him as Indra, the invincible, the unconquered army.'

original: sa ya etam evam upāste jiṣṇur hāparājiṣṇur bhavaty anyatastyajāyī // / / //
analyzed: sa yaḥ etam evam upāste jiṣṇuḥ ha aparājiṣṇuḥ bhavati anyatastya jāyī
translated: He who meditates on him as such becomes victorious and invincible, and his enemies are destroyed from all sides.

original: sa hovāca gārgyaḥ ya evāyam agnau puruṣa etam evāhaṃ brahmopāsa iti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca gārgyaḥ yaḥ eva ayam agnau puruṣaḥ etam eva aham brahma upāse iti
translated: Gargya said, 'The person who is in the fire, on him I meditate as Brahman.'

analyzed: sa ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvadiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Ajatasatru said, 'Do not dispute with me about this.

original: viṣāsahir iti vā aham etam upāsa iti /
analyzed: viṣāsahiḥ iti vai aham etam upāse iti
translated: I meditate on him as the one who conquers poison.'

original: sa ya etam evam upāste viṣāsahir ha bhavati /
analyzed: sa yaḥ etam evam upāste viṣāsahiḥ ha bhavati
translated: He who meditates on him as such becomes a conqueror of poison.

analyzed: viṣāsahiḥ ha asya prajā bhavati
translated: He who meditates on him as the conqueror of poison becomes the conqueror of poison.

original: sa hovāca gārgyaḥ ya evāyam apsu puruṣa etam evāhaṃ brahmopāsa iti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca gārgyaḥ yaḥ eva ayam apsu puruṣaḥ etam eva aham brahma upāse iti
translated: Gargya said, 'The person who is in the waters, on him indeed do I meditate as Brahman.'

analyzed: sa ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvadiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Ajatasatru said, 'Do not dispute with me about this.

original: pratirūpa iti vā aham etam upāsa iti /
analyzed: pratirūpaḥ iti vai aham etam upāse iti
translated: I meditate on him as the one who is like an image.'

original: sa ya etam evam upāste pratirūpaṃ haivainam upagacchati nāpratirūpam /
analyzed: sa yaḥ etam evam upāste pratirūpam ha eva enam upagacchati na apratirūpam
translated: He who meditates on him as such, indeed, approaches him as one who is like an image, not unlike an image.

analyzed: atha u pratirupaḥ smāt jāyate
translated: Moreover, he is born as one who is like an image from him.

original: sa hovāca gārgyaḥ ya evāyam ādarśe puruṣa etam evāhaṃ brahmopāsa iti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca gārgyaḥ yaḥ eva ayam ādarśe puruṣaḥ etam eva aham brahma upāse iti
translated: Gargya said, 'The person who is in the mirror, on him indeed do I meditate as Brahman.'

analyzed: sa ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvadiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Ajatasatru said, 'Do not dispute with me about this.

original: rociṣṇur iti vā aham etam upāsa iti /
analyzed: rociṣṇuḥ iti vai aham etam upāse iti
translated: I meditate on him as the shining one.'

original: sa ya etam evam upāste rociṣṇur ha bhavati /
analyzed: sa yaḥ etam evam upāste rociṣṇuḥ ha bhavati
translated: He who meditates on him as such, indeed, becomes shining.

analyzed: rociṣṇuḥ ha asya prajā bhavati
translated: His offspring becomes shining.

analyzed: atha u yaiḥ saṃnigacchati
translated: Moreover, whoever he associates with,

analyzed: sarvān tān atirocate
translated: he outshines them all.

original: sa hovāca gārgyaḥ ya evāyaṃ yantaṃ paścāc chabbo 'nūdety etam evāhaṃ brahmopāsa iti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca gārgyaḥ yaḥ eva ayam yantam paścāt śabbaḥ nūdeti etam eva aham brahma upāse iti
translated: Gargya said, 'The person who follows after one who is going, on him indeed do I meditate as Brahman.'

analyzed: sa ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvadiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Ajatasatru said, 'Do not dispute with me about this.

original: asur iti vā aham etam upāsa iti /
analyzed: asuḥ iti vai aham etam upāse iti
translated: I worship him as the Asura.

original: sa ya etam evam upāste sarvaṃ haivāsmiṃl loka āyur eti /
analyzed: sa yaḥ etam evam upāste sarvam ha eva asmin loke āyuḥ eti
translated: He who worships him thus attains the full life-span in this world.

analyzed: na enam purā kālāt prāṇaḥ jahāti
translated: Before his time, the vital breath does not abandon him.'

original: sa hovāca gārgyaḥ ya evāyaṃ dikṣu puruṣa etam evāhaṃ brahmopāsa iti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca gārgyaḥ yaḥ eva ayam dikṣu puruṣaḥ etam eva aham brahma upāse iti
translated: Gargya said, 'The person who is in the directions, on him indeed do I meditate as Brahman.'

analyzed: sa ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvadiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Ajatasatru said, 'Do not dispute with me about this.

original: dvitīyo 'napaga iti vā aham etam upāsa iti /
analyzed: dvitīyaḥ napagaḥ iti vai aham etam upāse iti
translated: I worship him as the second, the non-departing.

original: sa ya etam evam upāste dvitīyavān ha bhavati /
analyzed: sa yaḥ etam evam upāste dvitīyavān ha bhavati
translated: He who worships him thus becomes possessed of a second.

analyzed: na asmāt gaṇaḥ chidyate
translated: His group is not cut off from him.'

original: sa hovāca gārgyaḥ ya evāyaṃ chāyāmayaḥ puruṣa etam evāhaṃ brahmopāsa iti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca gārgyaḥ yaḥ eva ayam chāyā mayaḥ puruṣaḥ etam eva aham brahma upāse iti
translated: Gargya said, 'The person who is made of shadow, on him indeed do I meditate as Brahman.'

analyzed: sa ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvadiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Ajatasatru said, 'Do not dispute with me about this.

original: mṛtyur iti vā aham etam upāsa iti /
analyzed: mṛtyuḥ iti vai aham etam upāse iti
translated: I worship him as Death.

original: sa ya etam evam upāste sarvaṃ haivāsmiṃl loka āyur eti /
analyzed: sa yaḥ etam evam upāste sarvam ha eva asmin loke āyuḥ eti
translated: He who worships him thus attains the full life-span in this world.

analyzed: na enam purā kālāt mṛtyuḥ āgacchati
translated: Before his time, Death does not come to him.'

original: sa hovāca gārgyaḥ ya evāyam ātmani puruṣa etam evāhaṃ brahmopāsa iti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca gārgyaḥ yaḥ eva ayam ātmani puruṣaḥ etam eva aham brahma upāse iti
translated: Gargya said, 'The person who is in the self, on him I meditate as Brahman.'

analyzed: sa ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvadiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Ajatasatru said, 'Do not dispute with me about this.

original: ātmanvīti vā aham etam upāsa iti /
analyzed: ātmanvī iti vai aham etam upāse iti
translated: I meditate on him as the self-possessor.'

original: sa ya etam evam upāsta ātmanvī ha bhavati /
analyzed: sa yaḥ etam evam upāste ātmanvī ha bhavati
translated: One who meditates on him as such becomes self-possessed.

analyzed: ātmanvinī ha asya prajā bhavati
translated: His offspring become self-possessed.

original: sa ha tūṣṇīm āsa gārgyaḥ // / / //🔽sa hovācājātaśatruḥ etāvan iti /
analyzed: sa ha tūṣṇīm āsa gārgyaḥ  sa ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ etāvat nu iti
translated: Gargya became silent.🔽Ajatasatru said, 'This much.'

analyzed: etāvat hi iti
translated: 'This much is it,' (said Gargya).

analyzed: na etāvatā viditam bhavati iti
translated: 'It is not known by this much.'

analyzed: sa ha uvāca gārgyaḥ upa tvā ayāni iti
translated: Gargya said, 'I will come to you.'

original: sa hovācājātaśatruḥ pratilomaṃ caitad yad brāhmaṇaḥ kṣatriyam upeyād brahma me vakṣyatīti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ pratilomam ca etat yat brāhmaṇaḥ kṣatriyam upeyāt brahma me vakṣyati iti
translated: Ajatasatru said, 'It is contrary that a Brahmin should come to a Kshatriya, thinking, He will teach me Brahman.

analyzed: vi eva tvā jñapayiṣyāmi iti
translated: I will make you understand.'

analyzed: tam pāṇau ādāya uttasthau
translated: He took him by the hand and rose up.

analyzed: tau ha puruṣam suptam ājagmatuḥ
translated: They came to a sleeping man.

original: tam etair nāmabhir āmantrayāṃ cakre bṛhan pāṇdaravāsaḥ soma rājann iti /
analyzed: tam etaiḥ nāmabhiḥ āmantrayām cakre bṛhan pāṇdara vāsaḥ soma rājan iti
translated: He addressed him with these names, 'Great one, white-robed one, Soma, king.'

analyzed: sa na uttasthau  tam pāṇinā apeṣam bodhayāṃ cakāra
translated: He did not rise up.🔽He woke him up by rubbing him with his hand.

analyzed: sa ha uttasthau
translated: He rose up.

original: sa hovācājātaśatruḥ yatraiṣa etat supto 'bhūd ya eṣa vijñānamayaḥ puruṣaḥ kvaiṣa tadābhūt kuta etad āgād iti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ yatra eṣaḥ etat suptaḥ bhūt yaḥ eṣa vijñāna mayaḥ puruṣaḥ kva eṣa tadā abhūt kutas etat āgāt iti
translated: Ajatasatru said: 'When this person here was asleep, where was he then? Whence did he come?'

original: tad u ha na mene gārgyaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tat u ha na mene gārgyaḥ
translated: Gargya did not accept this.

original: sa hovācājātaśatruḥ yatraiṣa etat supto 'bhūd ya eṣa vijñānamayaḥ puruṣas tad eṣāṃ prāṇānāṃ vijñānena vijnānam ādāya ya eṣo 'ntar hṛdaya
analyzed: sa ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ yatra eṣaḥ etat suptaḥ bhūt yaḥ eṣa vijñāna mayaḥ puruṣaḥ tat eṣām prāṇānām vijñānena vijnānam ādāya yaḥ eṣaḥ ntar hṛdaya
translated: Ajatasatru said: 'When this person here was asleep, then this person consisting of knowledge took away the knowledge of these vital breaths and went to that space within the heart.

analyzed: ākāśaḥ tasmin śete
translated: There he lies.

original: tāni yadā gṛhṇāti /🔽atha haitat puruṣaḥ svapiti nāma /
analyzed: tāni yadā gṛhṇāti  atha ha etat puruṣaḥ svapiti nāma
translated: When he takes hold of them,🔽then this person is said to be sleeping.

analyzed: tat gṛhītaḥ eva prāṇaḥ bhavati
translated: Then the vital breath is indeed taken hold of.

analyzed: gṛhītā vāc  gṛhītam cakṣuḥ
translated: Speech is taken hold of.🔽The eye is taken hold of.

analyzed: gṛhītam śrotram
translated: The ear is taken hold of.

analyzed: gṛhītam manaḥ
translated: The mind is taken hold of.

original: sa yatraitat svapnyayā carati te hāsya lokāḥ /
analyzed: sa yatra etat svapnyayā carati te ha asya lokāḥ
translated: When he moves about in dreams, those are his worlds.

original: tad uteva mahārājo bhavaty uteva mahābrāhmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: tat uta iva mahā rājaḥ bhavati uta iva mahā brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: He becomes like a great king, like a great Brahmin.

analyzed: uta iva uccāvacam nigacchati
translated: He goes to high and low places.

original: sa yathā mahārājo jānapadān gṛhītvā sve janapade yathākāmaṃ parivartetaivam evaiṣa etat prāṇān gṛhītvā sve śarīre yathākāmaṃ parivartate //
analyzed: sa yathā mahā rājaḥ jānapadān gṛhītvā sve janapade yathākāmam parivarteta evam eva eṣa etat prāṇān gṛhītvā sve śarīre yathākāmam parivartate
translated: Just as a great king, having seized the people of the provinces, would move about in his own country as he wishes, so this one, having seized the vital breaths, moves about in his own body as he wishes.

analyzed: atha yadā suṣuptaḥ bhavati
translated: Now when he is in deep sleep,

analyzed: yadā na kasya cana veda
translated: when he knows nothing at all,

original: hitā nāma nādyo dvāsaptatiḥ sahasrāṇi hṛdayāt purītatam abhipratiṣṭhante /
analyzed: hitāḥ nāma nādyaḥ dvāsaptatiḥ sahasrāṇi hṛdayāt purītatam abhipratiṣṭhante
translated: there are seventy-two thousand channels called 'beneficial' that go from the heart to the brahma-granthi.

analyzed: tābhiḥ pratyavasṛpya purītati śete
translated: Having entered them, he lies in the brahma-granthi.

original: sa yathā kumāro add / vā mahārājo vā mahābrāhmaṇo vātighnīm ānandasya gatvā śayīta /
analyzed: sa yathā kumāraḥ vā mahā rājaḥ vā mahā brāhmaṇaḥ vā atighnīm ānandasya gatvā śayīta
translated: Just as a young boy or a great king or a great Brahmin would lie down after going to a very comfortable bed,

analyzed: evam eva eṣa etat śete
translated: so does he lie down in this way.

original: sa yathorṇavābhis tantunoccared yathā agneḥ kṣudrā viṣphuliṅgā vyuccaranty evam evāsmād ātmanaḥ sarve prāṇāḥ sarve lokāḥ sarve devāḥ sarvāṇi
analyzed: sa yathā ūrṇavābhiḥ tantunā uccaret yathā agneḥ kṣudrāḥ viṣphuliṅgāḥ vyuccaranti evam eva asmāt ātmanaḥ sarve prāṇāḥ sarve lokāḥ sarve devāḥ sarvāṇi
translated: Just as threads come out of wool, or as small sparks come out of a fire, in the same way all the vital breaths, all the worlds, all the gods, all the

analyzed: bhūtāni vyuccaranti
translated: beings come out of this Self.

analyzed: tasya upaniṣad satyasya satyam iti
translated: Its Upaniṣad is 'The truth of truth.'

original: prāṇā vai satyaṃ teṣām eṣa satyam // / / //
analyzed: prāṇāḥ vai satyam teṣām eṣa satyam
translated: The vital breaths are the truth, and this is the truth of them.

original: yo ha vai śiśuṃ sādhānaṃ sapratyādhānaṃ sasthūṇaṃ sadāmaṃ veda sapta ha dviṣato bhrātṛvyān avaruṇaddhi /
analyzed: yaḥ ha vai śiśum sa ādhānam sa pratyādhānam sa sthūṇam sa dāmam veda sapta ha dviṣataḥ bhrātṛvyān avaruṇaddhi
translated: He who knows the child with the foundation, the counter-foundation, the post, and the rope, overcomes seven hating enemies.

original: ayaṃ vāva śiśur yo 'yaṃ madhyamaḥ prāṇaḥ /
analyzed: ayam vāva śiśuḥ yaḥ yam madhyamaḥ prāṇaḥ
translated: This child, indeed, is the middle vital breath in this (body).

original: tasyedam evādhānam idaṃ pratyādhānaṃ prāṇaḥ sthūṇānnaṃ dāma // / / //
analyzed: tasya idam eva ādhānam idam pratyādhānam prāṇaḥ sthūṇā annam dāma
translated: Its foundation is this (earth), its counter-foundation is that (sky), the post is the vital breath, and the rope is food.

analyzed: tam etāḥ sapta akṣitayaḥ upatiṣṭhante
translated: These seven eyes attend on it.

original: tad yā imā akṣaṃl lohinyo rājayas tābhir enaṃ rudro 'nvāyattaḥ /
analyzed: tat yāḥ imāḥ akṣan lohinyaḥ rājayaḥ tābhiḥ enam rudraḥ nu āyattaḥ
translated: Rudra is connected with it by those red streaks in the eye.

original: atha yā akṣann āpas tābhiḥ parjanyaḥ /
analyzed: atha yāḥ akṣan āpaḥ tābhiḥ parjanyaḥ
translated: Parjanya (rain) by the water in the eye.

analyzed: yā kanīnakā tayā ādityaḥ  yat kṛṣṇam tena agniḥ
translated: The sun by the pupil.🔽Fire by the black (part).

original: yac chuklaṃ tenendraḥ /🔽adharayainaṃ vartanyā pṛthivy anvāyattā /
analyzed: yat śuklam tena indraḥ  adharayā enam vartanyā pṛthivī anvāyattā
translated: Indra by the white (part).🔽The earth is connected with it by the lower part.

analyzed: dyauḥ uttarayā
translated: The sky by the upper part.

analyzed: na asya annam kṣīyate yaḥ evam veda
translated: The food of him who knows thus is not exhausted.

analyzed: tat eṣa ślokaḥ bhavati
translated: This verse is about it:

original: arvāgbilaś camasa ūrdhvabudhnas tasmin yaśo nihitaṃ viśvarūpam /
analyzed: arvāc bilaḥ camasaḥ ūrdhva budhnaḥ tasmin yaśaḥ nihitam viśva rūpam
translated: The bowl with the opening below and the bottom above, in which is placed fame of all forms,

original: tasyāsata ṛṣayaḥ sapta tīre vāg aṣṭamī brahmaṇā saṃvidāneti /
analyzed: tasya āsata ṛṣayaḥ sapta tīre vāc aṣṭamī brahmaṇā saṃvidānā iti
translated: on its shore the seven seers sit, speech, the eighth, in agreement with Brahman.

analyzed: arvāc bilaḥ camasaḥ ūrdhva budhnaḥ iti
translated: The bowl with the opening below and the bottom above.

original: idaṃ tac charīra eṣa hy arvāgbilaś camasa ūrdhvabudhnaḥ /
analyzed: idam tat śarīre eṣa hi arvāc bilaḥ camasaḥ ūrdhva budhnaḥ
translated: This is that body, for this is the bowl with its opening downward and its bottom upward.

analyzed: tasmin yaśaḥ nihitam viśva rūpam iti
translated: In it is placed fame of all forms.

analyzed: prāṇāḥ vai yaśaḥ viśva rūpam
translated: Fame is the vital breaths, of all forms.

analyzed: prāṇān etat āha
translated: He says this about the vital breaths.

analyzed: tasya āsata ṛṣayaḥ sapta tīre iti
translated: In it the seven seers are the banks.

analyzed: prāṇāḥ vai ṛṣayaḥ
translated: The seers are the vital breaths.

original: prāṇāṇ etad āha /🔽vāg aṣṭamī brahmaṇā saṃvidāneti /
analyzed: etat āha  vāc aṣṭamī brahmaṇā saṃvidānā iti
translated: He says this about the vital breaths.🔽Speech is the eighth, in agreement with Brahman.

analyzed: vāc ghi aṣṭamī brahmaṇā saṃvitte
translated: For speech is the eighth, in agreement with Brahman.

analyzed: imau eva gotama bharadvājau
translated: These two are Gautama and Bharadvaja.

analyzed: ayam eva gotamaḥ yam bharadvājaḥ
translated: This one is Gautama, this one is Bharadvaja.

analyzed: imau eva viśvāmitra jamadagnī
translated: These two are Vishvamitra and Jamadagni.

analyzed: ayam eva viśvāmitraḥ yam jamadagniḥ
translated: This one is Vishvamitra, this one is Jamadagni.

analyzed: imau eva vasiṣṭha kaśyapau
translated: These two are Vasishtha and Kashyapa.

analyzed: ayam eva vasiṣṭhaḥ yam kaśyapaḥ
translated: This one is Vasishtha, this one is Kashyapa.

analyzed: vāc eva atriḥ
translated: Speech is Atri.

analyzed: vācā hi annam adyate
translated: For by speech food is eaten.

original: attir ha vai nāmaitad yad autrir iti /
analyzed: attiḥ ha vai nāma etat yat autriḥ iti
translated: Atri is indeed this name of his, that is, of Atri.

analyzed: sarvasya attā bhavati
translated: He becomes the eater of all.

original: sarvam asyānnaṃ bhavati ya evaṃ veda // / / //
analyzed: sarvam asya annam bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: All food becomes his who knows this thus.

original: dve vāva brahmaṇo rūpe /🔽mūrtaṃ caivāmūrtaṃ ca /
analyzed: dve vāva brahmaṇaḥ rūpe  mūrtam ca eva amūrtam ca
translated: Brahman indeed has two forms.🔽The embodied and the unembodied,

analyzed: martyam ca amṛtam ca
translated: the mortal and the immortal,

analyzed: sthitam ca yat ca
translated: the existing and the non-existing.

analyzed: sat ca tyam ca
translated: That which is real and that which is eternal.

original: tad etan mūrtaṃ yad anyad vāyoś cāntarikṣāc ca /
analyzed: tat etat mūrtam yat anyat vāyoḥ ca antarikṣāt ca
translated: This is the manifest, what is other than wind and space.

analyzed: etat martyam
translated: This is mortal.

analyzed: etat sthitam
translated: This is what stands.

analyzed: etat sat
translated: This is what is real.

original: tasyaitasya mūrtasyaitasya martyasyaitasya sthitasyaitasya sata eṣa raso ya eṣa tapati /
analyzed: tasya etasya mūrtasya etasya martyasya etasya sthitasya etasya sataḥ eṣa rasaḥ yaḥ eṣa tapati
translated: The essence of this manifest, this mortal, this standing, this real, is that which shines.

analyzed: sataḥ hi eṣa rasaḥ
translated: For he is the essence of what is real.

analyzed: atha amūrtam
translated: Now, the unmanifest.

analyzed: vāyuḥ ca antarikṣaḥ ca
translated: Wind and space.

analyzed: etat amṛtam  etat yat
translated: This is immortal.🔽This is what moves.

original: etat tyam /🔽tasyaitasyāmūrtasyaitasyāmṛtasyaitasya yata etasya tyasyaiṣa raso ya eṣa etasmin maṇḍale puruṣaḥ /
analyzed: etat tyam  tasya etasya amūrtasya etasya amṛtasya etasya yataḥ etasya tyasya eṣa rasaḥ yaḥ eṣaḥ etasmin maṇḍale puruṣaḥ
translated: This is what is eternal.🔽The essence of this unmanifest, this immortal, this moving, this eternal, is the person in this sphere.

analyzed: tyasya hi eṣa rasa
translated: For he is the essence of what is eternal.

analyzed: iti adhidaivatam
translated: Thus, in relation to the gods.

analyzed: atha adhyātmam
translated: Now, in relation to the self.

original: idam eva mūrtaṃ yad anyat prāṇāc ca yaś cāyam antar ātmann ākāśaḥ /
analyzed: idam eva mūrtam yat anyat prāṇāt ca yaḥ ca ayam antar ātman ākāśaḥ
translated: This very manifest is what is other than the vital breath and what is this space within the self.

analyzed: etat martyam
translated: This is mortal.

analyzed: etat sthitam
translated: This is what stands.

analyzed: etat sat
translated: This is what is real.

original: tasyaitasya mūrtasyaitasya martyasyaitasya sthitasyaitasya sata eṣa raso yac cakṣuḥ /
analyzed: tasya etasya mūrtasya etasya martyasya etasya sthitasya etasya sataḥ eṣa rasaḥ yat cakṣuḥ
translated: The essence of this manifest, this mortal, this standing, this real, is the eye.

analyzed: sataḥ hi eṣa rasaḥ
translated: For it is the essence of what is real.

original: athāmūrtaṃ prāṇaś ca yaś cāyam antar ātmann ākāśaḥ /
analyzed: atha amūrtam prāṇaḥ ca yaḥ ca ayam antar ātman ākāśaḥ
translated: Now, the formless is the breath and this space within the self.

analyzed: etat amṛtam
translated: This is the immortal.

analyzed: etat yat
translated: This is the what.

analyzed: etat tyad
translated: This is the that.🔽The essence of this formless, immortal, what, and that is this person in the right eye.

original: tasyaitasyāmūrtasyaitasyāmṛtasyaitasya yata etasya tyasyaiṣa raso yo 'yaṃ dakṣiṇe 'kṣan puruṣaḥ /🔽tyasya hy eṣa rasaḥ // / / //🔽tasya haitasya puruṣasya rūpam /
analyzed: tasya etasya amūrtasya etasya amṛtasya etasya yatas etasya tyasya eṣa rasaḥ yaḥ yam dakṣiṇe kṣan puruṣaḥ  tyasya hi eṣa rasaḥ  tasya ha etasya puruṣasya rūpam
translated: For he is the essence of that what and that.

original: yathā māhārajanaṃ vāso yathā pāṇḍvāvikaṃ yathendragopo yathāgnyarcir yathā puṇḍarīkaṃ yathā sakṛdvidyuttam /
analyzed: yathā māhārajanam vāsaḥ yathā pāṇḍvāvikam yathā indragopaḥ yathā agnyarciḥ yathā puṇḍarīkam yathā sakṛdvidyuttam
translated: Now, the form of this person is like a cloth of fine wool, like a peacock's neck, like a firefly, like a lotus, like a flash of lightning.

original: sakṛdvidyutteva ha vā asya śrīr bhavati ya evaṃ veda /
analyzed: sakṛt vidyuttā iva ha vai asya śrīḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: One's glory becomes like a flash of lightning for one who knows this.

analyzed: atha atas ādeśaḥ na iti na iti
translated: Now, therefore, the teaching: Not so! Not so!

original: na hy etasmād iti nety anyat param asti /
analyzed: na hi etasmāt iti na iti anyat param asti
translated: For there is nothing higher than this, not so!

analyzed: atha nāmadheyam satyasya satyam iti
translated: Now, the name is The Truth of Truth.

analyzed: prāṇāḥ vai satyam
translated: The vital breaths are the truth.

original: teṣām eṣa satyam // / / //🔽maitreyīti hovāca yājñavalkyaḥ udyāsyan vā are 'ham asmāt sthānād asmi /
analyzed: teṣām eṣa satyam  maitreyi iti ha uvāca yājñavalkyaḥ udyāsyan vai are ham asmāt sthānāt asmi
translated: Of them, this is the truth.🔽Maitreyi, Yajnavalkya said, I am about to depart from this place.

analyzed: hanta te naya kātyāyanyā antam karavāṇi iti
translated: Let me conclude with you and Katyayani.

original: sā hovāca maitreyī yan nu ma iyaṃ bhagoḥ sarvā pṛthivī vittena pūrṇā syāt kathaṃ tenāmṛtā syām iti /
analyzed: sā ha uvāca maitreyī yat nu me iyam sarvā pṛthivī vittena pūrṇā syāt katham tena amṛtā syām iti
translated: Maitreyi said, 'If this entire earth filled with wealth were mine, would I thereby become immortal?'

analyzed: na iti ha uvāca yājñavalkyaḥ
translated: Yajnavalkya said, 'No.'

original: yathaivopakaraṇavatāṃ jīvitaṃ tathaiva te jīvitaṃ syāt /
analyzed: yathā eva upakaraṇavatām jīvitam tathā eva te jīvitam syāt
translated: 'Just as the life of those who have means of livelihood, so would your life be.

analyzed: amṛta tvasya tu na āśā asti vittena iti
translated: But there is no way to immortality through wealth.'

original: sā hovāca maitreyī yenāhaṃ nāmṛtā syāṃ kim ahaṃ tena kuryām /
analyzed: sā ha uvāca maitreyī yena aham na amṛtā syām kim aham tena kuryām
translated: Maitreyi said, 'What should I do with that by which I do not become immortal?

original: yad eva bhagavān veda tad eva me brūhīti // / / //
analyzed: yat eva bhagavān veda tat eva me brūhi iti
translated: Tell me that which you know.'

original: sa hovāca yājñavalkyaḥ priyā batāre naḥ satī priyaṃ bhāṣase /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca yājñavalkyaḥ priyā bata are naḥ satī priyam bhāṣase
translated: Yajnavalkya said, 'You speak what is dear to me, O my beloved, when you say this.

analyzed: ehi āssva
translated: Come, sit down.

analyzed: vyākhyāsyāmi te
translated: I will explain it to you.

original: vyācakṣāṇasya tu me nididhyāsasveti // / / //🔽sa hovāca na vā are patyuḥ kāmāya patiḥ priyo bhavaty ātmanas tu kāmāya patiḥ priyo bhavati /
analyzed: vyācakṣāṇasya tu me nididhyāsasva iti  sa ha uvāca na vai are patyuḥ kāmāya patiḥ priyaḥ bhavati ātmanaḥ tu kāmāya patiḥ priyaḥ bhavati
translated: But while I am explaining, reflect on it.'🔽He said, 'Verily, O my beloved, a husband is not dear for the sake of the wife, but a husband is dear for one's own sake.

original: na vā are jāyāyai kāmāya jāyā priyā bhavaty ātmanas tu kāmāya jāyā priyā bhavati /
analyzed: na vai are jāyāyai kāmāya jāyā priyā bhavati ātmanaḥ tu kāmāya jāyā priyā bhavati
translated: Verily, a wife is not dear for the sake of the husband, but a wife is dear for one's own sake.

original: na vā are putrāṇāṃ kāmāya putrāḥ priyā bhavanty ātmanas tu kāmāya putrāḥ priyā bhavanti /
analyzed: na vai are putrāṇām kāmāya putrāḥ priyāḥ bhavanti ātmanaḥ tu kāmāya putrāḥ priyāḥ bhavanti
translated: 'Verily, children are not dear for the sake of children, but for the sake of the self are children dear.

original: na vā are vittasya kāmāya vittaṃ priyaṃ bhavaty ātmanas tu kāmāya vittaṃ priyaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: na vai are vittasya kāmāya vittam priyam bhavati ātmanaḥ tu kāmāya vittam priyam bhavati
translated: 'Verily, wealth is not dear for the sake of wealth, but for the sake of the self is wealth dear.

original: na vā are brahmaṇaḥ kāmāya brahma priyaṃ bhavaty ātmanas tu kāmāya brahma priyaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: na vai are brahmaṇaḥ kāmāya brahma priyam bhavati ātmanaḥ tu kāmāya brahma priyam bhavati
translated: 'Verily, Brahman is not dear for the sake of Brahman, but for the sake of the self is Brahman dear.

original: na vā are kṣatrasya kāmāya kṣatraṃ priyaṃ bhavaty ātmanas tu kāmāya kṣatraṃ priyaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: na vai are kṣatrasya kāmāya kṣatram priyam bhavati ātmanaḥ tu kāmāya kṣatram priyam bhavati
translated: 'Verily, the Kshatriya is not dear for the sake of the Kshatriya, but for the sake of the self is the Kshatriya dear.

original: na vā are lokānāṃ kāmāya lokāḥ priyā bhavanty ātmanas tu kāmāya lokāḥ priyā bhavanti /
analyzed: na vai are lokānām kāmāya lokāḥ priyāḥ bhavanti ātmanaḥ tu kāmāya lokāḥ priyāḥ bhavanti
translated: 'Verily, the worlds are not dear for the sake of the worlds, but for the sake of the self are the worlds dear.

original: na vā are devānāṃ kāmāya devāḥ priyā bhavanty ātmanas tu kāmāya devāḥ priyā bhavanti /
analyzed: na vai are devānām kāmāya devāḥ priyāḥ bhavanti ātmanaḥ tu kāmāya devāḥ priyāḥ bhavanti
translated: 'Verily, the gods are not dear for the sake of the gods, but for the sake of the self are the gods dear.

original: na vā are bhūtānāṃ kāmāya bhūtāni priyāṇi bhavanty ātmanas tu kāmāya bhūtāni priyāṇi bhavanti /
analyzed: na vai are bhūtānām kāmāya bhūtāni priyāṇi bhavanti ātmanaḥ tu kāmāya bhūtāni priyāṇi bhavanti
translated: 'Verily, the beings are not dear for the sake of the beings, but for the sake of the self are the beings dear.'

original: na vā are sarvasya kāmāya sarvaṃ priyaṃ bhavaty ātmanas tu kāmāya sarvaṃ priyaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: na vai are sarvasya kāmāya sarvam priyam bhavati ātmanaḥ tu kāmāya sarvam priyam bhavati
translated: Verily, O dear one, everything is not dear for the sake of all; but everything is dear for the sake of the self.

original: ātmā vā are draṣṭavyaḥ śrotavyo mantavyo nididhyāsitavyo maitreyi /
analyzed: ātmā vai are draṣṭavyaḥ śrotavyaḥ mantavyaḥ nididhyāsitavyaḥ maitreyi
translated: Verily, O dear Maitreyi, the self is to be seen, to be heard, to be perceived, to be reflected upon.

original: ātmano vā are darśanena śravaṇena matyā vijñānenedaṃ sarvaṃ viditam // / / //

analyzed: idam mānuṣam sarveṣām bhūtānām madhu
translated: This is the honey of all beings.

analyzed: asya mānuṣasya sarvāṇi bhūtāni madhu
translated: All beings are the honey of this human being.

original: yaś cāyam asmin mānuṣe tejomayo 'mṛtamayaḥ puruṣo yaś cāyam adhyātmaṃ mānuṣas tejomayo 'mṛtamayaḥ puruṣo 'yam eva sa yo 'yam ātmā /
analyzed: yaḥ ca ayam asmin mānuṣe tejaḥ mayaḥ mṛta mayaḥ puruṣaḥ yaḥ ca ayam adhyātmam mānuṣaḥ tejaḥ mayaḥ mṛta mayaḥ puruṣaḥ yam eva sa yaḥ yam ātmā
translated: And this person who is full of light and immortality in this human being, and this person who is full of light and immortality in the inner self of the human being, he is indeed this Self.

analyzed: idam amṛtam idam brahma idam sarvam
translated: This is the immortal, this is Brahman, this is all...

analyzed: ayam ātmā sarveṣām bhūtānām madhu
translated: This Self is the honey of all beings.

analyzed: asya ātmanaḥ sarvāṇi bhūtāni madhu
translated: All beings are the honey of this self.

original: yaś cāyam asminn ātmani tejomayo 'mṛtamayaḥ puruṣo yaś cāyam ātmā tejomayo 'mṛtamayaḥ puruṣo 'yam eva sa yo 'yam ātmā /
analyzed: yaḥ ca ayam asmin ātmani tejaḥ mayaḥ mṛta mayaḥ puruṣaḥ yaḥ ca ayam ātmā tejaḥ mayaḥ mṛta mayaḥ puruṣaḥ yam eva sa yaḥ yam ātmā
translated: And this person who is full of light and immortal in this self, and this self who is full of light and immortal, he is that very one who is this self.

analyzed: idam amṛtam idam brahma idam sarvam
translated: This is the immortal, this is Brahman, this is all.

original: sa vā ayam ātmā sarveṣāṃ adhipatiḥ sarveṣāṃ bhūtānāṃ rājā /
analyzed: sa vai ayam ātmā sarveṣām adhipatiḥ sarveṣām bhūtānām rājā
translated: This self is the lord of all, the king of all beings.

original: tad yathā rathanābhau ca rathanemau cārāḥ sarve samarpitāḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā ratha nābhau ca ratha nemau ca arāḥ sarve samarpitāḥ
translated: Just as all the spokes are fastened to the nave and felly of a chariot,

original: evam evāsminn ātmani sarvāṇi bhūtāni sarve devāḥ sarve lokāḥ sarve prāṇāḥ sarva eta ātmānaḥ samarpitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: evam eva asmin ātmani sarvāṇi bhūtāni sarve devāḥ sarve lokāḥ sarve prāṇāḥ sarve ete ātmānaḥ samarpitāḥ
translated: in the same way all beings, all gods, all worlds, all vital breaths, and all these selves are fastened to this self.

original: idaṃ vai tan madhu dadhyaṅṅ ātharvaṇo 'śvibhyām uvāca /
analyzed: idam vai tat madhu dadhyaṅ ātharvaṇaḥ śvibhyām uvāca
translated: This is that honey which Dadhyan, the son of Atharvan, told the Ashvins.

original: tad etad ṛṣiḥ paśyann avocat tad vāṃ narā sanaye daṃsa ugram āviṣ kṛṇomi tanyatur na vṛṣṭim /
analyzed: tat etat ṛṣiḥ paśyan avocat tat vām narā sanaye daṃsaḥ ugram āvis kṛṇomi tanyatuḥ na vṛṣṭim
translated: The seer, seeing this, said: I reveal to you, O men, that terrible thing, like the roar of thunder, for your enjoyment.

original: dadhyaṅ ha yan madhv ātharvaṇo vām aśvasya śīrṣṇā pra yad īm uvāceti // / / //
analyzed: dadhyaṅ ha yat madhu ātharvaṇaḥ vām aśvasya śīrṣṇā pra yat īm uvāca iti
translated: When Dadhyan, the son of Atharvan, told you, O Ashvins, about the head of the horse, with that honey.

original: idaṃ vai tan madhu dadhyaṅṅ ātharvaṇo 'śvibhyām uvāca /
analyzed: idam vai tat madhu dadhyaṅ ātharvaṇaḥ śvibhyām uvāca
translated: This, indeed, is that honey which Dadhyan, son of Atharvan, spoke to the Asvins.

original: tad etad ṛṣiḥ paśyann avocat ātharvaṇāyāśvinau dadhīce 'śvyaṃ śiraḥ praty airayatam /
analyzed: tat etat ṛṣiḥ paśyan avocat ātharvaṇāya aśvinau dadhīce śvyam śiraḥ prati airayatam
translated: Seeing this, the Rishi said: To Dadhyan, son of Atharvan, the Asvins restored the horse's head.

original: sa vāṃ madhu pra vocad ṛtāyan tvāṣṭraṃ yad dasrāv apikakṣyaṃ vām iti // / / //
analyzed: sa vām madhu pra vocat ṛtāyan tvāṣṭram yat dasrau apikakṣyam vām iti
translated: He, truthful, spoke to you the honey, O wonder-workers, that which belongs to Tvashtar, that which is between your arms.

original: idaṃ vai tan madhu dadhyaṅṅ ātharvaṇo 'śvibhyām uvāca /
analyzed: idam vai tat madhu dadhyaṅ ātharvaṇaḥ śvibhyām uvāca
translated: This, indeed, is that honey which Dadhyan, son of Atharvan, spoke to the Asvins.

original: tad etad ṛṣiḥ paśyann avocat puraś cakre dvipadaḥ puraś cakre catuṣpadaḥ /
analyzed: tat etat ṛṣiḥ paśyan avocat puraḥ cakre dvipadaḥ puraḥ cakre catuṣpadaḥ
translated: Seeing this, the Rishi said: He made the two-footed in front, he made the four-footed in front.

original: puraḥ sa pakṣī bhutvā puraḥ puruṣa āviśad iti /
analyzed: puras sa pakṣī bhutvā puras puruṣaḥ āviśat iti
translated: Having become the winged one, he entered the man in front.

original: sa vā ayaṃ puruṣaḥ sarvāsu pūrṣu puriśayaḥ /🔽nainena kiṃ canānāvṛtam /
analyzed: sa vai ayam puruṣaḥ sarvāsu pūrṣu puriśayaḥ  na enena kim cana an āvṛtam
translated: This person, indeed, is the innermost being in all the beings.🔽There is nothing whatsoever that is not covered by him.

analyzed: na enena kim cana a saṃvṛtam
translated: There is nothing whatsoever that is not encompassed by him.

original: idaṃ vai tan madhu dadhyaṅṅ ātharvaṇo 'śvibhyām uvāca /

translated: This, indeed, is that honey which Dadhyan, son of Atharvan, spoke to the Asvins.

original: ayaṃ vai harayo 'yaṃ vai daśa ca sahasraṇi bahūni cānantāni ca /
