translated: 'Let us hear what anyone has told you.'

analyzed: abravīt me vidagdhaḥ śākalyaḥ
translated: 'Vidagdha Sakalya told me.

analyzed: hṛdayam vai brahma iti
translated: The heart is indeed Brahman.'

original: yathā mātṛmān pitṛmān ācāryavān brūyāt tathā tac chākalyo 'bravīd dhṛdayaṃ vai brahmeti /
analyzed: yathā mātṛmān pitṛmān ācāryavān brūyāt tathā tat śākalyaḥ bravīt dhṛdayam vai brahma iti
translated: Just as one who has a mother, who has a father, who has a teacher would speak, so did Śākalya speak: 'The heart, indeed, is Brahman.'

analyzed: ahṛdayasya hi kim syāt iti
translated: For what would be the use of one who has no heart?

analyzed: abravīt tu te tasya āyatanam pratiṣṭhām
translated: But he told you its abode and support.

analyzed: na me bravīt iti
translated: He did not tell me,' he said.

analyzed: eka pād vai etat samrāj iti
translated: 'This is the one-footed sovereignty,'

analyzed: sa vai naḥ brūhi yājñavalkya
translated: 'Tell us that, Yājñavalkya.'

analyzed: hṛdayam eva āyatanam ākāśaḥ pratiṣṭhā
translated: 'The heart, indeed, is the abode, space is the support.

analyzed: sthitiḥ iti enat upāsīta
translated: One should worship it as the support.'

analyzed: kā sthititā yājñavalkya
translated: 'What is the nature of the support, Yājñavalkya?'

original: hṛdayam eva samrāḍ iti hovāca /🔽hṛdayaṃ vai samrāṭ sarveṣāṃ bhūtānām āyatanam /
analyzed: hṛdayam eva samrāj iti ha uvāca  hṛdayam vai samrāj sarveṣām bhūtānām āyatanam
translated: 'The heart, indeed, is the sovereign,' he said.🔽'The heart, indeed, is the abode of all beings, Yājñavalkya.

original: hṛdayaṃ vai samrāṭ sarveṣāṃ bhūtānāṃ pratiṣṭhā /
analyzed: hṛdayam vai samrāj sarveṣām bhūtānām pratiṣṭhā
translated: The heart, indeed, is the support of all beings.

original: hṛdaye hy eva samrāṭ sarvāṇi bhūtāni pratiṣṭhitāni bhavanti /
analyzed: hṛdaye hi eva samrāj sarvāṇi bhūtāni pratiṣṭhitāni bhavanti
translated: For it is in the heart, O king, that all beings are established.

analyzed: hṛdayam vai samrāj paramam brahma
translated: The heart, indeed, is the supreme Brahman, O king.

analyzed: na enam hṛdayam jahāti
translated: The heart does not abandon him.

analyzed: sarvāṇi enam bhūtāni abhikṣaranti
translated: All beings attend upon him.

analyzed: devaḥ bhūtvā devān apyeti
translated: Having become a god, he goes even to the gods.

analyzed: yaḥ evam vidvān etat upāste
translated: One who, knowing thus, worships it thus,

original: hastyṛṣabhaṃ sahasraṃ dadāmīti hovāca janako vaidehaḥ /
analyzed: hasti ṛṣabham sahasram dadāmi iti ha uvāca janakaḥ vaidehaḥ
translated: Janaka of Videha said, I will give you a thousand cows with bulls.

original: sa hovāca yājñavalkyaḥ pitā me 'manyata nānanuśiṣya hareteti // / / //
analyzed: sa ha uvāca yājñavalkyaḥ pitā me manyata na an anuśiṣya hareta iti
translated: Yajnavalkya said, My father thought that one should not take a fee without teaching.

original: janako ha vaidehaḥ kūrcād upāvasarpann uvāca namas te 'stu yājñavalkya /
analyzed: janakaḥ ha vaidehaḥ kūrcāt upāvasarpan uvāca namaḥ te stu yājñavalkya
translated: Janaka of Videha, descending from his couch, said, Salutations to you, Yajnavalkya.

analyzed: anu mā śādhi iti
translated: Instruct me.

original: sa hovāca yathā vai samrāṇ mahāntam adhvānam eṣyan rathaṃ vā nāvaṃ vā samādadītaivam evaitābhir upaniṣadbhiḥ samāhitātmāsi /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca yathā vai samrāj mahāntam adhvānam eṣyan ratham vā nāvam vā samādadīta evam eva etābhiḥ upaniṣadbhiḥ samāhita ātmā asi
translated: He said, Just as, O king, one who is about to go on a long journey would prepare a chariot or a boat, in the same way, your mind is prepared with these Upaniṣads.

original: evaṃ vṛndāraka āḍhyaḥ sann adhītaveda uktopaniṣatka ito vimucyamānaḥ kva gamiṣyasīti /
analyzed: evam vṛndārakaḥ āḍhyaḥ san adhīta vedaḥ ukta upaniṣatkaḥ itas vimucyamānaḥ kva gamiṣyasi iti
translated: Thus, being wealthy and having studied the Vedas and the Upaniṣads, where will you go when released from here?

original: nāhaṃ tad bhagavan veda yatra gamiṣyāmīti /
analyzed: na aham tat bhagavan veda yatra gamiṣyāmi iti
translated: I do not know that, O revered one, where I will go.

original: atha vai te 'haṃ tad vakṣyāmi yatra gamiṣyasīti /
analyzed: atha vai te ham tat vakṣyāmi yatra gamiṣyasi iti
translated: Then I will tell you where you will go.

original: bravītu bhagavān iti // / / //🔽indho ha vai nāmaiṣa yo 'yaṃ dakṣiṇe 'kṣan puruṣaḥ /
analyzed: bravītu bhagavān iti  indhaḥ ha vai nāma eṣa yaḥ yam dakṣiṇe kṣan puruṣaḥ
translated: Let the revered one speak.🔽Indha, indeed, is the name of the person who is in the right eye.

original: taṃ vā etam indhaṃ santam indra ity ācakṣate parokṣeṇaiva /
analyzed: tam vai etam indham santam indraḥ iti ācakṣate parokṣeṇa eva
translated: Him, who is Indha, they call Indra by a roundabout expression.

analyzed: parokṣa priyāḥ iva hi devāḥ pratyakṣa dviṣaḥ
translated: For the gods love what is indirect, and hate what is direct.

original: athaitad vāme 'kṣaṇi puruṣarūpam eṣāsya patnī virāṭ /
analyzed: atha etat vāme kṣaṇi puruṣa rūpam eṣā asya patnī virāj
translated: Now this form of a man in the left eye is his wife, Virāj.

original: tayor eṣa saṃstāvo ya eṣo 'ntar hṛdaya ākāśaḥ /
analyzed: tayoḥ eṣa saṃstāvaḥ yaḥ eṣaḥ ntar hṛdaye ākāśaḥ
translated: Their union is this space within the heart.

original: athainayor etad annaṃ ya eṣo 'ntar hṛdaye lohitapiṇḍaḥ /🔽athainayor etat prāvaraṇaṃ yad etad antar hṛdaye jālakam iva /
analyzed: atha enayoḥ etat annam yaḥ eṣaḥ ntar hṛdaye lohita piṇḍaḥ  atha enayoḥ etat prāvaraṇam yat etat antar hṛdaye jālakam iva
translated: Now this is their food, this lump of blood within the heart.🔽Now this is their covering, this net-like thing within the heart.

original: athainayor eṣā sṛtiḥ saṃcaraṇī yaiṣā hṛdayād ūrdhvā nāḍy uccarati /
analyzed: atha enayoḥ eṣā sṛtiḥ saṃcaraṇī yā eṣā hṛdayāt ūrdhvā nāḍī uccarati
translated: Now this is their path of movement, this channel that rises up from the heart.

original: yathā keśaḥ sahasradhā bhinna evam asyaitā hitā nāma nāḍyo 'ntar hṛdaye pratiṣṭhitā bhavanti /
analyzed: yathā keśaḥ sahasradhā bhinnaḥ evam asya etāḥ hitāḥ nāma nāḍyaḥ ntar hṛdaye pratiṣṭhitāḥ bhavanti
translated: Just as a hair is divided a thousandfold, so these channels called Hītās are established within the heart.

analyzed: etābhiḥ vai etat āsravat āsravati
translated: Through them he flows when flowing.

original: tasmād eṣa praviviktāhāratara iva bhavaty asmāc chārīrād ātmanaḥ // / / //🔽tasya prācī dik prāñcaḥ prāṇāḥ /🔽dakṣiṇā dig dakṣiṇe prāṇāḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt eṣa pravivikta āhārataraḥ iva bhavati asmāt śārīrāt ātmanaḥ  tasya prācī diś prāñcaḥ prāṇāḥ  dakṣiṇā diś dakṣiṇe prāṇāḥ
translated: Therefore he is more nourished than this bodily self.🔽His eastern direction are his eastern vital breaths.

original: pratīcī dik pratyañcaḥ prāṇāḥ /🔽udīcī dig udañcaḥ prāṇāḥ /
analyzed: pratīcī diś pratyañcaḥ prāṇāḥ  udīcī diś udañcaḥ prāṇāḥ
translated: His southern direction are his southern vital breaths.🔽His western direction are his western vital breaths.🔽His northern direction are his northern vital breaths.

analyzed: ūrdhvā diś ūrdhvāḥ prāṇāḥ
translated: His upward direction are his upward vital breaths.

analyzed: avācī diś avāñcaḥ prāṇāḥ
translated: The southern direction is the downward breaths.

analyzed: sarvāḥ diśaḥ sarve prāṇāḥ
translated: All directions are all breaths.

analyzed: saḥ eṣa na iti na iti ātmā
translated: This Self is indeed 'neti neti' (not this, not that).

original: agṛhyo na hi gṛhyate /🔽aśīryo na hi śīryate /🔽asaṅgo na hi sajyate /
analyzed: a gṛhyaḥ na hi gṛhyate  a śīryaḥ na hi śīryate  a saṅgaḥ na hi sajyate
translated: It cannot be grasped, for it is not grasped.🔽It is not torn, for it does not tear.🔽It is not bound, for it does not bind.

analyzed: a sitaḥ na vyathate
translated: It is not stained, for it is not afflicted.

analyzed: na riṣyati
translated: It does not perish.

original: abhayaṃ vai janaka prāpto 'sīti hovāca yājñavalkyaḥ /
analyzed: abhayam vai janaka prāptaḥ si iti ha uvāca yājñavalkyaḥ
translated: O Janaka, you have indeed attained fearlessness, Yajnavalkya said.

original: sa hovāca janako vaideho 'bhayaṃ tvā gacchatād yājñavalkya yo no bhagavann abhayaṃ vedayase /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca janakaḥ vaidehaḥ bhayam tvā gacchatāt yājñavalkya yaḥ naḥ bhagavan abhayam vedayase
translated: Janaka of Videha said: May you go in fearlessness, O Yajnavalkya, O revered one, you who teach us fearlessness.

analyzed: namaḥ te stu
translated: Salutations to you.

analyzed: ime videhāḥ ayam aham asmi iti
translated: These are the Videhas, this am I.

analyzed: janakam ha vaideham yājñavalkyaḥ jagāma
translated: Yajnavalkya went to Janaka of Videha.

analyzed: sam enena vadiṣye iti
translated: Thinking, I will converse with him.

original: atha ha yaj janakaś ca vaideho yājñavalkyaś cāgnihotre samūdāte /
analyzed: atha ha yat janakaḥ ca vaidehaḥ yājñavalkyaḥ ca agnihotre samūdāte
translated: Then, when Janaka of Videha and Yajnavalkya were discussing the Agnihotra,

analyzed: tasmai ha yājñavalkyaḥ varam dadau
translated: Yajnavalkya gave him a boon.

analyzed: sa ha kāmapraśnam eva vavre
translated: He chose the question of his desire.

analyzed: tam ha asmai dadau
translated: Yajnavalkya granted it to him.

original: taṃ ha samrāḍ eva pūrvaḥ papraccha // / / //
analyzed: tam ha samrāj eva pūrvaḥ papraccha
translated: The emperor himself asked him first.

analyzed: yājñavalkya kiṃjyotiḥ ayam puruṣaḥ iti
translated: Yajnavalkya, what is the light of this person?

analyzed: āditya jyotiḥ samrāj iti ha uvāca
translated: The light of the sun, O emperor, he said.

original: ādityenaivāyaṃ jyotiṣāste palyayate karma kurute vipalyetīti /
analyzed: ādityena eva ayam jyotiṣā āste palyayate karma kurute vipalyeti iti
translated: By the sun, indeed, this person shines, moves about, does his work, and returns.

analyzed: evam eva etat yājñavalkya
translated: Thus, Yajnavalkya.

original: astamita āditye yājñavalkya kiṃjyotir evāyaṃ puruṣa iti /
analyzed: astamite āditye yājñavalkya kiṃjyotiḥ eva ayam puruṣaḥ iti
translated: When the sun has set, Yajnavalkya, by what light does this person here (live and) move about?

analyzed: candramāḥ eva asya jyotiḥ bhavati iti
translated: By the light of the moon, indeed, he lives.

original: candramasaivāyaṃ jyotiṣāste palyayate karma kurute vipalyetīti /
analyzed: candramasā eva ayam jyotiṣā āste palyayate karma kurute vipalyeti iti
translated: By the light of the moon, indeed, he shines, moves about, does his work, and returns.

analyzed: evam eva etat yājñavalkya
translated: Thus, Yajnavalkya.

original: astamita āditye yājñavalkya candramasy astamite kiṃjyotir evāyaṃ puruṣa iti /
analyzed: astamite āditye yājñavalkya candramasi astamite kiṃjyotiḥ eva ayam puruṣaḥ iti
translated: When the sun has set, Yajnavalkya, and the moon has set, by what light does this person here (live and) move about?

analyzed: agniḥ eva asya jyotiḥ bhavati iti
translated: By the light of fire, indeed, he lives.

original: agninaiva jyotiṣāste palyayate karma kurute vipalyetīti /
analyzed: agninā eva jyotiṣā āste palyayate karma kurute vipalyeti iti
translated: By the light of fire, indeed, he shines, moves about, does his work, and returns.

analyzed: evam eva etat yājñavalkya
translated: Thus, Yajnavalkya.

original: astamita āditye yājñavalkya candramasy astamite śānte 'gnau kiṃjyotir evāyaṃ puruṣa iti /
analyzed: astamite āditye yājñavalkya candramasi astamite śānte gnau kiṃjyotiḥ eva ayam puruṣaḥ iti
translated: When the sun has set, Yajnavalkya, and the moon has set, and the fire has gone out, by what light does this person here (live and) move about?

analyzed: vāc eva asya jyotiḥ bhavati iti
translated: By the light of speech, indeed, he lives.

original: vācaivāyaṃ jyotiṣāste palyayate karma kurute vipalyeti /
analyzed: vācā eva ayam jyotiṣā āste palyayate karma kurute vipalyeti
translated: By the light of speech, indeed, he shines, moves about, does his work, and returns.

original: tasmād vai samrāḍ api yatra svaḥ pāṇir na vinirjñāyate 'tha yatra vāg uccaraty upaiva tatra nyetīti /
analyzed: tasmāt vai samrāj api yatra svaḥ pāṇiḥ na vinirjñāyate yatra vāc uccarati upa eva tatra nyeti iti
translated: Therefore, O King, where the hand of heaven is not distinguished, and where speech is uttered, there one approaches.

analyzed: evam eva etat yājñavalkya
translated: Even so, Yajnavalkya.

original: astamita āditye yājñavalkya candramasy astamite śānte 'gnau śāntāyāṃ vāci kiṃjyotir evāyaṃ puruṣa iti /
analyzed: astamite āditye yājñavalkya candramasi astamite śānte gnau śāntāyām vāci kiṃjyotiḥ eva ayam puruṣaḥ iti
translated: When the sun has set, Yajnavalkya, when the moon has set, when the fire has been pacified, when speech has been pacified, what light does this person have?

analyzed: ātmā eva asya jyotiḥ bhavati iti
translated: The self is his light.

original: ātmanaivāyaṃ jyotiṣāste palyayate karma kurute vipalyetīti // / / //
analyzed: ātmanā eva ayam jyotiṣā āste palyayate karma kurute vipalyeti iti
translated: By the self alone he abides, moves about, performs his duties, and returns.

original: katama ātmeti yo 'yaṃ vijñānamayaḥ prāṇeṣu hṛdy antarjyotiḥ puruṣaḥ /
analyzed: katamaḥ ātmā iti yaḥ yam vijñāna mayaḥ prāṇeṣu hṛdi antar jyotiḥ puruṣaḥ
translated: What is the self? He who is made of knowledge, the person in the heart between the lungs, the inner light.

original: sa samānaḥ sann ubhau lokāv anusaṃcarati dhyāyatīva lelāyatīva /
analyzed: sa samānaḥ san ubhau lokau anusaṃcarati dhyāyati iva lelāyati iva
translated: Being the same, he moves along both worlds, as if thinking, as if moving.

original: sa hi svapno bhūtvemaṃ lokam atikrāmati add / mṛtyo rūpāṇi // / / //
analyzed: sa hi svapnaḥ bhūtvā imam lokam atikrāmati mṛtyoḥ rūpāṇi
translated: For he, becoming dream, passes beyond this world. The forms of death.

original: sa vā ayaṃ puruṣo jāyamānaḥ śarīram abhisampadyamānaḥ pāpmabhiḥ saṃsṛjyate /
analyzed: sa vai ayam puruṣaḥ jāyamānaḥ śarīram abhisampadyamānaḥ pāpmabhiḥ saṃsṛjyate
translated: This person, being born, is united with the body and is mixed with evils.

analyzed: saḥ utkrāman mriyamāṇaḥ pāpmanaḥ vijahāti
translated: Departing, dying, he leaves the evils behind.

original: tasya vā etasya puruṣasya dve eva sthāne bhavataḥ /
analyzed: tasya vai etasya puruṣasya dve eva sthāne bhavataḥ
translated: This person has two abodes.

analyzed: idam ca para loka sthānam ca
translated: This one and the abode in the other world.

analyzed: sandhyam tṛtīyam svapna sthānam
translated: The third abode, the abode of dreams, is in between.

original: tasminsandhye sthāne tiṣṭhan ubhe sthāne paśyatīdaṃ ca paralokasthānaṃ ca /
analyzed: tasmin sandhye sthāne tiṣṭhan ubhe sthāne paśyati idam ca para loka sthānam ca
translated: Standing in that intermediate abode, he sees both abodes, this one and the abode in the other world.

analyzed: atha yathākramaḥ yam para loka sthāne bhavati
translated: Then, as he is in the abode in the other world in due order,

original: tam ākramam ākramyobhayān pāpmana ānandāṃś ca paśyati /
analyzed: tam ākramam ākramya ubhayān pāpmanaḥ ānandān ca paśyati
translated: having mounted that order, he sees both the evil and the blissful.

original: sa yatra prasvapity asya lokasya sarvāvato mātrām apādāya svayaṃ vihatya svayaṃ nirmāya svena bhāsā svena jyotiṣā prasvapiti /
analyzed: sa yatra prasvapiti asya lokasya sarvāvataḥ mātrām apādāya svayam vihatya svayam nirmāya svena bhāsā svena jyotiṣā prasvapiti
translated: When he sleeps, having taken away the measure of this entire world, having himself destroyed it, having himself created it, he sleeps with his own light, with his own radiance.

analyzed: atra ayam puruṣaḥ svayam jyotiḥ bhavati
translated: Here this person becomes self-luminous.

original: na tatra rathā na rathayogā na panthāno bhavanti /
analyzed: na tatra rathāḥ na ratha yogāḥ na panthānaḥ bhavanti
translated: There are no chariots, no yokings of chariots, no paths there.

analyzed: atha rathān ratha yogān pathaḥ sṛjate
translated: Then he creates chariots, yokings of chariots, and paths.

analyzed: na tatra ānandāḥ mudaḥ pramudaḥ bhavanti
translated: There are no delights, no joys, no great joys there.

analyzed: atha ānandāt mudaḥ pramudaḥ sṛjate
translated: Then he creates delights, joys, and great joys.

original: na tatra veśāntāḥ puṣkariṇyaḥ sravantyo bhavanti /
analyzed: na tatra veśāntāḥ puṣkariṇyaḥ sravantyaḥ bhavanti
translated: There are no pools, lotus ponds, or streams there.

analyzed: atha veśāntān puṣkariṇīḥ sravantīḥ sṛjate
translated: Then he creates the pleasure groves, the lotus ponds, and the streams.

analyzed: sa hi kartā
translated: For he is the creator.

original: tad ete ślokā bhavanti 🔽svapnena śārīram abhiprahatyāsuptaḥ suptān abhicākaśīti /
analyzed: tat ete ślokāḥ bhavanti  svapnena śārīram abhiprahatya a suptaḥ suptān abhicākaśīti
translated: Regarding this, there are these verses:🔽By superimposing sleep on the embodied being, the one who is not asleep sees the sleepers.

original: śukram ādāya punar aiti sthānaṃ hiraṇmayaḥpuruṣa ekahaṃsaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śukram ādāya punar aiti sthānam hiraṇmayaḥ puruṣaḥ eka haṃsaḥ
translated: Taking the semen, he returns to his place, the golden person, the one-haṃsa.

original: prāṇena rakṣann avaraṃ kulāyaṃ bahiṣkulāyād amṛtaś caritvā /
analyzed: prāṇena rakṣan avaram kulāyam bahis kulāyāt amṛtaḥ caritvā
translated: Protecting the lower nest with the vital breath, the immortal one moves outside the nest.

original: sa īyate 'mṛto yatrakāmaṃ hiraṇmayaḥ puruṣa ekahaṃsaḥ // / / //
analyzed: saḥ īyate mṛtaḥ yatrakāmam hiraṇmayaḥ puruṣaḥ eka haṃsaḥ
translated: He goes as an immortal to wherever he desires, the golden person, the one-haṃsa.

original: svapnānta uccāvacam īyamāno rūpāṇi devaḥ kurute bahūni /
analyzed: svapna ante uccāvacam īyamānaḥ rūpāṇi devaḥ kurute bahūni
translated: Moving up and down in the end of sleep, the god creates many forms.

original: uteva strībhiḥ saha modamāno jakṣad utevāpi bhayāni paśyan // / / //
analyzed: uta iva strībhiḥ saha modamānaḥ jakṣat uta iva api bhayāni paśyan
translated: As if rejoicing with women, eating, and as if seeing even frightening things.

original: ārāmam asya paśyanti na taṃ paśyati kaś caneti /
analyzed: ārāmam asya paśyanti na tam paśyati kaḥ cana iti
translated: They see his pleasure grove, but no one sees him.

analyzed: tam na āyatam bodhayet iti āhuḥ
translated: They say one should not awaken him who is not to be awakened.

original: durbhiṣajyaṃ hāsmai bhavati yam eṣa na pratipadyate /
analyzed: durbhiṣajyam ha asmai bhavati yam eṣa na pratipadyate
translated: For he who does not accept this becomes difficult to cure for him.

original: atho khalv āhur jāgaritadeśa evāsyaisa iti /
analyzed: atha u khalu āhuḥ jāgarita deśe eva asya esaḥ iti
translated: But others say that this is indeed the region of waking.

original: yāni hy eva jāgrat paśyati tāni supta iti /
analyzed: yāni hi eva jāgrat paśyati tāni suptaḥ iti
translated: For whatever one sees while awake, that one sees while sleeping.

analyzed: atra ayam puruṣaḥ svayam jyotiḥ bhavati
translated: Here this person is self-luminous.

analyzed: saḥ ham bhagavate sahasram dadāmi
translated: I give the Blessed One a thousand.

analyzed: atas ūrdhvam vimokṣāya brūhi iti
translated: Speak further for the sake of liberation.

original: sa vā eṣa etasmin saṃprasāde ratvā caritvā dṛṣṭvaiva puṇyaṃ ca pāpaṃ ca punaḥ pratinyāyaṃ pratiyony ādravati svapnāyaiva /
analyzed: sa vai eṣaḥ etasmin saṃprasāde ratvā caritvā dṛṣṭvā eva puṇyam ca pāpam ca punar pratinyāyam pratiyoni ādravati svapnāya eva
translated: He, having enjoyed himself and moved about in that tranquility, having seen both good and evil, runs back again by the same way he came, to sleep.

original: sa yat tatra kiñcit paśyaty ananvāgatas tena bhavati /
analyzed: sa yat tatra kiñcid paśyati an anvāgataḥ tena bhavati
translated: Whatever he sees there, he is not affected by it.

analyzed: a saṅgaḥ hi ayam puruṣaḥ iti
translated: For this person is unattached, indeed.

analyzed: evam eva etat yājñavalkya
translated: Just so, Yajnavalkya.

analyzed: saḥ ham bhagavate sahasram dadāmi
translated: I give the Blessed One a thousand.

analyzed: atas ūrdhvam vimokṣāya eva brūhi iti
translated: Speak further for the sake of liberation.

original: sa vā eṣa etasmin svapne ratvā caritvā dṛṣṭvaiva puṇyaṃ ca pāpaṃ ca punaḥ pratinyāyaṃ pratiyony ādravati buddhāntāyaiva /
analyzed: sa vai eṣaḥ etasmin svapne ratvā caritvā dṛṣṭvā eva puṇyam ca pāpam ca punar pratinyāyam pratiyoni ādravati buddha antāya eva
translated: He, having enjoyed himself and moved about in that dream, having seen both good and evil, runs back again by the same way he came, to the end of sleep.

original: sa yat tatra kiñcit paśyaty ananvāgatas tena bhavati /
analyzed: sa yat tatra kiñcid paśyati an anvāgataḥ tena bhavati
translated: Whatever he sees there, he is not affected by it.

analyzed: a saṅgaḥ hi ayam puruṣaḥ iti
translated: For this person is unattached, indeed.

analyzed: evam eva etat yājñavalkya
translated: Just so, Yajnavalkya.

analyzed: saḥ ham bhagavate sahasram dadāmi
translated: I give the Blessed One a thousand.

analyzed: atas ūrdhvam vimokṣāya eva brūhi iti
translated: Therefore, speak further only for the sake of liberation.

original: sa vā eṣa etasmin buddhānte ratvā caritvā dṛṣṭvaiva puṇyaṃ ca pāpaṃ ca punaḥ pratinyāyaṃ pratiyony ādravati svapnāntāyaiva // / /
analyzed: sa vai eṣaḥ etasmin buddha ante ratvā caritvā dṛṣṭvā eva puṇyam ca pāpam ca punar pratinyāyam pratiyoni ādravati svapna antāya eva  /
translated: He, having enjoyed and moved about in this end of the waking state, having seen only merit and demerit, again runs back by the same way, by the same path, to the end of sleep.

original: tad yathā mahāmatsya ubhe kūle anusaṃcarati pūrvaṃ cāparaṃ ca /
analyzed: tat yathā mahā matsyaḥ ubhe kūle anusaṃcarati pūrvam ca aparam ca
translated: Just as a large fish, moving along both banks, the eastern and the western,

original: evam evāyaṃ puruṣa etāv ubhāv antāv anusaṃcarati svapnāntaṃ ca buddhāntaṃ ca // / / //
analyzed: evam eva ayam puruṣaḥ etau ubhau antau anusaṃcarati svapna antam ca buddha antam ca
translated: in the same way, this person moves along both these ends, the end of sleep and the end of waking.

original: tad yathāsminn ākāśe śyeno vā suparṇo vā viparipatya śrāntaḥ saṃhatya pakṣau saṃlayāyaiva dhriyate /
analyzed: tat yathā asmin ākāśe śyenaḥ vā suparṇaḥ vā viparipatya śrāntaḥ saṃhatya pakṣau saṃlayāya eva dhriyate
translated: Just as a hawk or a vulture, flying in this space, becomes tired, folds its wings, and moves towards its nest,

original: evam evāyaṃ puruṣa etasmā antāya dhavati /
analyzed: evam eva ayam puruṣaḥ etasmai antāya dhavati
translated: in the same way, this person moves towards this end,

original: yatra supto na kaṃ cana kāmaṃ kāmayate na kaṃ cana svapnaṃ paśyati // / / //
analyzed: yatra suptaḥ na kam cana kāmam kāmayate na kam cana svapnam paśyati
translated: where, while sleeping, he desires no desire, sees no dream.

original: tā vā asyaitā hitā nāma nāḍyo yathā keśaḥ sahasradhā bhinnas tāvatāṇimnā tiṣṭhanti /
analyzed: tāḥ vai asya etāḥ hitāḥ nāma nāḍyaḥ yathā keśaḥ sahasradhā bhinnaḥ tāvatā aṇimnā tiṣṭhanti
translated: These are his arteries named Hita, which are as thin as a hair split into a thousand parts, and extend to that extent.

original: śuklasya nīlasya piṅgalasya haritasya lohitasya pūrṇāḥ /
analyzed: śuklasya nīlasya piṅgalasya haritasya lohitasya pūrṇāḥ
translated: They are filled with white, blue, tawny, green, and red.🔽Here is the realigned and corrected output:

original: atha yatrainaṃ ghnantīva jinantīva hastīva vicchāyayati gartam iva patati /
analyzed: atha yatra enam ghnanti iva jinanti iva hastī iva vicchāyayati gartam iva patati
translated: Now, when they strike him as it were, and winnow him as it were, and he is as if carried away by a current, and as if he were falling into a pit,

original: yad eva jāgrad bhayaṃ paśyati tad atrāvidyayā manyate /
analyzed: yat eva jāgrat bhayam paśyati tat atra avidyayā manyate
translated: whatever fear he sees while awake, that he thinks here through ignorance.

original: atha yatra deva iva rājevāham evedaṃ sarvo 'smīti manyate /
analyzed: atha yatra devaḥ iva rājā iva aham eva idam sarvaḥ smi iti manyate
translated: Now, when he thinks, 'As a god, as a king, I alone am all this,'

analyzed: saḥ sya paramaḥ lokaḥ
translated: that is his highest world.

analyzed: tat vai asya etat aticchandaḥ pahata pāpma abhayam rūpam
translated: That is his form free from sin, free from fear, beyond the reach of mind.

original: tad yathā priyayā striyā saṃpariṣvakto na bāhyaṃ kiṃ cana veda nāntaram /
analyzed: tat yathā priyayā striyā saṃpariṣvaktaḥ na bāhyam kim cana veda na antaram
translated: Just as one embraced by his beloved wife knows nothing outside or inside,

original: evam evāyaṃ puruṣaḥ prājñenātmanā saṃpariṣvakto na bāhyaṃ kiṃ cana veda nāntaram /
analyzed: evam eva ayam puruṣaḥ prājñena ātmanā saṃpariṣvaktaḥ na bāhyam kim cana veda na antaram
translated: so this person, embraced by the wise Self, knows nothing outside or inside.

original: tad vā asyaitad āptakāmam ātmakāmam akāmaṃ rūpam śokāntaram // / / //
analyzed: tat vai asya etat āpta kāmam ātma kāmam akāmam rūpam śoka antaram
translated: That is his form, whose desires are fulfilled, whose desires are the Self, who is desireless, beyond grief.

original: atra pitāpitā bhavati mātāmātā lokā alokā devā adevā vedā avedāḥ /
analyzed: atra pitā a pitā bhavati mātā a mātā lokāḥ a lokāḥ devāḥ a devāḥ vedāḥ a vedāḥ
translated: Here the father is not the father, the mother is not the mother, the worlds are not the worlds, the gods are not the gods, the Vedas are not the Vedas.

original: atra steno 'steno bhavati bhrūṇahābhrūṇahā cāṇḍyālo 'caṇḍyālaḥ paulkaso 'paulkasaḥ śramaṇo 'śramaṇas tāpaso 'tāpasaḥ /
analyzed: atra stenaḥ stenaḥ bhavati bhrūṇa hā abhrūṇa hā cāṇḍyālaḥ caṇḍyālaḥ paulkasaḥ paulkasaḥ śramaṇaḥ śramaṇaḥ tāpasaḥ tāpasaḥ
translated: Here the thief is not the thief, the murderer of a foetus is not the murderer of a foetus, the Caṇḍāla is not the Caṇḍāla, the Pulkasa is not the Pulkasa, the ascetic is not the ascetic, the anchorite is not the anchorite.

analyzed: an anvāgatam puṇyena an anvāgatam pāpena
translated: He is not accompanied by merit, he is not accompanied by demerit.

original: tīrṇo hi tadā sarvāñ śokān hṛdayasya bhavati // / / //
analyzed: tīrṇaḥ hi tadā sarvām śokān hṛdayasya bhavati
translated: For then he has crossed over all sorrows of the heart.

original: yad vai tan na paśyati paśyan vai tan na paśyati /
analyzed: yat vai tat na paśyati paśyan vai tat na paśyati
translated: What, indeed, he does not see, seeing, he does not see that.

original: na hi draṣṭur dṛṣṭer viparilopo vidyate 'vināśitvān /
analyzed: na hi draṣṭuḥ dṛṣṭeḥ viparilopaḥ vidyate vināśitvān
translated: For the seer's seeing is not subject to destruction, because of imperishability.

original: na tu tad dvitīyam asti tato 'nyad vibhaktaṃ yat paśyet // / / //
analyzed: na tu tat dvitīyam asti tatas nyat vibhaktam yat paśyet
translated: But there is no second thing separate from that which he could see.

original: yad vai tan na jighrati jighran vai tan na jighrati /
analyzed: yat vai tat na jighrati jighran vai tat na jighrati
translated: What, indeed, he does not smell, smelling, he does not smell that.

original: na hi ghrātur ghrāter viparilopo vidyate 'vināśitvāt /
analyzed: na hi ghrātuḥ ghrāteḥ viparilopaḥ vidyate vināśi tvāt
translated: For the smeller's smelling is not subject to destruction, because of imperishability.

original: na tu tad dvitīyam asti tato 'nyad vibhaktaṃ yaj jighret // / / //
analyzed: na tu tat dvitīyam asti tatas nyat vibhaktam yat jighret
translated: But there is no second thing separate from that which he could smell.

original: yad vai tan na rasayati rasayan vai tan na rasayati /
analyzed: yat vai tat na rasayati rasayan vai tat na rasayati
translated: What, indeed, he does not taste, tasting, he does not taste that.

original: na hi rasayitū rasayater viparilopo vidyate 'vināśitvāt /
analyzed: na hi rasayituḥ rasayateḥ viparilopaḥ vidyate vināśi tvāt
translated: For the taster's tasting is not subject to destruction, because of imperishability.

original: na tu tad dvitīyam asti tato 'nyad vibhaktaṃ yad rasayet // / / //
analyzed: na tu tat dvitīyam asti tatas vibhaktam yat rasayet
translated: But there is no second thing separate from that which he could taste.

original: yad vai tan na vadati vadan vai tan na vadati /
analyzed: yat vai tat na vadati vadan vai tat na vadati
translated: What, indeed, he does not speak, speaking, he does not speak that.

original: na hi vaktur vakter viparilopo vidyate 'vināśitvāt /
analyzed: na hi vaktuḥ vakteḥ viparilopaḥ vidyate vināśi tvāt
translated: For the speaker's speaking is not subject to destruction, because of imperishability.

original: na tu tad dvitīyam asti tato 'nyad vibhaktaṃ yad vadet // / / //
analyzed: na tu tat dvitīyam asti tatas vibhaktam yat vadet
translated: But there is no second, separate from that, which one could say.

original: yad vai tan na śṛṇoti śṛṇvan vai tan na śṛṇoti /
analyzed: yat vai tat na śṛṇoti śṛṇvan vai tat na śṛṇoti
translated: What, indeed, one does not hear, hearing, indeed, one does not hear that.

original: na hi śrotuḥ śruter viparilopo vidyate 'vināśitvāt /
analyzed: na hi śrotuḥ śruteḥ viparilopaḥ vidyate vināśi tvāt
translated: For the hearer's hearing does not perish, because of its imperishability.

original: na tu tad dvitīyam asti tato 'nyad vibhaktaṃ yac chṛṇuyāt // / / //
analyzed: na tu tat dvitīyam asti tatas nyat vibhaktam yat śṛṇuyāt
translated: But there is no second, separate from that, which one could hear.

original: yad vai tan na manute manvāno vai tan na manute /
analyzed: yat vai tat na manute manvānaḥ vai tat na manute
translated: What, indeed, one does not think, thinking, indeed, one does not think that.

original: na hi mantur mater viparilopo vidyate 'vināśitvāt /
analyzed: na hi mantuḥ mateḥ viparilopaḥ vidyate vināśi tvāt
translated: For the thinker's thought does not perish, because of its imperishability.

original: na tu tad dvitīyam asti tato 'nyad vibhaktaṃ yan manvīta // / / //
analyzed: na tu tat dvitīyam asti tatas nyat vibhaktam yat manvīta
translated: But there is no second, separate from that, which one could think.

original: yad vai tan na spṛśati spṛśan vai tan na spṛśati /
analyzed: yat vai tat na spṛśati spṛśan vai tat na spṛśati
translated: What, indeed, one does not touch, touching, indeed, one does not touch that.

original: na hi spraṣṭuḥ spṛṣṭer viparilopo vidyate 'vināśitvāt /
analyzed: na hi spraṣṭuḥ spṛṣṭeḥ viparilopaḥ vidyate vināśi tvāt
translated: For the toucher's touch does not perish, because of its imperishability.

original: na tu tad dvitīyam asti tato 'nyad vibhaktaṃ yat spṛśet // / / //
analyzed: na tu tat dvitīyam asti tatas nyat vibhaktam yat spṛśet
translated: But there is no second, separate from that, which one could touch.

original: yad vai tan na vijānāti vijānan vai tan na vijānāti /
analyzed: yat vai tat na vijānāti vijānan vai tat na vijānāti
translated: What, indeed, one does not know, knowing, indeed, one does not know that.

original: na hi vijñātur vijñāter viparilopo vidyate 'vināśitvāt /
analyzed: na hi vijñātuḥ vijñāteḥ viparilopaḥ vidyate vināśi tvāt
translated: For the knower's knowledge does not perish, because of its imperishability.

original: na tu tad dvitīyam asti tato 'nyad vibhaktaṃ yad vijānīyāt // / / //
analyzed: na tu tat dvitīyam asti tatas nyat vibhaktam yat vijānīyāt
translated: But there is no second apart from that, distinct, which he could know.

original: yatra vā anyad iva syāt tatrānyo 'nyat paśyed anyo 'nyaj jighred anyo 'nyad rasayed
analyzed: yatra vai anyat iva syāt tatra anyaḥ nyat paśyet anyaḥ nyat jighret anyaḥ nyat rasayet
translated: Where there is something else, there one would see another, one would smell another, one would taste another,

original: anyo 'nyad vaded anyo 'nyac chṛṇuyād anyo 'nyan manvītānyo 'nyat spṛśed anyo 'nyad
analyzed: anyaḥ nyat vadet anyaḥ nyat śṛṇuyāt anyaḥ nyat manvīta anyaḥ nyat spṛśet anyaḥ nyat
translated: one would speak another, one would hear another, one would think another, one would touch another, one would know another.

analyzed: vijānīyāt
translated: one would know.

analyzed: salilaḥ ekaḥ draṣṭā advaitaḥ bhavati
translated: He becomes one seer, not divided, in water.

analyzed: eṣa brahma lokaḥ samrāj
translated: This is the world of Brahman, O Emperor.

original: iti hainam anuśaśāsa yājñavalkyaḥ /🔽eṣāsya paramā gatiḥ /
analyzed: iti ha enam anuśaśāsa yājñavalkyaḥ  eṣā asya paramā gatiḥ
translated: Thus, indeed, did Yajnavalkya instruct him.🔽This is his highest goal.

analyzed: eṣā asya paramā saṃpad
translated: This is his highest prosperity.

analyzed: eṣa u sya paramaḥ lokaḥ
translated: This is his highest world.

analyzed: eṣaḥ sya paramaḥ ānandaḥ
translated: This is his highest bliss.

analyzed: etasya eva ānandasya anyāni bhūtāni mātrām upajīvanti
translated: The other beings live on a part of this bliss.

original: sa yo manūṣyāṇāṃ rāddhaḥ samṛddho bhavaty anyeṣām adhipatiḥ sarvair mānuṣyakair bhogaiḥ sampannatamaḥ sa manuṣyāṇāṃ parama ānandaḥ /
analyzed: sa yaḥ manūṣyāṇām rāddhaḥ samṛddhaḥ bhavati anyeṣām adhipatiḥ sarvaiḥ mānuṣyakaiḥ bhogaiḥ sampannatamaḥ sa manuṣyāṇām paramaḥ ānandaḥ
translated: He who among men is prosperous and successful, the lord of others, most perfect in all human enjoyments, he is the highest bliss of men.

original: atha ye śataṃ manuṣyāṇām ānandāḥ sa ekaḥ pitṝṇāṃ jitalokānām ānandaḥ /
analyzed: atha ye śatam manuṣyāṇām ānandāḥ saḥ ekaḥ pitṝṇām jita lokānām ānandaḥ
translated: Now, a hundred times the bliss of men is the bliss of the victorious ancestors.

original: atha ye śataṃ pitṝṇāṃ jitalokānām ānandāḥ sa eko gandharvaloka ānandaḥ /🔽atha ye śataṃ gandharvaloka ānandāḥ sa ekaḥ karmadevānām ānando ye karmaṇā devatvam abhisampadyante /
analyzed: atha ye śatam pitṝṇām jita lokānām ānandāḥ saḥ ekaḥ gandharva loke ānandaḥ  atha ye śatam gandharva loke ānandāḥ saḥ ekaḥ karma devānām ānandaḥ ye karmaṇā deva tvam abhisampadyante
translated: Now, a hundred times the joy of the Fathers who have conquered the worlds is one joy of the Gandharva world.🔽Now, a hundred times the joy of the Gandharva world is one joy of the gods who are gods by action.

original: atha ye śataṃ karmadevānām ānandāḥ sa eka ājānadevānām ānandaḥ /
analyzed: atha ye śatam karma devānām ānandāḥ saḥ ekaḥ ājāna devānām ānandaḥ
translated: Now, a hundred times the joy of the gods who are gods by action is one joy of the gods who are born of Brahman.

analyzed: yaḥ ca śrotriyaḥ vṛjino kāma hataḥ
translated: And of the one who is a learned Brahmin, free from bonds, and free from desire.

original: atha ye śatam ājānadevānām ānandāḥ sa ekaḥ prajāpatiloka ānandaḥ /
analyzed: atha ye śatam ājāna devānām ānandāḥ saḥ ekaḥ prajāpati loke ānandaḥ
translated: Now, a hundred times the joy of the gods who are born of Brahman is one joy of the world of Prajapati.

analyzed: yaḥ ca śrotriyaḥ vṛjino kāma hataḥ
translated: And of the one who is a learned Brahmin, free from bonds, and free from desire.

original: atha ye śataṃ prajāpatiloka ānandāḥ sa eko brahmaloka ānandaḥ /
analyzed: atha ye śatam prajāpati loke ānandāḥ saḥ ekaḥ brahma loke ānandaḥ
translated: Now, a hundred times the joy of the world of Prajapati is one joy of the world of Brahman.

analyzed: yaḥ ca śrotriyaḥ vṛjino kāma hataḥ
translated: And of the one who is a learned Brahmin, free from bonds, and free from desire.

analyzed: atha eṣaḥ eva paramaḥ ānandaḥ
translated: Now, this is the highest joy.

analyzed: eṣa brahma lokaḥ samrāj
translated: This is the world of Brahman, O King.

analyzed: iti ha uvāca yājñavalkyaḥ
translated: Thus spoke Yajnavalkya.

analyzed: saḥ ham bhagavate sahasram dadāmi
translated: I give the teacher a thousand.

analyzed: atas ūrdhvam vimokṣāya eva brūhi iti
translated: Speak further for the sake of liberation alone.

original: atra ha yājñavalkyo bibhayāṃ cakāra medhāvī rājā sarvebhyo māntebhya udarautsīd iti // / / //
analyzed: atra ha yājñavalkyaḥ bibhayām cakāra medhāvī rājā sarvebhyaḥ mā antebhyaḥ udarautsīt iti
translated: Here, indeed, Yajnavalkya was afraid, thinking, 'The king is wise; he will take away all my knowledge.'

original: sa vā eṣa etasmin svapnānte ratvā caritvā dṛṣṭvaiva puṇyaṃ ca pāpaṃ ca punaḥ pratinyāyaṃ pratiyony ādravati buddhāntāyaiva // / /
analyzed: sa vai eṣaḥ etasmin svapna ante ratvā caritvā dṛṣṭvā eva puṇyam ca pāpam ca punar pratinyāyam pratiyoni ādravati buddha antāya eva  /
translated: He, verily, having sported and moved about and seen good and evil in this dream, runs back again by the same way he came, to the place from which he started, to the waking state.

original: tad yathānaḥ susamāhitam utsarjaṃ yāyād evam evāyaṃ śārīra ātmā prājñenātmanānvārūḍha utsarjaṃ yāti /
analyzed: tat yathā anaḥ su samāhitam utsarjam yāyāt evam eva ayam śārīraḥ ātmā prājñena ātmanā anvārūḍhaḥ utsarjam yāti
translated: Just as a well-harnessed horse, when loosed, would run away, so does this embodied Self, mounted by the wise Self, run away when loosed.

analyzed: yatra etat ūrdhva ucchvāsī bhavati
translated: Wherein he becomes one who breathes upwards.

original: sa yatrāyam aṇimānaṃ nyeti jarayā vopatapatā vāṇimānaṃ nigacchati /
analyzed: sa yatra ayam aṇimānam nyeti jarayā vā upatapatā vā aṇimānam nigacchati
translated: When he goes to that subtlest part, either by old age or by being afflicted by disease, he goes to that subtlest part.

original: tad yathāmraṃ vodumbaraṃ vā pippalaṃ vā bandhanāt pramucyate /
analyzed: tat yathā āmram vā udumbaram vā pippalam vā bandhanāt pramucyate
translated: Just as a mango, or an udumbara, or a pippala is freed from its bonds,

original: evam evāyaṃ puruṣa ebhyo 'ṅgebhyaḥ saṃpramucya punaḥ pratinyāyaṃ pratiyony ādravati prāṇāyaiva // / / //
analyzed: evam eva ayam puruṣaḥ ebhyaḥ ṅgebhyaḥ saṃpramucya punar pratinyāyam pratiyoni ādravati prāṇāya eva
translated: even so this person, being freed from these limbs, runs back again by the same way he came, to the place from which he started, to the life-breath.

original: tad yathā rājānam āyantam ugrāḥ pratyenasaḥ sūtagrāmaṇyo 'nnaiḥ pānair avasathaiḥ pratikalpante 'yam āyāty ayam āgacchatīti /
analyzed: tat yathā rājānam āyantam ugrāḥ pratyenasaḥ sūta grāmaṇyaḥ nnaiḥ pānaiḥ avasathaiḥ pratikalpante yam āyāti ayam āgacchati iti
translated: Just as when a king is coming, the fierce enemies, the charioteers and village chiefs, prepare for him with food, drink, and houses, thinking, He is coming, he is coming.

original: evaṃ haivaṃvidaṃ sarvāṇi bhūtāni pratikalpanta idaṃ brahmāyātīdam āgacchatīti // / / //
analyzed: evam ha evaṃvidam sarvāṇi bhūtāni pratikalpante idam brahma āyāti idam āgacchati iti
translated: In the same way, all beings prepare for one who knows thus, thinking, Brahman is coming, Brahman is coming.

original: tad yathā rājānaṃ prayiyāsantam ugrāḥ pratyenasaḥ sūtagrāmaṇyo 'bhisamāyanti /
analyzed: tat yathā rājānam prayiyāsantam ugrāḥ pratyenasaḥ sūta grāmaṇyaḥ bhisamāyanti
translated: Just as when a king is about to depart, the fierce enemies, the charioteers and village chiefs, assemble around him.

original: evam evemam ātmānam antakāle sarve prāṇā abhisamāyanti /
analyzed: evam eva imam ātmānam anta kāle sarve prāṇāḥ abhisamāyanti
translated: In the same way, all the vital breaths assemble around this self at the time of death.

analyzed: yatra etat ūrdhva ucchvāsī bhavati
translated: When he breathes only through the upper nostril.

original: sa yatrāyam ātmābalyaṃ nyetya saṃmoham iva nyeti /
analyzed: sa yatra ayam ātmā abalyam nyetya saṃmoham iva nyeti
translated: When this self enters weakness and seems to enter confusion,

analyzed: atha enam ete prāṇāḥ abhisamāyanti
translated: then these vital breaths assemble around him.

original: sa etās tejomātrāḥ samabhyādadāno hṛdayam evānvavakrāmati /
analyzed: saḥ etāḥ tejaḥ mātrāḥ samabhyādadānaḥ hṛdayam eva anvavakrāmati
translated: Taking up these measures of light, he ascends to the heart.

original: sa yatraiṣa cākṣuṣaḥ puruṣaḥ parāṅ paryāvartate /
analyzed: sa yatra eṣa cākṣuṣaḥ puruṣaḥ parāṅ paryāvartate
translated: Where this person of the eye turns away,

original: athārūpajño bhavati // / / //🔽ekībhavati na paśyatīty āhuḥ /🔽ekībhavati na jighratīty āhuḥ /
analyzed: atha a rūpa jñaḥ bhavati  ekībhavati na paśyati iti āhuḥ  ekībhavati na jighrati iti āhuḥ
translated: then he becomes unaware of forms.🔽They say he becomes one and does not see.🔽They say he becomes one and does not smell.

analyzed: ekībhavati na rasayati iti āhuḥ
translated: They say he becomes one and does not taste.

analyzed: ekībhavati na vadati iti āhuḥ
translated: They say, 'It becomes one, it does not speak.'

original: ekībhavati na śṛṇotīty āhuḥ /🔽ekībhavati na manuta ity āhuḥ /
analyzed: ekībhavati na śṛṇoti iti āhuḥ  ekībhavati na manute iti āhuḥ
translated: They say, 'It becomes one, it does not hear.'🔽They say, 'It becomes one, it does not think.'

analyzed: ekībhavati na spṛśati iti āhuḥ
translated: They say, 'It becomes one, it does not touch.'

analyzed: ekībhavati na vijānāti iti āhuḥ
translated: They say, 'It becomes one, it does not know.'

analyzed: tasya ha etasya hṛdayasya agram pradyotate
translated: The tip of this heart shines forth.

analyzed: tena pradyotena eṣaḥ ātmā niṣkrāmati
translated: By that light this Self goes out.

original: cakṣuṣṭo vā mūrdhno vānyebhyo vā śarīradeśebhyaḥ /
analyzed: cakṣuṣṭas vā mūrdhnaḥ vā anyebhyaḥ vā śarīra deśebhyaḥ
translated: Either through the eye, or through the head, or through other parts of the body.

analyzed: tam utkrāmantam prāṇaḥ nu utkrāmati
translated: When it goes out, the vital breath follows it out.

analyzed: prāṇam anūtkrāmantam sarve prāṇāḥ anūtkrāmanti
translated: When the vital breath follows it out, all the vital breaths follow it out.

analyzed: sa vijñanaḥ bhavati
translated: He becomes conscious.

analyzed: saṃjānam eva anvavakrāmati
translated: Consciousness alone he follows.

analyzed: tam vidyā karmaṇī samanvārabhete pūrva prajñā ca
translated: Knowledge and action seize him, and his former wisdom.

original: tad yathā tṛṇajalāyukā tṛṇasyāntaṃ gatvānyam ākramam ākramyātmānam upasaṃharati /
analyzed: tat yathā tṛṇajalāyukā tṛṇasya antam gatvā anyam ākramam ākramya ātmānam upasaṃharati
translated: Just as a water-snake, having gone to the end of a blade of grass, seizes another support and withdraws itself,

original: evam evāyam ātmedaṃ śarīraṃ nihatyāvidyāṃ gamayitvānyam ākramam ākramyātmānam upasaṃharati // / / //
analyzed: evam eva ayam ātmā idam śarīram nihatya avidyām gamayitvā anyam ākramam ākramya ātmānam upasaṃharati
translated: even so this Self, having destroyed this body and cast off ignorance, seizes another support and withdraws itself.

original: tad yathā peśaskārī peśaso mātrām apādāyānyan navataraṃ kalyāṇataraṃ rūpaṃ tanute /
analyzed: tat yathā peśaskārī peśasaḥ mātrām apādāya anyat navataram kalyāṇataram rūpam tanute
translated: Just as a weaver, having removed the warp from the shafts, makes a new and better form,

original: evam evāyam ātmedaṃ śarīraṃ nihatyāvidyāṃ gamayitvānyan navataraṃ kalyāṇataraṃ rūpaṃ kurute /
analyzed: evam eva ayam ātmā idam śarīram nihatya avidyām gamayitvā anyat navataram kalyāṇataram rūpam kurute
translated: so this Self, having destroyed this body and cast off ignorance, makes for itself a new and better form.

original: pitryaṃ vā gāndharvaṃ vā daivaṃ vā prājāpatyaṃ vā brāhmaṃ vānyeṣāṃ vā bhūtānām // / / //
analyzed: pitryam vā gāndharvam vā daivam vā prājāpatyam vā brāhmam vā anyeṣām vā bhūtānām
translated: Whether it be of the Pitrs, Gandharvas, Devas, Prajāpatis, Brahmans, or of any other beings.

original: sa vā ayam ātmā brahma vijñānamayo manomayo prāṇamayaś cakṣurmayaḥ śrotramayaḥ pṛthivīmaya
analyzed: sa vai ayam ātmā brahma vijñāna mayaḥ manaḥ mayaḥ prāṇa mayaḥ cakṣuḥ mayaḥ śrotra mayaḥ pṛthivī maya
translated: This Self is Brahman, consisting of knowledge, consisting of mind, consisting of life, consisting of eyes, consisting of ears, consisting of earth,

original: āpomayo vāyumaya ākāśamayas tejomayo 'tejomayaḥ kāmamayo 'kāmamayaḥ krodhamayo 'krodhamayo
analyzed: āpaḥ mayaḥ vāyu mayaḥ ākāśa mayaḥ tejaḥ mayaḥ tejaḥ mayaḥ kāma mayaḥ kāma mayaḥ krodha mayaḥ krodha mayaḥ
translated: consisting of water, consisting of air, consisting of space, consisting of fire, consisting of what is not fire, consisting of desire, consisting of what is not desire, consisting of anger, consisting of what is not anger,

analyzed: dharma mayaḥ dharma mayaḥ sarva mayaḥ
translated: consisting of righteousness, consisting of what is not righteousness, consisting of all.

analyzed: tat yat etat idaṃmayaḥ domayaḥ iti
translated: That which is said to be 'consisting of this' and 'consisting of that',

analyzed: yathākārī yathācārī tathā bhavati
translated: one becomes like what one does, like what one practices.

analyzed: sādhu kārī sādhuḥ bhavati
translated: One who does good becomes good.

analyzed: pāpa kārī pāpaḥ bhavati
translated: One who does evil becomes evil.

analyzed: puṇyaḥ puṇyena karmaṇā pāpaḥ pāpena
translated: The virtuous by virtuous deeds, the sinful by sinful deeds.

analyzed: atha u khalu āhuḥ
translated: Now, they also say,

analyzed: kāma mayaḥ eva ayam puruṣaḥ iti
translated: this person consists of desire alone.

original: sa yathākāmo bhavati tatkratur bhavati /🔽yatkratur bhavati tat karma kurute /
analyzed: sa yathā kāmaḥ bhavati tad kratuḥ bhavati  yad kratuḥ bhavati tat karma kurute
translated: As he desires, so is his will.🔽As is his will, so he acts.

analyzed: yat karma kurute tat abhisaṃpadyate
translated: As he acts, so he attains.

analyzed: tat eṣa ślokaḥ bhavati
translated: This verse is about that:

original: tad eva saktaḥ saha karmaṇaiti liṅgaṃ mano yatra niṣaktam asya /
analyzed: tat eva saktaḥ saha karmaṇā eti liṅgam manaḥ yatra niṣaktam asya
translated: Attached to that very thing, he goes with his action, wherever his mind is attached.

original: prāpyāntaṃ karmaṇas tasya yat kiñceha karoty ayam /
analyzed: prāpya antam karmaṇaḥ tasya yat kiñca iha karoti ayam
translated: Having reached the end of that action, whatever he does here,

original: tasmāl lokāt punar aity asmai lokāya karmaṇe /
analyzed: tasmāt lokāt punar aiti asmai lokāya karmaṇe
translated: from that world he returns to this world for action.

analyzed: iti nu kāmayamānaḥ
translated: Thus, indeed, he who desires.

original: athākāmayamāno yo 'kāmo niṣkāma āptakāma ātmakāmo na tasya prāṇā utkrāmanti /
analyzed: atha a kāmayamānaḥ yaḥ kāmaḥ niṣkāmaḥ āpta kāmaḥ ātma kāmaḥ na tasya prāṇāḥ utkrāmanti
translated: Now, he who does not desire, who is desireless, who has attained desirelessness, who desires the Self, his vital breaths do not depart.

analyzed: brahma eva san brahma apyeti
translated: Being Brahman, he goes to Brahman.

analyzed: tat eṣa ślokaḥ bhavati
translated: This verse is about that:

original: yadā sarve pramucyante kāmā ye 'sya hṛdi śritāḥ /
analyzed: yadā sarve pramucyante kāmāḥ ye sya hṛdi śritāḥ
translated: When all the desires that lie within the heart are set free,

original: atha martyo 'mṛto bhavaty atra brahma samaśnuta iti /
analyzed: atha martyaḥ mṛtaḥ bhavati atra brahma samaśnute iti
translated: then the mortal becomes immortal; here he attains Brahman.

original: tad yathāhinirlvayanī valmīke mṛtā pratyastā śayīta /
analyzed: tat yathā ahi nirlvayanī valmīke mṛtā pratyastā śayīta
translated: Just as a snake-slough, cast off and lying in a heap,

analyzed: evam eva idam śarīram śete
translated: so does this body lie.

original: athāyam aśarīro 'mṛtaḥ prāṇo brahmaiva teja eva /
analyzed: atha ayam aśarīraḥ mṛtaḥ prāṇaḥ brahma eva tejaḥ eva
translated: But this bodiless immortal breath is Brahman itself, is light itself.

original: so 'haṃ bhagavate sahasraṃ dadāmīti hovāca janako vaidehaḥ // / / //
analyzed: saḥ ham bhagavate sahasram dadāmi iti ha uvāca janakaḥ vaidehaḥ
translated: I give a thousand (cows) to the Blessed Lord, said Janaka, the king of Videha.

analyzed: tat ete ślokāḥ bhavanti
translated: There are these verses:

original: aṇuḥ panthā vitataḥ purāṇo māṃ spṛṣṭo 'nuvitto mayaiva /
analyzed: aṇuḥ panthāḥ vitataḥ purāṇaḥ mām spṛṣṭaḥ nuvittaḥ mayā eva
translated: The ancient path, subtle and extended, has been touched by me and discovered by me alone.

original: tena dhīrā apiyanti brahmavidaḥ svargaṃ lokam ita ūrdhvaṃ vimuktāḥ // / / //
analyzed: tena dhīrāḥ apiyanti brahma vidaḥ svargam lokam itas ūrdhvam vimuktāḥ
translated: By that path the wise who know Brahman go to heaven, being liberated from here upwards.

original: tasmiñ śuklam uta nīlam āhuḥ piṅgalaṃ haritaṃ lohitaṃ ca /
analyzed: tasmin śuklam uta nīlam āhuḥ piṅgalam haritam lohitam ca
translated: In that (path) they call it white and blue, tawny, green, and red.

original: eṣa panthā brahmaṇā hānuvittas tenaiti brahmavit puṇyakṛt taijasaś ca // / / //
analyzed: eṣa panthāḥ brahmaṇā ha anuvittaḥ tena eti brahma vid puṇya kṛt taijasaḥ ca
translated: This is the path that has been discovered by Brahman. By it the knower of Brahman, the doer of good deeds, and the one of fiery splendor go.

analyzed: andham tamaḥ praviśanti ye vidyām upāsate
translated: Those who worship ignorance enter into blinding darkness.

original: tato bhūya iva te tamo ya u vidyāyāṃ ratāḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatas bhūyaḥ iva te tamaḥ ye u vidyāyām ratāḥ
translated: Even greater darkness than that is for those who delight in knowledge.

original: anandā nāma te lokā andhena tamasāvṛtāḥ /
analyzed: anandāḥ nāma te lokāḥ andhena tamasā āvṛtāḥ
translated: Those worlds are called 'unhappy,' covered by blinding darkness.

analyzed: tān te pretya abhigacchati a vidvāṃsaḥ budhāḥ janāḥ
translated: After death, the ignorant, unlearned people go to them.

original: ātmānaṃ ced vijānīyād ayam asmīti puruṣaḥ /
analyzed: ātmānam ced vijānīyāt ayam asmi iti puruṣaḥ
translated: If a person would know the self, thinking 'I am this,'

original: kim icchan kasya kāmāya śarīram anu saṃjvaret // / / //
analyzed: kim icchan kasya kāmāya śarīram anu saṃjvaret
translated: desiring what, for the sake of what desire, would he burn with passion for the body?

original: yasyānuvittaḥ pratibuddha ātmāsmin saṃdehye gahane praviṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: yasya anuvittaḥ pratibuddhaḥ ātmā asmin saṃdehye gahane praviṣṭaḥ
translated: Whose self, being known, being awakened, has entered this doubtful and dense (world),

original: sa viśvakṛt sa hi sarvasya kartā tasya lokaḥ sa u loka eva // / / //
analyzed: sa viśva kṛt sa hi sarvasya kartā tasya lokaḥ saḥ u lokaḥ eva
translated: He is the creator of the universe, he is the maker of all. His world is indeed the only world.

original: ihaiva santo 'tha vidmas tad vayaṃ na ced avedir mahatī vinaṣṭiḥ /
analyzed: iha eva santaḥ vidmaḥ tat vayam na ced avediḥ mahatī vinaṣṭiḥ
translated: We know that even here, if we do not know that, there is great destruction.

original: ye tad vidur amṛtās te bhavanty athetare duḥkham evāpiyanti // / / //
analyzed: ye tat viduḥ amṛtāḥ te bhavanti atha itare duḥkham eva apiyanti
translated: Those who know that become immortal, the others indeed go to sorrow.

analyzed: yadā etam anupaśyati atmānam devam aṅjasā
translated: When one sees this self as the manifest god,

analyzed: īśānam bhūta bhavyasya na tatas vijugupsate
translated: The lord of the past and the future, one does not despise it.

analyzed: yasmāt arvāk saṃvatsaraḥ hobhiḥ parivartate
translated: From which the year turns back with its days,

original: tad devā jyotiṣāṃ jyotir āyur hopāsate 'mṛtam // / / //
analyzed: tat devāḥ jyotiṣām jyotiḥ āyuḥ ha upāsate mṛtam
translated: The gods worship that light of the lights, the immortal life.

original: yasmin pañca pañcajanā ākāśaś ca pratiṣṭhitaḥ /
analyzed: yasmin pañca pañcajanāḥ ākāśaḥ ca pratiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: In whom the five people and space are established,

original: tam eva manya ātmānaṃ vidvān brahmāmṛto 'mṛtam // / / //
analyzed: tam eva manye ātmānam vidvān brahma amṛtaḥ mṛtam
translated: Knowing that very self as Brahman, the wise one becomes immortal and attains immortality.

original: prāṇasya prāṇam uta cakṣuṣaś cakṣur uta śrotrasya śrotram manaso ye mano viduḥ /
analyzed: prāṇasya prāṇam uta cakṣuṣaḥ cakṣuḥ uta śrotrasya śrotram manasaḥ ye manaḥ viduḥ
translated: Those who know the breath of the breath, the eye of the eye, the ear of the ear, and the mind of the mind,

analyzed: te nicikyuḥ brahma purāṇam agryam
translated: They have discerned that ancient primeval Brahman.

analyzed: manasā eva anudraṣṭavyam na iha nānā asti kim cana
translated: By the mind alone should it be seen, there is no diversity here at all.

original: mṛtyoḥ sa mṛtyum āpnoti ya iha nāneva paśyati/ / / //
analyzed: mṛtyoḥ sa mṛtyum āpnoti yaḥ iha nānā iva paśyati
translated: He who sees diversity here attains death after death.

analyzed: ekadhā eva anudraṣṭavyam etat apramayam dhruvam
translated: It should be seen as one only, this is the truth, the certain one.

original: virajaḥ para ākāśād aja ātmā mahān dhruvaḥ // / / //
analyzed: virajaḥ paras ākāśāt ajaḥ ātmā mahān dhruvaḥ
translated: Free from dust, higher than the sky, unborn, the great self, the eternal one.

original: tam eva dhīro vijñāya prajñāṃ kurvīta brāhmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: tam eva dhīraḥ vijñāya prajñām kurvīta brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: The wise brāhmaṇa, having known that alone, should make wisdom.

original: nānudhyāyād bahūñ chabdān vāco viglāpanaṃ hi tad iti // / / //
analyzed: na anudhyāyāt bahūm śabdān vācaḥ viglāpanam hi tat iti
translated: He should not meditate on many words, for that is the distraction of speech.

original: sa vā eṣa mahān aja ātmā yo 'yaṃ vijñānamayaḥ prāṇeṣu /
analyzed: sa vai eṣa mahān ajaḥ ātmā yaḥ yam vijñāna mayaḥ prāṇeṣu
translated: That is this great unborn self, which is made of consciousness, among the vital breaths.

original: ya eṣo 'ntar hṛdaya ākāśas tasmiñ chete /🔽sarvasya vaśī /🔽sarvasyeśānaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ eṣaḥ ntar hṛdaye ākāśaḥ tasmin śete  sarvasya vaśī  sarvasya īśānaḥ
translated: He who is in the space within the heart, he lies there.🔽He is the controller of all.🔽He is the lord of all.

analyzed: sarvasya adhipatiḥ  sa na sādhunā karmaṇā bhūyān
translated: He is the overlord of all.🔽He does not become greater by good deeds.

analyzed: na u eva a sādhunā kanīyān
translated: Nor does he become smaller by bad deeds.

analyzed: eṣa sarva īśvaraḥ  eṣa bhūta adhipatiḥ
translated: He is the lord of all.🔽He is the lord of beings.

analyzed: eṣa bhūta pālaḥ
translated: He is the protector of beings.

original: eṣa setur vidharaṇa eṣāṃ lokānām asaṃbhedāya /
analyzed: eṣa setuḥ vidharaṇaḥ eṣām lokānām a saṃbhedāya
translated: He is the dam, the support, for the non-disruption of these worlds.

original: tam etaṃ vedānuvacanena brāhmaṇā vividiṣanti yajñena dānena tapasānāśakena /
analyzed: tam etam veda anuvacanena brāhmaṇāḥ vividiṣanti yajñena dānena tapasā anāśakena
translated: The brāhmaṇas seek to know him through the recitation of the Vedas, through sacrifice, through giving, through austerity, through the unbreakable [vow].

analyzed: etam eva viditvā muniḥ bhavati
translated: Knowing this, one becomes a sage.

original: etam eva pravrājino lokam icchantaḥ pravrajanti // / / //
analyzed: etam eva pravrājinaḥ lokam icchantaḥ pravrajanti
translated: Desiring this very world of the renunciant, they go forth.

analyzed: tat etat ṛcā abhyuktam
translated: This is stated in the Ṛc:

original: eṣa nityo mahimā brāhmaṇasya na karmaṇā vardhate no kanīyān /
analyzed: eṣa nityaḥ mahimā brāhmaṇasya na karmaṇā vardhate na u kanīyān
translated: This is the eternal greatness of the brāhmaṇa. It does not increase through action, nor does it decrease.

original: tasyaiva syāt padavittaṃ viditvā na lipyate karmaṇā pāpakeneti /
analyzed: tasya eva syāt pada vittam viditvā na lipyate karmaṇā pāpakena iti
translated: Having known the state of him who knows this, one is not tainted by sinful action.

original: tasmād evaṃvic chānto dānta uparatas titikṣuḥ samāhito bhūtvātmany evātmānaṃ paśyati /
analyzed: tasmāt evaṃvid śāntaḥ dāntaḥ uparataḥ titikṣuḥ samāhitaḥ bhūtvā ātmani eva ātmānam paśyati
translated: Therefore, one who knows this, being tranquil, self-controlled, restrained, patient, and concentrated, sees the self in the self.

analyzed: sarvam ātmānam paśyati
translated: He sees the self in all.

analyzed: na enam pāpmā tarati
translated: Sin does not overcome him.

analyzed: sarvam pāpmānam tarati
translated: He overcomes all sin.

analyzed: na enam pāpmā tapati
translated: Sin does not torment him.

analyzed: sarvam pāpmānam tapati
translated: He torments all sin.

analyzed: vipāpaḥ virajaḥ vicikitsaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhavati
translated: He becomes a brāhmaṇa free from sin, free from impurity, free from doubt.

analyzed: eṣa brahma lokaḥ samrāj
translated: This is the world of Brahman, O Emperor.

analyzed: enam si iti ha uvāca yājñavalkyaḥ
translated: Yājñavalkya said, I have brought you to this.

original: so 'haṃ bhagavate videhān dadāmi mām cāpi saha dāsyāyeti // / / //
analyzed: saḥ u ham bhagavate videhān dadāmi mām ca api saha dāsyāya iti
translated: I give you the Videha country and myself along with the slaves.

original: sa vā eṣa mahān aja ātmānnādo vasudānaḥ /
analyzed: sa vai eṣa mahān ajaḥ ātmā anna ādaḥ vasu dānaḥ
translated: He is the great unborn self, the giver of wealth.

analyzed: vindate vasu yaḥ evam veda
translated: One who knows this obtains wealth.

original: sa vā eṣa mahān aja ātmājaro 'maro 'mṛto 'bhayo brahma /
analyzed: sa vai eṣa mahān ajaḥ ātmā ajaraḥ maraḥ mṛtaḥ bhayaḥ brahma
translated: He is the great unborn Self, undecaying, undying, immortal, fearless. He is Brahman.

analyzed: abhayam vai brahma
translated: Brahman, verily, is fearless.

original: abhayaṃ hi vai brahma bhavati ya evaṃ veda // / / //
analyzed: abhayam hi vai brahma bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: For, verily, he who knows thus becomes fearless, Brahman.

original: atha ha yājñavalkyasya dve bhārye babhūvatur maitreyī ca kātyāyanī ca /
analyzed: atha ha yājñavalkyasya dve bhārye babhūvatuḥ maitreyī ca kātyāyanī ca
translated: Now, Yajnavalkya had two wives, Maitreyi and Katyayani.

analyzed: tayoḥ ha maitreyī brahma vādinī babhūva
translated: Of them, Maitreyi was a speaker of Brahman.

analyzed: strī prajñā eva tarhi kātyāyanī
translated: Katyayani, on the other hand, was a mere woman's understanding.

analyzed: atha ha yājñavalkyaḥ nyat vṛttam upākariṣyan
translated: Then Yajnavalkya, intending to take up another way of life,

analyzed: maitreyi iti ha uvāca yājñavalkyaḥ
translated: Yajnavalkya said to Maitreyi:

original: pravrajiṣyan vā are 'ham asmāt sthānād asmi /
analyzed: pravrajiṣyan vai are ham asmāt sthānāt asmi
translated: I am going away from this place, my dear, to wander forth.

analyzed: hanta te nayā katyāyanyā antam karavāṇi iti
translated: Let me make an end with this Katyayani of yours.

analyzed: sā ha uvāca maitreyī
translated: Maitreyi said:

original: yan nu ma iyam bhagoḥ sarvā pṛthivī vittena pūrṇā syāt syāṃ nv ahaṃ neti /
analyzed: yat nu me iyam sarvā pṛthivī vittena pūrṇā syāt syām nu aham tena amṛtā aho na iti
translated: If now this entire earth filled with wealth were mine, would I be immortal, sir?

analyzed: na iti ha uvāca yājñavalkyaḥ
translated: No, said Yajnavalkya.

analyzed: yathā eva upakaraṇavatām jīvitam
translated: As is the life of those who have means,

analyzed: tathā eva te jīvitam syāt
translated: so would be your life.

analyzed: amṛta tvasya tu na āśā asti vittena iti
translated: But there is no way to immortality by wealth.

analyzed: sā ha uvāca maitreyī
translated: Maitreyi said:

original: yenāhaṃ nāmṛtā syām kim ahaṃ tena kuryām /
analyzed: yena aham na amṛtā syām kim aham tena kuryām
translated: What should I do with that by which I would not be immortal?

original: yad eva bhagavān veda tad eva me brūhīti // / / //
analyzed: yat eva bhagavān veda tat eva me brūhi iti
translated: Whatever the Blessed One knows, just that tell me.

analyzed: sa ha uvāca yājñavalkyaḥ
translated: He, Yajnavalkya, said:

original: priyā vai khalu no bhavatī satī priyam avṛdhat /
analyzed: priyā vai khalu naḥ bhavatī satī priyam avṛdhat
translated: Indeed, O Blessed One, you, being dear to us, have increased what is dear.

analyzed: hanta tarhi
translated: Well then,

analyzed: bhavati etat vyākhyāsyāmi te
translated: I will explain this to you.

analyzed: vyācakṣāṇasya tu me nididhyāsasva iti
translated: But while I am explaining, reflect on it.

analyzed: sa ha uvāca
translated: He said:

original: na vā are patyuḥ kāmāya patiḥ priyo bhavaty ātmanas tu kāmāya patiḥ priyo bhavati /
analyzed: na vai are patyuḥ kāmāya patiḥ priyaḥ bhavati ātmanaḥ tu kāmāya patiḥ priyaḥ bhavati
translated: O dear one, a husband is not dear for the sake of the wife's desire, but a husband is dear for the sake of one's own desire.

original: na vā are jāyāyai kāmāya jāyā priyā bhavaty ātmanas tu kāmāya jāyā priyā bhavati /
analyzed: na vai are jāyāyai kāmāya jāyā priyā bhavati ātmanaḥ tu kāmāya jāyā priyā bhavati
translated: A wife is not dear for the sake of the wife's desire, but a wife is dear for the sake of one's own desire.

original: na vā are putrāṇāṃ kāmāya putrāḥ priyā bhavanty ātmanas tu kāmāya putrāḥ priyā bhavanti /
analyzed: na vai are putrāṇām kāmāya putrāḥ priyāḥ bhavanti ātmanaḥ tu kāmāya putrāḥ priyāḥ bhavanti
translated: Sons are not dear for the sake of the sons' desire, but sons are dear for the sake of one's own desire.

original: na vā are vittasya kāmāya vittaṃ priyaṃ bhavaty ātmanas tu kāmāya vittaṃ priyaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: na vai are vittasya kāmāya vittam priyam bhavati ātmanaḥ tu kāmāya vittam priyam bhavati
translated: Wealth is not dear for the sake of wealth's desire, but wealth is dear for the sake of one's own desire.

original: na vā are paśūnāṃ kāmāya paśavaḥ priyaṃ bhavaty ātmanas tu kāmāya paśavaḥ priyaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: na vai are paśūnām kāmāya paśavaḥ priyam bhavati ātmanaḥ tu kāmāya paśavaḥ priyam bhavati
translated: Cattle are not dear for the sake of cattle's desire, but cattle are dear for the sake of one's own desire.

original: na vā are brahmaṇaḥ kāmāya brahma priyaṃ bhavaty ātmanas tu kāmāya brahma priyaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: na vai are brahmaṇaḥ kāmāya brahma priyam bhavati ātmanaḥ tu kāmāya brahma priyam bhavati
translated: Verily, O friend, Brahman is not dear for the sake of the desire for Brahman, but Brahman is dear for the sake of the self.

original: na vā are kṣatrasya kāmāya kṣatraṃ priyaṃ bhavaty ātmanas tu kāmāya kṣatraṃ priyaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: na vai are kṣatrasya kāmāya kṣatram priyam bhavati ātmanaḥ tu kāmāya kṣatram priyam bhavati
translated: Verily, O friend, the Kshatriya is not dear for the sake of the desire for the Kshatriya, but the Kshatriya is dear for the sake of the self.

original: na vā are lokānāṃ kāmāya lokāḥ priyā bhavanty ātmanas tu kāmāya lokāḥ priyā bhavanti /
analyzed: na vai are lokānām kāmāya lokāḥ priyāḥ bhavanti ātmanaḥ tu kāmāya lokāḥ priyāḥ bhavanti
translated: Verily, O friend, the worlds are not dear for the sake of the desire for the worlds, but the worlds are dear for the sake of the self.

original: na vā are devānāṃ kāmāya devāḥ priyā bhavanty ātmanas tu kāmāya devāḥ priyā bhavanti /
analyzed: na vai are devānām kāmāya devāḥ priyāḥ bhavanti ātmanaḥ tu kāmāya devāḥ priyāḥ bhavanti
translated: Verily, O friend, the gods are not dear for the sake of the desire for the gods, but the gods are dear for the sake of the self.

original: na vā are vedānāṃ kāmāya vedāḥ priyā bhavanty ātmanas tu kāmāya vedāḥ priyā bhavanti /
analyzed: na vai are vedānām kāmāya vedāḥ priyāḥ bhavanti ātmanaḥ tu kāmāya vedāḥ priyāḥ bhavanti
translated: Verily, O friend, the Vedas are not dear for the sake of the desire for the Vedas, but the Vedas are dear for the sake of the self.

original: na vā are bhūtānāṃ kāmāya bhūtāni priyāṇi bhavanty ātmanas tu kāmāya bhūtāni priyāṇi bhavanti /
analyzed: na vai are bhūtānām kāmāya bhūtāni priyāṇi bhavanti ātmanaḥ tu kāmāya bhūtāni priyāṇi bhavanti
translated: Verily, O friend, the beings are not dear for the sake of the desire for the beings, but the beings are dear for the sake of the self.

original: na vā are sarvasya kāmāya sarvaṃ priyaṃ bhavaty ātmanas tu kāmāya sarvaṃ priyaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: na vai are sarvasya kāmāya sarvam priyam bhavati ātmanaḥ tu kāmāya sarvam priyam bhavati
translated: Verily, O friend, everything is not dear for the sake of the desire for everything, but everything is dear for the sake of the self.

original: ātmā vā are draṣṭavyaḥ śrotavyo mantavyo nididhyāsitavyo maitreyi /
analyzed: ātmā vai are draṣṭavyaḥ śrotavyaḥ mantavyaḥ nididhyāsitavyaḥ maitreyi
translated: Verily, O friend, the self is to be seen, to be heard, to be thought, to be reflected upon.

original: ātmani khalv are dṛṣṭe śrute mate vijñāta idaṃ sarvaṃ viditam // / / //
analyzed: ātmani khalu are dṛṣṭe śrute mate vijñāte idam sarvam viditam
translated: When the Self alone is seen, heard, thought, and known, then all this is known.

original: brahma taṃ parādād yo 'nyatrātmano vedān veda /
analyzed: brahma tam parādāt yaḥ nyatra ātmanaḥ vedān veda
translated: Brahman has passed over him who knows the Vedas as something other than the Self.

original: kṣatraṃ taṃ parādād yo 'nyatrātmanaḥ kṣatraṃ veda /
analyzed: kṣatram tam parādāt yaḥ nyatra ātmanaḥ kṣatram veda
translated: The Kshatriya has passed over him who knows the Kshatriya as something other than the Self.

original: lokās taṃ parādur yo 'nyatrātmano lokān veda /
analyzed: lokāḥ tam parāduḥ yaḥ nyatra ātmanaḥ lokān veda
translated: The worlds have passed over him who knows the worlds as something other than the Self.

original: devās taṃ parādur yo 'nyatrātmano devān veda /
analyzed: devāḥ tam parāduḥ yaḥ nyatra ātmanaḥ devān veda
translated: The gods have passed over him who knows the gods as something other than the Self.

original: vedās taṃ parādur yo 'nyatrātmano vedān veda /
analyzed: vedāḥ tam parāduḥ yaḥ nyatra ātmanaḥ vedān veda
translated: The Vedas have passed over him who knows the Vedas as something other than the Self.

original: bhūtāni taṃ parādur yo 'nyatrātmano bhūtāni veda /
analyzed: bhūtāni tam parāduḥ yaḥ nyatra ātmanaḥ bhūtāni veda
translated: The beings have passed over him who knows the beings as something other than the Self.

original: sarvaṃ taṃ parādād yo 'nyatrātmanaḥ sarvaṃ veda /
analyzed: sarvam tam parādāt yaḥ nyatra ātmanaḥ sarvam veda
translated: Everything has passed over him who knows everything as something other than the Self.

original: idaṃ brahmedaṃ kṣatram ime lokā ime devā ime vedā imāni bhūtānīdaṃ sarvaṃ yad ayam ātmā // / / //
analyzed: idam brahma idam kṣatram ime lokāḥ ime devāḥ ime vedāḥ imāni bhūtāni idam sarvam yat ayam ātmā
translated: This is Brahman, this is the Kshatriya, these are the worlds, these are the gods, these are the Vedas, these are the beings, this is all that is, namely this Self.

original: sa yathā dundubher hanyamānasya na bāhyāñ chabdāñ chaknuyād grahaṇāya /
analyzed: sa yathā dundubheḥ hanyamānasya na bāhyām śabdām śaknuyāt grahaṇāya
translated: Just as one cannot grasp the external sounds of a beaten drum,

original: dundubhes tu grahaṇena dundubhyāghātasya vā śabdo gṛhītaḥ // / / //
analyzed: dundubheḥ tu grahaṇena dundubhi āghātasya vā śabdaḥ gṛhītaḥ
translated: but by grasping the drum or the beating of the drum, the sound is grasped.

original: sa yathā śaṅkhasya dhmāyamānasya na bāhyāñ chabdāñ chaknuyād grahaṇāya /
analyzed: sa yathā śaṅkhasya dhmāyamānasya na bāhyām śabdām śaknuyāt grahaṇāya
translated: As one would not be able to grasp the external sounds of a blown conch,

original: śaṅkhasya tu grahaṇena śaṅkhadhmasya vā śabdo gṛhītaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śaṅkhasya tu grahaṇena śaṅkhadhmasya vā śabdaḥ gṛhītaḥ
translated: but by grasping the conch or the conch-blower, the sound is grasped.

original: sa yathā vīṇāyai vādyamānāyai na bāhyāñ chabdāñ chaknuyād grahaṇāya /
analyzed: sa yathā vīṇāyai vādyamānāyai na bāhyām śabdām śaknuyāt grahaṇāya
translated: As one would not be able to grasp the external sounds of a played vīṇā,

original: vīṇāyai tu grahaṇena vīṇāvādasya vā śabdo grhītaḥ // / / //🔽sa yathārdraidhāgner abhyāhitasya pṛthag dhūmā viniścaranty evaṃ vā are 'sya mahato
analyzed: vīṇāyai tu grahaṇena vīṇā vādasya vā śabdaḥ grhītaḥ  sa yathā ārdra edha agneḥ abhyāhitasya pṛthak dhūmāḥ viniścaranti evam vai are sya mahataḥ
translated: but by grasping the vīṇā or the vīṇā-player, the sound is grasped.

original: bhūtasya niḥśvasitam etad yad ṛgvedo yajurvedaḥ sāmavedo 'tharvāṅgirasa itihāsaḥ
analyzed: bhūtasya niḥśvasitam etat yat ṛgvedaḥ yajurvedaḥ sāmavedaḥ tharvāṅgirasaḥ itihāsaḥ
translated: As from a wet-fuelled fire that is blown, separate smokes issue forth, so, my dear, this Ṛg Veda, Yajur Veda, Sāma Veda, Atharva-Aṅgiras, Itihāsa,

original: purāṇaṃ vidyā upaniṣadaḥ ślokāḥ sūtrāṇy anuvyākhyānāni vyākhyānanīṣṭaṃ hutam āśitaṃ
analyzed: purāṇam vidyāḥ upaniṣadaḥ ślokāḥ sūtrāṇi anuvyākhyānāni vyākhyāna nīṣṭam hutam āśitam
translated: Purāṇa, Vidyā, Upaniṣads, Ślokas, Sūtras, Anuvyañjanas, Vyājanas, desired, offered oblations, eaten,

original: pāyitam ayaṃ ca lokaḥ paraś ca lokaḥ sarvāṇi ca bhūtāni /
analyzed: pāyitam ayam ca lokaḥ paraḥ ca lokaḥ sarvāṇi ca bhūtāni
translated: drunk, this world, the other world, and all beings.

analyzed: asya eva etāni sarvāṇi niśvasitāni
translated: All these are the out-breathings of that very [Self].

original: sa yathā sarvāsām apāṃ samudra ekāyanam /
analyzed: sa yathā sarvāsām apām samudraḥ ekāyanam
translated: As the ocean is the one destination of all waters,

analyzed: evam sarveṣām sparśānām tvac ekāyanam
translated: so the skin is the one destination of all touches.

analyzed: evam sarveṣām gandhānām nāsike ekāyanam
translated: Thus the nose is the one path of all smells.

analyzed: evam sarveṣām rasānām jihvā ekāyanam
translated: Thus the tongue is the one path of all tastes.

analyzed: evam sarveṣām rūpāṇām cakṣuḥ ekāyanam
translated: Thus the eye is the one path of all forms.

analyzed: evam sarveṣam śabdānām śrotram ekāyanam
translated: Thus the ear is the one path of all sounds.

analyzed: evam sarveṣām saṃkalpānām manaḥ ekāyanam
translated: Thus the mind is the one path of all intentions.

analyzed: evam sarvāsām vidyānām hṛdayam ekāyanam
translated: Thus the heart is the one path of all knowledge.

original: evaṃ sarveṣāṃ karmaṇāṃ hastāv ekāyanam /🔽evaṃ sarveṣām ānandānām upastha ekāyanam /🔽evaṃ sarveṣāṃ visargāṇāṃ pāyur ekāyanam /
analyzed: evam sarveṣām karmaṇām hastau ekāyanam  evam sarveṣām ānandānām upasthaḥ ekāyanam  evam sarveṣām visargāṇām pāyuḥ ekāyanam
translated: Thus the hands are the one path of all actions.🔽Thus the penis is the one path of all joys.🔽Thus the anus is the one path of all emissions.

analyzed: evam sarveṣām adhvanām pādau ekāyanam
translated: Thus the feet are the one path of all journeys.

analyzed: evam sarveṣām vedānām vāc ekāyanam
translated: Thus speech is the one path of all the Vedas.

original: sa yathā saindhavaghano 'nantaro 'bāhyaḥ kṛtsno rasaghana eva /
analyzed: sa yathā saindhava ghanaḥ nantaraḥ bāhyaḥ kṛtsnaḥ rasa ghanaḥ eva
translated: Just as this salt does not differ anywhere inside or outside, being entirely a mass of taste,

original: evaṃ vā are 'yam ātmānantaro 'bāhyaḥ kṛtsnaḥ prajñānaghana eva /
analyzed: evam vai are yam ātmā anantaraḥ bāhyaḥ kṛtsnaḥ prajñāna ghanaḥ eva
translated: so, my dear, this Self does not differ anywhere inside or outside, being entirely a mass of knowledge.

analyzed: etebhyaḥ bhūtebhyaḥ samutthāya tāni eva anuvinayati
translated: Having risen from these elements, it merges into them again.

analyzed: na pretya saṃjñā asti iti are bravīmi
translated: After death, there is no consciousness, my dear, I declare.

analyzed: iti ha uvāca yājñavalkyaḥ
translated: Thus spoke Yajnavalkya.

analyzed: sā ha uvāca maitreyī
translated: Maitreyi said:

analyzed: atra eva mā bhagavān moha antam āpīpadat
translated: Sir, please do not confuse me.

analyzed: na vai aham imam vijānāmi iti
translated: I do not understand this.

original: sa hovāca na vā are 'haṃ mohaṃ bravīmi /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca na vai are ham moham bravīmi
translated: He said: I am not confusing you, my dear.

original: avināśī vā are 'yam ātmānucchittidharmā // / / //🔽yatra hi dvaitam iva bhavati tad itara itaraṃ paśyati /🔽tad itara itaraṃ jighrati /🔽tad itara itaraṃ rasayate /🔽tad itara itaram abhivadati /
analyzed: avināśī vai are yam ātmā an ucchitti dharmā  yatra hi dvaitam iva bhavati tat itaraḥ itaram paśyati  tat itaraḥ itaram jighrati  tat itaraḥ itaram rasayate  tat itaraḥ itaram abhivadati
translated: This self is indestructible, my dear, and cannot be destroyed.

original: tad itara itaraṃ śṛṇoti /🔽tad itara itaraṃ manute / tad itara itaraṃ spṛśati /🔽tad itara itaraṃ vijānāti /🔽yatra tv asya sarvam ātmaivābhūt tat kena kaṃ paśyet tat kena kaṃ jighret tat kena🔽kaṃ rasayet tat kena kam abhivadet tat kena kaṃ śṛṇuyāt tat kena kaṃ manvīta tat
analyzed: tat itaraḥ itaram śṛṇoti  tat itaraḥ itaram manute tat itaraḥ itaram spṛśati  tat itaraḥ itaram vijānāti  yatra tu asya sarvam ātmā eva abhūt tat kena kam paśyet tat kena kam jighret tat kena  kam rasayet tat kena kam abhivadet tat kena kam śṛṇuyāt tat kena kam manvīta tat
translated: Where there is duality as it were, then one sees the other, then one smells the other, then one tastes the other, then one speaks to the other, then one hears the other, then one thinks of the other, then one touches the other, then one understands the other.

original: kena kaṃ spṛśet tat kena kaṃ vijānīyāt /
analyzed: kena kam spṛśet tat kena kam vijānīyāt
translated: But when the self alone becomes all this, then how should he see another? How should he smell another? How should he taste another? How should he speak to another? How should he hear another? How should he think of another? How should he touch another? How should he understand another?

original: yenedaṃ sarvaṃ vijānāti taṃ kena vijānīyāt /
analyzed: yena idam sarvam vijānāti tam kena vijānīyāt
translated: By what could he know the knower?

analyzed: saḥ eṣa na iti na iti ātmā
translated: That self is to be described by 'No, no'.

original: agṛhyo na hi gṛhyate /🔽aśīryo na hi śīryate /🔽asaṅgo na hi sajyate /
analyzed: a gṛhyaḥ na hi gṛhyate  a śīryaḥ na hi śīryate  a saṅgaḥ na hi sajyate
translated: It is ungraspable, for it cannot be grasped.🔽It is unbreakable, for it cannot be broken.🔽It is unattached, for it does not get attached.

analyzed: a sitaḥ na vyathate na riṣyati
translated: It is not white, not pained, not injured.

original: vijñātāram are kena vijānīyād ity uktānuśāsanāsi maitreyi /
analyzed: vijñātāram are kena vijānīyāt iti ukta anuśāsanā asi maitreyi
translated: By what could one know the knower? Thus instructed, Maitreyi,

original: etāvad are khalv amṛtatvam iti hoktvā yājñavalkyo vijahāra // / / //
analyzed: etāvat are khalu amṛta tvam iti ha uktvā yājñavalkyaḥ vijahāra
translated: having said, This much, indeed, is immortality, Yajnavalkya departed.

analyzed: atha vaṃśaḥ  pautimāṣyaḥ gaupavanāt
translated: Now, the genealogy:🔽Pautimashiya from Gaupavana.

analyzed: gaupavanaḥ pautimāṣyāt  pautimāṣyaḥ gaupavanāt  gaupavanaḥ kauśikāt
translated: Gaupavana from Pautimashiya.🔽Pautimashiya from Gaupavana.🔽Gaupavana from Kaushika.

analyzed: kauśikaḥ kauṇḍinyāt
translated: Kaushika from Kaundinya.

analyzed: kauṇḍinyaḥ śāṇḍilyāt
translated: Kaundinya from Shandilya.

analyzed: śāṇḍilyaḥ kauśikāt ca gautamāt ca
translated: Shandilya from Kaushika and Gautama.

analyzed: gautamaḥ
translated: Gautama from...

analyzed: agniveśyāt
translated: Agniveshya.

analyzed: agniveśyaḥ gārgyāt
translated: Agniveshya from Gargya.

analyzed: gārgyaḥ gārgyāt  gārgyaḥ gautamāt
translated: Gargya from Gargya.🔽Gargya from Gautama.

analyzed: gautamaḥ saitavāt
translated: Gautama from Saivata.

analyzed: saitavaḥ pārāśaryāyaṇāt  pārāśaryāyaṇaḥ gārgyāyaṇāt
translated: Saivata from Parasharyayana.🔽Parasharyayana from Gargyayana.

analyzed: gārgyāyaṇaḥ uddālakāyanāt  uddālakāyanaḥ jābālāyanāt
translated: Gargyayana from Uddalakyayana.🔽Uddalakyayana from Jabalayana.

analyzed: jābālāyanaḥ mādhyandināyanāt
translated: Jabalayana from Madhyandinyayana.

analyzed: mādhyandināyanaḥ saukarāyaṇāt
translated: Madhyandinyayana from Saukaryayana.

analyzed: saukarāyaṇaḥ kāṣāyaṇāt
translated: Saukaryayana from Kashyayana.

analyzed: kāṣāyaṇaḥ sāyakāyanāt  sākāyanaḥ kauśikāyaneḥ
translated: Kāṣāyaṇa from Sāyakāyana.🔽Sākayana from Kauśikāyana.

analyzed: kauśikāyaniḥ
translated: Kauśikāyani from ...

analyzed: ghṛtakauśikāt
translated: Ghṛtakaushika.

analyzed: ghṛtakauśikaḥ pārāśaryāt
translated: Ghṛtakaushika from Pārāśarya.
