analyzed: cakṣuḥ ha uccakrāma
translated: The eye went out.

original: tat saṃvatsaraṃ proṣyāgatyovāca katham aśakata mad ṛte jīvitum iti /
analyzed: tat saṃvatsaram proṣya āgatya uvāca katham aśakata mat ṛte jīvitum iti
translated: After staying away for a year, it returned and said, How did you manage to live without me?

original: te hocuḥ yathāndhā apaśyantaś cakṣuṣā prāṇantaḥ prāṇena vadanto vācā śṛṇvantaḥ śrotreṇa vidvāṃso manasā prajāyamānā retasaivam ajīviṣmeti
analyzed: te ha ūcuḥ yathā andhāḥ a paśyantaḥ cakṣuṣā prāṇantaḥ prāṇena vadantaḥ vācā śṛṇvantaḥ śrotreṇa vidvāṃsaḥ manasā prajāyamānāḥ retasā evam ajīviṣma iti
translated: They said, 'As the blind, not seeing with the eye, not breathing with the breath, not speaking with the voice, not hearing with the ear, not knowing with the mind, not procreating with the seed, so we have lived.'

analyzed: praviveśa ha cakṣuḥ
translated: The eye entered in.

analyzed: śrotram ha uccakrāma
translated: The ear went away.

original: tat saṃvatsaraṃ proṣyāgatyovāca katham aśakata mad ṛte jīvitum iti /
analyzed: tat saṃvatsaram proṣya āgatya uvāca katham aśakata mat ṛte jīvitum iti
translated: Having stayed away for a year, it came back and said, 'How did you manage to live without me?'

original: te hocuḥ yathā badhirā aśṛṇvantaḥ śrotreṇa prāṇantaḥ prāṇena vadanto vācā paśyantaś cakṣuṣā vidvāṃso manasā prajāyamānā retasaivam ajīviṣmeti
analyzed: te ha ūcuḥ yathā badhirāḥ a śṛṇvantaḥ śrotreṇa prāṇantaḥ prāṇena vadantaḥ vācā paśyantaḥ cakṣuṣā vidvāṃsaḥ manasā prajāyamānāḥ retasā evam ajīviṣma iti
translated: They said, 'As the deaf, not hearing with the ear, breathing with the breath, speaking with the voice, seeing with the eye, knowing with the mind, procreating with the seed, so we have lived.'

analyzed: praviveśa ha śrotram
translated: The ear entered in.

analyzed: manaḥ ha uccakrāma
translated: The mind went away.

original: tat saṃvatsaraṃ proṣyāgatyovāca katham aśakata mad ṛte jīvitum iti /
analyzed: tat saṃvatsaram proṣya āgatya uvāca katham aśakata mat ṛte jīvitum iti
translated: Having stayed away for a year, it came back and said, 'How did you manage to live without me?'

original: te hocuḥ yathā mugdhā avidvāṃso manasā prāṇantaḥ prāṇena vadanto vācā paśyantaś cakṣuṣā śṛṇvantaḥ śrotreṇa prajāyamānā retasaivam ajīviṣmeti
analyzed: te ha ūcuḥ yathā mugdhāḥ a vidvāṃsaḥ manasā prāṇantaḥ prāṇena vadantaḥ vācā paśyantaḥ cakṣuṣā śṛṇvantaḥ śrotreṇa prajāyamānāḥ retasā evam ajīviṣma iti
translated: They said, 'As the foolish, not knowing with the mind, breathing with the breath, speaking with the voice, seeing with the eye, hearing with the ear, procreating with the seed, so we have lived.'🔽The mind entered in.

analyzed: praviveśa ha manaḥ 🔽retaḥ ha uccakrāma
translated: The seed went away.

original: tat saṃvatsaraṃ proṣyāgatyovāca katham aśakata mad ṛte jīvitum iti /
analyzed: tat saṃvatsaram proṣya āgatya uvāca katham aśakata mat ṛte jīvitum iti
translated: Having returned after a year, he said, 'How did you live without me?'

original: te hocuḥ yathā klībā aprajāyamānā retāsā prāṇantaḥ prāṇena vadanto vācā paśyantaś cakṣuṣā śṛṇvantaḥ śrotreṇa vidvāṃso manasaivam ajīviṣmeti
analyzed: te ha ūcuḥ yathā klībāḥ a prajāyamānāḥ retāsā prāṇantaḥ prāṇena vadantaḥ vācā paśyantaḥ cakṣuṣā śṛṇvantaḥ śrotreṇa vidvāṃsaḥ manasā evam ajīviṣma iti
translated: They said, 'Just as eunuchs, unable to procreate, breathing with semen, speaking with speech, seeing with the eye, hearing with the ear, knowing with the mind, so we lived.'

analyzed: praviveśa ha retaḥ
translated: He entered into the semen.

original: atha ha prāṇa utkramiṣyan yathā mahāsuhayaḥ saindhavaḥ paḍvīśaśaṅkhūnt saṃvṛhed evaṃ haivemān prāṇānt saṃvavarha /
analyzed: atha ha prāṇaḥ utkramiṣyan yathā mahā su hayaḥ saindhavaḥ paḍvīśa śaṅkhūn saṃvṛhet evam ha eva imān prāṇān saṃvavarha
translated: Then, when the vital breath was about to depart, just as a great swift Sindhu horse would toss about its fetters and halters, so it tossed about these vital breaths.

analyzed: te ha ūcuḥ mā bhagavaḥ utkramīḥ
translated: They said, 'Sir, do not depart.

original: na vai śakṣyāmas tvad ṛte jīvitum iti /
analyzed: na vai śakṣyāmaḥ tvat ṛte jīvitum iti
translated: We will not be able to live without you.'

analyzed: tasya u me balim kuruta iti
translated: 'Make me an offering.'

analyzed: tathā iti
translated: 'So be it.'

original: sā ha vāg uvāca yad vā ahaṃ vasiṣṭhāsmi tvaṃ tad vasiṣṭho 'sīti /🔽yad vā ahaṃ pratiṣṭhāsmi tvaṃ tat pratiṣṭho 'sīti cakṣuḥ /
analyzed: sā ha vāc uvāca yat vai aham vasiṣṭhā asmi tvam tat vasiṣṭha u si iti  yat vai aham pratiṣṭhā asmi tvam tat pratiṣṭhā u si iti cakṣuḥ
translated: Then speech said, 'Whatever I am the best of, you are the best of that.'🔽'Whatever I am the foundation of, you are the foundation of that.' (It said to) the eye.

original: yad vā ahaṃ saṃpad asmi tvaṃ tat saṃpad asīti śrotram /
analyzed: yat vai aham saṃpad asmi tvam tat saṃpad asi iti śrotram
translated: 'Whatever I am the perfection of, you are the perfection of that.' (It said to) the ear.

original: yad vā aham āyatanam asmi tvaṃ tad āyatanam asīti manaḥ /
analyzed: yat vai aham āyatanam asmi tvam tat āyatanam asi iti manaḥ
translated: 'Whatever I am the abode of, you are the abode of that.' (It said to) the mind.

original: yad vā ahaṃ prajātir asmi tvaṃ tat prajātir asīti retaḥ /
analyzed: yat vai aham prajātiḥ asmi tvam tat prajātiḥ asi iti retaḥ
translated: Or, 'I am procreation, you are procreation,' is seed.

original: tasyo me kim annaṃ kiṃ vāsa iti /
analyzed: tasya u me kim annam kim vāsaḥ iti
translated: 'What is my food, what my clothing?'

original: yad idaṃ kiñcā śvabhya ā kṛmibhya ā kīṭapataṅgebhyas tat te 'nnam /
analyzed: yat idam kiñca śvabhyaḥ ā kṛmibhyaḥ ā kīṭa pataṅgebhyaḥ tat te nnam
translated: 'Whatever there is here for dogs, for worms, for insects and locusts, that is your food.

analyzed: āpaḥ vāsaḥ iti
translated: Water is your clothing.'

original: na ha vā asyānannaṃ jagdhaṃ bhavati nānannaṃ pratigṛhītaṃ ya evam etad anasyānnaṃ veda /
analyzed: na ha vai asya an annam jagdham bhavati na an annam pratigṛhītam yaḥ evam etat an asya annam veda
translated: For him who knows thus the food of Anan, there is nothing eaten that is not food, nothing accepted that is not food.

original: tad vidvāṃsaḥ śrotriyā aśiṣyanta ācāmanty aśitvācāmanti /
analyzed: tat vidvāṃsaḥ śrotriyāḥ a śiṣyantaḥ ācāmanti aśitvā ācāmanti
translated: Knowing this, the learned Brahmins, when they are about to eat, sip water, and after eating, they sip water.

original: etam eva tad annam anagnaṃ kurvanto manyante // / / //
analyzed: etam eva tat annam anagnam kurvantaḥ manyante
translated: They think that they make that food of Anan free from fire.

original: śvetaketur vā āruṇeyaḥ pancālānāṃ pariṣadam ājagāma /
analyzed: śvetaketuḥ vai āruṇeyaḥ pancālānām pariṣadam ājagāma
translated: Śvetaketu Āruṇeyi went to the assembly of the Pañcālas.

original: sa ājagāma jaivaliṃ pravāhaṇaṃ paricārayamāṇam /🔽tam udīkṣyābhyuvāda iti /
analyzed: saḥ ājagāma jaivalim pravāhaṇam paricārayamāṇam  tam udīkṣya abhyuvāda kumārāḥ iti
translated: He came to Jaibali Pravahaṇa while he was tending the cattle.🔽Having seen him, he addressed him, saying, 'So!'

analyzed: sa bho iti pratiśuśrāva
translated: He replied, 'So.'

analyzed: anuśiṣṭaḥ nu asi pitrā iti
translated: 'Have you been instructed by your father?'

analyzed: om iti ha uvāca
translated: 'Yes,' he said.

analyzed: vettha yathā imāḥ prajāḥ prayatyaḥ vipratipadyante iti
translated: 'Do you know how these creatures go forth?'

analyzed: na iti ha uvāca
translated: 'No,' he said.

analyzed: vetthaḥ yathā imam lokam punar āpadyante iti
translated: 'Do you know how this world returns?'

analyzed: na iti ha eva uvāca
translated: 'No,' he said.

original: vettho yathāsau loka evaṃ bahubhiḥ punaḥ punaḥ prayadbhir na iti /
analyzed: vetthaḥ yathā asau lokaḥ evam bahubhiḥ punar punar prayadbhiḥ na saṃpūryate iti
translated: Do you know how this world, even though many try again and again, is not reached?

analyzed: na iti ha eva uvāca
translated: He said, No.

original: vettho yatithyām āhutyāṃ hutāyām āpaḥ puruṣavāco bhūtvā samutthāya iti /
analyzed: vetthaḥ yatithyām āhutyām hutāyām āpaḥ puruṣa vācaḥ bhūtvā samutthāya vadantī iti
translated: Do you know how, when an oblation is offered, the waters rise up, becoming the speech of men?

analyzed: na iti ha eva uvāca
translated: He said, No.

original: vettho devayānasya vā pathaḥ pratipadaṃ pitṛyāṇasya vā /
analyzed: vetthaḥ deva yānasya vā pathaḥ pratipadam pitṛyāṇasya vā
translated: Do you know the first step of the path of the gods or of the path of the ancestors?

original: yat kṛtvā devayānaṃ vā panthānaṃ pratipadyante pitṛyāṇaṃ vā /
analyzed: yat kṛtvā deva yānam vā panthānam pratipadyante pitṛyāṇam vā
translated: By doing what do they enter the path of the gods or the path of the ancestors?

original: api hi na ṛṣer vacaḥ śrutaṃ
analyzed: api hi naḥ ṛṣeḥ vacaḥ śrutam
translated: For the sage's words have been heard:

original: dve sṛtī aśṛṇavaṃ pitṝṇām ahaṃ devānām uta martyānām /
analyzed: dve sṛtī aśṛṇavam pitṝṇām aham devānām uta martyānām
translated: I have heard of two paths of the ancestors, of the gods and of mortals.

original: tābhyām idaṃ viśvam ejat sameti yad antarā pitaraṃ mātaraṃ ceti /
analyzed: tābhyām idam viśvam ejat sameti yat antarā pitaram mātaram ca iti
translated: On these two this moving universe rests, whatever is between father and mother.

original: nāham ata ekaṃ cana vedeti hovāca // / / //
analyzed: na aham atas ekam cana veda iti ha uvāca
translated: He said, I know not even one of these.

analyzed: atha enam vasatyā upamantrayāṃ cakre
translated: Then Vasistha tried to persuade him.

analyzed: an ādṛtya vasatim kumāraḥ pradudrāva
translated: Disregarding Vasistha, the young man ran away.

analyzed: saḥ ājagāma pitaram
translated: He went to his father.

original: taṃ hovāca iti vāva kila no bhavān purānuśiṣṭān avoca iti /
analyzed: tam ha uvāca iti vāva kila naḥ bhavān purā anuśiṣṭān avocaḥ iti
translated: He said to him, It seems that you have indeed spoken to us as you were instructed before.

analyzed: katham sumedha iti
translated: How, O most wise one?

analyzed: pañca mā praśnān rājanyabandhuḥ aprākṣīt
translated: A Rājanya friend asked me five questions.

analyzed: tatas na ekam cana veda iti
translated: Then he does not know any of them.

analyzed: katame te iti
translated: Which are they?

analyzed: ime iti ha pratīkāni udājahāra
translated: He recited the symbols, 'These.'

original: sa hovāca tathā nas tvaṃ tata jānīthā yathā yad ahaṃ kiṃca veda sarvam ahaṃ tat tubham avocam /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca tathā naḥ tvam tata jānīthāḥ yathā yat aham kiṃca veda sarvam aham tat tubham avocam
translated: He said, 'You should know us thus, that whatever I know, I have told you all that.

original: prehi tu tatra /🔽pratītya brahmacaryaṃ vatsyāva iti /
analyzed: prehi tu tatra  pratītya brahmacaryam vatsyāvaḥ iti
translated: Go there.🔽Having gone, we will live the holy life depending on you.'

analyzed: bhavān eva gacchatu iti
translated: 'You go.'

original: sa ājagāma gautamo yatra pravāhaṇasya jaivaler āsa /🔽tasmā āsanam āhṛtyodakam āhārayāṃ cakāra /
analyzed: saḥ ājagāma gautamaḥ yatra pravāhaṇasya jaivaleḥ āsa  tasmai āsanam āhṛtya udakam āhārayāṃ cakāra
translated: Gautama went to where Pravahaṇa's son Jājali was.🔽He brought a seat and had water brought.

analyzed: atha ha asmai arghyam cakāra
translated: Then he offered him the guest-gift.

original: taṃ hovāca varaṃ bhagavate gautamāya dadma iti // / / //
analyzed: tam ha uvāca varam bhagavate gautamāya dadmaḥ iti
translated: He said, 'We give a boon to the revered Gautama.'

original: sa hovāca pratijñato ma eṣa varaḥ /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca pratijñataḥ me eṣa varaḥ
translated: He said, 'This boon is promised to me.

original: yāṃ tu kumārasyānte vācam abhāṣathās tāṃ me brūhīti // / / //
analyzed: yām tu kumārasya ante vācam abhāṣathāḥ tām me brūhi iti
translated: But tell me the words you spoke to the young man.'

original: sa hovāca daiveṣu vai gautama tad vareṣu /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca daiveṣu vai gautama tat vareṣu
translated: He said, 'Gautama, that is among the divine boons.

analyzed: mānuṣāṇām brūhi iti
translated: Speak of the human ones.'

original: sa hovāca vijñāyate hāstihiraṇyasyāpāttaṃ goaśvānāṃ dāsīnāṃ pravārāṇāṃ paridhānasya /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca vijñāyate ha astihiraṇyasya apāttam go aśvānām dāsīnām pravārāṇām paridhānasya
translated: He said, 'It is known that there is gold, cows, horses, female slaves, carriages, and garments that have not been taken.

original: mā no bhavān bahor anantasyāparyantasyābhyavadānyo bhūd iti /
analyzed: mā naḥ bhavān bahoḥ anantasya aparyantasya abhyavadānyaḥ bhūt iti
translated: Do not be a sacrificer of much, endless, boundless (to us).

analyzed: sa vai gautama tīrthena icchase iti
translated: He said, Gautama, I desire to come to you as a guest.

analyzed: upaimi aham bhavantam iti
translated: He said, I am coming to you, sirs.

analyzed: vācā ha sma eva pūrve upayanti
translated: In ancient times, they used to approach with speech.

analyzed: sa ha upāyana kīrtyā uvāsa
translated: He stayed there, being announced as a guest.

original: sa hovāca tathā nas tvam gautama māparādhās tava ca pitāmahāḥ /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca tathā naḥ tvam gautama mā aparādhāḥ tava ca pitāmahāḥ
translated: He said, Gautama, do not offend us or your ancestors

original: yatheyaṃ vidyetaḥ pūrvaṃ na kasmiṃś cana brāhmana uvāsa /
analyzed: yathā iyam vidyā itas pūrvam na kasmin cana brāhmane uvāsa
translated: in such a way that this knowledge has not dwelt in any brahmin before.

analyzed: tām tu aham tubhyam vakṣyāmi
translated: But I will tell it to you.

original: ko hi tvaivaṃ bruvantam arhati pratyākhyātum iti // / / //
analyzed: kaḥ hi tvā evam bruvantam arhati pratyākhyātum iti
translated: For who deserves to refuse one who speaks thus?

original: asau vai loko 'gnir gautama /🔽tasyāditya eva samit /
analyzed: asau vai lokaḥ gniḥ gautama  tasya ādityaḥ eva samidh
translated: He said, Gautama, this world is indeed the fire.

analyzed: raśmayaḥ dhūmaḥ  ahar arciḥ  diśaḥ ṅgārāḥ
translated: Its fuel is the sun.🔽Its smoke is the rays.🔽Its flame is the day.🔽Its embers are the directions.

analyzed: avāntara diśaḥ viṣphuliṅgāḥ
translated: Its sparks are the intermediate directions.

original: tasminn etasminn agnau devāḥ śraddhāṃ juhvati /
analyzed: tasmin etasmin agnau devāḥ śraddhām juhvati
translated: In this fire, the gods offer faith.

analyzed: tasyai āhutyai somaḥ rājā saṃbhavati
translated: From that oblation, King Soma is produced.

analyzed: parjanyaḥ vai agniḥ gautama
translated: Gautama, Parjanya is indeed the fire.

original: tasya saṃvatsara eva samit /🔽abhrāṇi dhūmaḥ /🔽vidyud arciḥ /
analyzed: tasya saṃvatsaraḥ eva samidh  abhrāṇi dhūmaḥ  vidyut arciḥ
translated: Its fuel is the year.🔽Its smoke is the clouds.🔽Its flame is lightning.

analyzed: aśaniḥ aṅgārāḥ
translated: Its embers are the thunderbolts.

analyzed: hrādunayaḥ viṣphuliṅgāḥ
translated: The sparks are the lightnings.

original: tasminn etasminn agnau devāḥ somaṃ rājānaṃ juhvati /
analyzed: tasmin etasmin agnau devāḥ somam rājānam juhvati
translated: In this fire the gods offer the king Soma.

analyzed: tasyai āhutyai vṛṣṭiḥ saṃbhavati
translated: From that oblation rain is produced.

analyzed: ayam vai lokaḥ gniḥ gautama
translated: Gautama, this world is the fire.

analyzed: tasya pṛthivī eva samidh
translated: Its fuel is the earth.

analyzed: agniḥ dhūmaḥ
translated: The smoke is the fire.

analyzed: rātriḥ arciḥ  candramāḥ aṅgārāḥ
translated: The flame is the night.🔽The embers are the moon.

analyzed: nakṣatrāṇi viṣphuliṅgāḥ
translated: The sparks are the stars.

original: tasminn etasminn agnau devā vṛṣṭiṃ juhvati /
analyzed: tasmin etasmin agnau devāḥ vṛṣṭim juhvati
translated: In this fire the gods offer rain.

analyzed: tasyāḥ āhutyāḥ annam saṃbhavati
translated: From that oblation food is produced.

original: puruṣo vā agnir gautama /🔽tasya vyāttam eva samit /
analyzed: puruṣaḥ vai agniḥ gautama  tasya vyāttam eva samidh
translated: Gautama, the man is the fire.🔽His mouth is the fuel.

analyzed: prāṇaḥ dhūmaḥ
translated: The smoke is the breath.

analyzed: vāc arciḥ  cakṣuḥ aṅgārāḥ
translated: The flame is the speech.🔽The embers are the eyes.

analyzed: śrotram viṣphuliṅgāḥ
translated: The sparks are the ears.

original: tasminn etasminn agnau devā annaṃ juhvati /
analyzed: tasmin etasmin agnau devāḥ annam juhvati
translated: In this fire the gods offer food.

analyzed: tasyai āhutyai retaḥ saṃbhavati
translated: From that oblation semen is produced.

original: yoṣā vā agnir gautama /🔽tasyā upastha eva samit /🔽lomāni dhūmaḥ /
analyzed: yoṣā vai agniḥ gautama  tasyāḥ upasthe eva samidh  lomāni dhūmaḥ
translated: Gautama, the woman is the fire.🔽Her vulva is the fuel.🔽The smoke is the hair.

analyzed: yoniḥ arciḥ
translated: The flame is the vagina.

analyzed: yat antar karoti te ṅgārāḥ
translated: What she does inside are the embers.

analyzed: abhinandāḥ viṣphuliṅgāḥ
translated: The satisfaction is the sparks.

original: tasminn etasminn agnau devā reto juhvati /
analyzed: tasmin etasmin agnau devāḥ retaḥ juhvati
translated: In this fire the gods offer semen.

analyzed: tasyai āhutyai puruṣaḥ saṃbhavati
translated: From that oblation, a person is produced.

analyzed: sa jīvati yāvat jīvati
translated: He lives as long as he lives.

analyzed: atha yadā mriyate
translated: Then when he dies...

analyzed: atha enam agnaye haranti
translated: Then they carry him to Agni.

analyzed: tasya agniḥ eva agniḥ bhavati
translated: His fire becomes the fire.

analyzed: samidh samidh  dhūmaḥ dhūmaḥ
translated: The kindling wood is the kindling wood.🔽The smoke is the smoke.

analyzed: arciḥ arciḥ  aṅgārāḥ aṅgārāḥ
translated: The flame is the flame.🔽The coals are the coals.

analyzed: viṣphuliṅgāḥ viṣphuliṅgāḥ
translated: The sparks are the sparks.

original: tasminn etasminn agnau devāḥ puruṣaṃ juhvati /
analyzed: tasmin etasmin agnau devāḥ puruṣam juhvati
translated: In that fire, the gods offer the person as an oblation.

analyzed: tasyai āhutyai puruṣaḥ bhāsvara varṇaḥ saṃbhavati
translated: From that oblation, a person of radiant complexion is produced...

original: te ya evam etad vidur ye cāmī araṇye śraddhāṃ satyam upāsate te 'rcir abhisaṃbhavanti /
analyzed: te ye evam etat viduḥ ye ca amī araṇye śraddhām satyam upāsate te rciḥ abhisaṃbhavanti
translated: Those who know this, and those in the forest who worship faith and truth, they attain the light.

analyzed: arciṣaḥ haḥ
translated: From the light, the day.

original: tam indra nirjahi garbheṇa sāvarāṃ saheti // / / //
analyzed: tam indra nirjahi garbheṇa sā avarām saha iti
translated: O Indra, drive it forth with the embryo, together with the after-birth.

original: jāte 'gnim upasamādhāyāṅka ādhāya kaṃse pṛṣadājyaṃ saṃnīya pṛṣadājyasyopaghātaṃ juhoti
analyzed: jāte agnim upasamādhāya aṅke ādhāya kaṃse pṛṣadājyam saṃnīya pṛṣadājyasya upaghātam juhoti
translated: When (the child) is born, he puts wood on the fire, takes it on his lap, pours out the speckled ghee into a bronze (vessel), and sacrifices of the speckled ghee with the formula,

analyzed: asmin sahasram puṣyāsam edhamānaḥ sve gṛhe
translated: May I prosper in this (house) a thousand years, waxing great in my own house.

original: asyopasandyāṃ mā chaitsīt prajayā ca paśubhiś ca svāhā /
analyzed: asya upasandyām mā chaitsīt prajayā ca paśubhiḥ ca svāhā
translated: May I not be deprived of the companionship of this (wife) through offspring and cattle, Svâhâ!

original: mayi prāṇāṃs tvayi manasā juhomi svāhā /
analyzed: mayi prāṇān tvayi manasā juhomi svāhā
translated: I offer the vital airs in thee, the mind in myself, Svâhâ!

original: yat karmaṇātyarīricam yad vā nyūnam ihākaram /
analyzed: yat karmaṇā atyarīricam yat vā nyūnam iha akaram
translated: Whatever I have done too much in the rite, or whatever I have done too little here,

original: agniṣṭat sviṣṭakṛd vidvān sviṣṭaṃ suhutaṃ karotu naḥ svāheti // / / //
analyzed: agniḥ tat sviṣṭakṛt vidvān su iṣṭam su hutam karotu naḥ svāhā iti
translated: may Agni, the all-knower, the well-sacrificed, make that well-sacrificed for us, Svâhâ!

original: athāsya dakṣiṇaṃ karṇam abhinidhāya vāg vāg iti triḥ /
analyzed: atha asya dakṣiṇam karṇam abhinidhāya vāc vāc iti tris
translated: Then, having placed (the child) on his right ear, he murmurs three times, Speech, speech!

original: atha dadhi madhu ghṛtaṃ saṃnīyānantarhitena jātarūpeṇa prāśayati /
analyzed: atha dadhi madhu ghṛtam saṃnīya an antarhitena jātarūpeṇa prāśayati
translated: Then, having mixed together curds, honey, and ghee, he makes him eat it with gold that has not been melted.

original: bhūs te dadhāmi bhuvas te dadhāmi svas te dadhāmi bhūr bhuvaḥ svaḥ sarvaṃ tvayi dadhāmīti // / / //
analyzed: bhūḥ te dadhāmi bhuvaḥ te dadhāmi svar te dadhāmi bhūḥ bhuvaḥ svar sarvam tvayi dadhāmi iti
translated: He says: I place Bhūr in you, I place Bhuvaḥ in you, I place Svaḥ in you. I place everything in you, Bhūr Bhuvaḥ Svaḥ.

analyzed: atha asya nāma karoti vedaḥ si iti
translated: Then he gives him a name, saying, You are Veda.

original: tad asyaitad guhyam eva nāma bhavati // / / //
analyzed: tat asya etat guhyam eva nāma bhavati
translated: That becomes his secret name.

original: athainaṃ mātre pradāya stanaṃ prayacchati yas te stanaḥ śaśayo yo mayobhūr yo ratnadhā vasuvid yaḥ sudatraḥ /
analyzed: atha enam mātre pradāya stanam prayacchati yaḥ te stanaḥ śaśayaḥ yaḥ mayobhūḥ yaḥ ratna dhāḥ vasu vid yaḥ su datraḥ
translated: Then, having given him to his mother, he gives him her breast to suck, saying, The breast of yours that is tender, that is soothing, that gives jewels, that gives wealth, that is bountiful,

original: yena viśvā puṣyasi vāryāṇi sarasvati tam iha dhātave kar iti // / / //
analyzed: yena viśvā puṣyasi vāryāṇi sarasvati tam iha dhātave kaḥ iti
translated: By which, O Sarasvatī, you nourish all valuable things, I give it to you to suckle him.

original: athāsya mātaram abhimantrayate ilāsi maitrāvaruṇī vīre vīram ajījanat /
analyzed: atha asya mātaram abhimantrayate  ilā asi maitrāvaruṇī vīre vīram ajījanat
translated: Then he recites over his mother, You are the earth, born of Mitra and Varuṇa, who has given birth to a hero.

original: sā tvaṃ vīravatī bhava yāsmān vīravato 'karad iti /
analyzed: sā tvam vīravatī bhava yā asmān vīravataḥ karat iti
translated: Be you who are rich in heroes, who has made us rich in heroes.

original: taṃ vā etam āhuḥ atipitā batābhūḥ /
analyzed: tam vai etam āhuḥ atipitā bata abhūḥ
